story:
About

Hi guys, my name is Perie Wolford and I’m an LGBT author.

I need a little help covering editing expenses for my new gay novel, Lights. Lights is a story about underwater UFOs and boy on boy romance.

What I Need

I need $500 to cover the editing expenses.

Even though I am a published author and I have a couple books on sale, the profit is not nearly enought to cover all of the expenses that go into self-publishing.

What You Will Get

I will be giving away my other books and audiobooks.

And of course you will receive a free copy of Lights, when it's ready.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't donate, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign on FB and twitter! That would help greatly!

Thank you! For more information about me and my books visit my website periewolford.com

story:
Adam Burke of Little Village Mag covered the second photo shoot in October 2014

Help turn the Guarded project into a photography book!

Hi! I'm Taylor and I recently graduated from the University of Iowa. In February of 2014, I and other classmates were talking about what we have on our keychains to protect ourselves from sexual assault. The women and feminine identifying people and I rattled off our go-to methods...rape whistles, keys between our fingers, mace...these were all standard. The men in the room were taken aback that we even needed to think about this. Then, I knew that I had to visually represent this discrepancy in vulnerability. So, I created Guarded. This photo series depicts college age women holding what they use to protect themselves from assault. I saw this as an important critique on rape culture...how absurd it is for these people to be on guard in any situation when the perpetrator should not be committing the crime.                         

 

Taylor (left) and KT's Guarded portraits along with a sample of some other photographs from 2014.

In May of 2015 (my last few days of college...the craziest week of my life!), Guarded went viral. The story was picked up by HelloGiggles (and was shared by Zooey Deschanel!), then the Huffington Post, Mic.com, aplus.com, and Buzzfeed. I did interviews with local  stations (KWWL, KCRG, The Daily Iowan, and Iowa Public Radio) and my project was published by outlets such as the Des Moines Register and USA Today, The BTN and Vanity Fair Italy. It was truly hitting me...these photographs resonated with people. Even more importantly, I was receiving emails from women all over the world telling me that my project spoke to their stories. This was huge. At this point, I knew I had to keep the project going to tell more stories and speak to more experiences.


I am thrilled to once again team up with KT Hawbaker-Krohn! After our successful two person show Looker, we're at it again! We will be hitting the road to travel to other college campuses. I'll take more photographs for the Guarded series and she will write an accompanying essay detailing the experience. These photos and words will be compiled into a photography book published by the critically acclaimed powerHouse Books in Brooklyn, NY. We are both so eager to get this important message across in such a meaningful and impressive format!

But we need your help

We cannot wait to hit the road and tell these stories through words and photographs in a beautiful book. But we need your help. Unfortunately, art projects usually require money. Sometimes a lot of money. Here's a breakdown of what we need funding for.

  • Equipment. I will need to purchase a portable light kit to use for indoor portraits...this is vital to keep the aesthetics consistent from place to place. 
  • Consultation from a lawyer. We'll need help with photo release forms and advice on other issues we might run into!
  • Travel. Transportation costs, bus tickets, hotels, gas, food...
  • Funding for shipping and producing the perks!
  • Printing and framing the photographs taken during these trips for use in a  potential future exhibition. 
  • Compensating KT for her time tagging along with me!
This funding goal has built with the "what ifs" in mind. If we do not use all of the money for the project or if we exceed our goal, the difference will be donated to the sexual assault resource centers of the various colleges we visit.


The impact!

Your donation funds two ambitious, talented, and passionate feminist artists complete good work that makes a positive impact on the world. That in and of itself is a great idea to be proud of promoting!

The Guarded Project has a successful track record...and I want to keep the consistency of the images. The series has gained amazing momentum of support from all across the world...and having a physical book of the portraits and stories can pair a face to this pressing issue. Your donation will help make this happen and confront rape culture on two levels. First, the travel aspect fosters community on campuses and can create a venue for discussion and support while the photographs are taken. The publication of the book pushes this even further by bringing more awareness to this worldwide problem and validating the experiences and stories told through the portraits and words. This book will be possible because of you.


Both KT and I are extremely passionate about this cause and will create the essay and photographs with respect and empathy. Our number one priority is creating a work of art in a way that honors the people who have shared their words and likeness with us...and this in turn will be a thought provoking and beautiful publication.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, things can go wrong. We have some schools to travel to lined up, but anything can happen...be it travel mishaps or the weather.

We are doing our best to cover all of our bases, be it from backing up the photos to multiple devices or expanding our network of contacts. We will always have a "plan b" and are determined to make this project happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not feel comfortable making a donation or are not able to do so at this time but would like to show your support, please spread the word! Posting the campaign on your social media pages would help tremendously. And make sure to like Taylor Yocom Art on Facebook to keep up with the progress!

story:
Noob Spearo's 99 Tips to Get Better At Spearfishing

Turbo and I have been interviewing the world's best spearo's for 4 years and sharing those interviews free on the Noob Spearo podcast. Find these interviews free at

  • iOS Noob Spearo Podcast - spearfishing interviews right from your phone
  • Android Noob Spearo Podcast - spearfishing interviews right from your phone
  • noobspearo.com the home of spearfishing tips, advice and wisdom

If you would like to learn more us check out noobspearo.com/about

What We Need & What You Get

Ok so we ran this project successfully on Kickstarter and so the first print run is paid for. Basically we are continuing this campaign on Indiegogo to allow people who missed out to secure a copy before they arrive in spearfishing retailers.

The Impact

By purchasing a copy of 99 Tips To Get Better At Spearfishing you are directly supporting the Noob Spearo Podcast and our future plans to move more into video! Noob Spearo's vision is pretty straight forward.

1. We aim to help reduce spearfishing deaths

2. We aim to help in the development of the next generation of environmentally aware spearo’s

3. We aim to help spearfishing grow as a lifestyle sport, by developing community and relationships with spearo’s all over the world.

4. We aim to help our readers shoot more fish and have fun

 

Get involved in the Noob Spearo Community on Facebook here!

Big thanks to these sponsors for getting on board!

  • Penetrator Fins
  • Mannysub
  • Speared Apparel
  • Spearing Magazine
  • Spear & Fish Downunder
  • Australian Spearfishing Academy
  • Ninepin Wetsuits
  • Immersion Freediving
  • HECS Aquatic
  • Everything Spearfishing
  • Block Island Saltworks

story:
seeds

Haley is a writer who lives in Brooklyn. Sam is an illustrator who lives in San Francisco. Two coasts apart, we found each other online, and somehow had the same story to tell. Through artistic instinct and and an immediate trust, over the past two years we have created a collaborative anthology. The final step of our creative melding is to share it all with you. 

To maintain the artistic heart of our book, we are self-publishing. As young women in our respective industries, we want to shatter the expectation that someone else gets to decide that our creativity is worthy of sharing. This feat comes with exciting challenges, and that's why we are launching this campaign.

Combining storytelling illustration with raw, unfiltered poetry, Write Like Prayers is a bedtime story for your twenties.

We have two goals:

1. Publish 200 copies of our book.

2. Take that book on a tour throughout the United States.

roots

$7,000 will make our goals a reality. Here's the breakdown of where that money is going:

- $4,000 to print 200 books. Because Sam's artwork is essential to Haley's narrative, our vision includes fine quality printing.

- $3,000 to fund the Write Like Prayers book tour, coming to a city near you June 2018. Expenses include travel, housing, and merchandise. 

growth

This book doesn't hide under the covers. Write Like Prayers depicts a universal vulnerability, weaving together stories of loss, heartbreak, depression, sexual assault, radical transformation, and hope.  The next step in Write Like Prayers' journey is to share this story with the world, championing unapologetic truth telling. It is our promise that you are not alone. 

We made this book with our hands, and now it is time to put it in yours.

story:
Short Summary

Our mission is to support and make possible awesome pilgrimages around the world. Through support like yours, we have been able to help make pilgrimages around the world to places like Canada, Austria, Germany, and Italy. Every sponsor who donates will be recorded and prayed for especially at the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela upon completion of the trek. 

Trips like this are amazing, once-in-a-lifteime opportunities.  Your donations makes that possible.

 "I am the vine; you are the branches. If a man remains in me and I in him, he will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing" (John 15:5).  

Without your support, we can do nothing!

 

What We Need

What we need is finanicial support for airfare, camping supplies, and hostel fares.

The Impact

Tens of thousands of Christian pilgrims and many other travellers set out each year from their front doorstep, or popular starting points across Europe, to make their way to Santiago de Compostela. Most travel by foot, some by bicycle, and a few travel as some of their medieval counterparts did, on horseback or by donkey. 

In addition to people undertaking a religious pilgrimage, the majority are travellers and hikers who walk the route for non-religious reasons: travel, sport, or simply the challenge of weeks of walking in a foreign land. Also, many consider the experience a spiritual adventure to remove themselves from the bustle of modern life. It acts as a retreat for many modern "pilgrims". The average pilgrimage for the Camino takes a month and requires the travelers to cover on foot over 800km to 1500 km or roughly 500 to 933 miles. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

 

Check out our facebook page at: http://www.facebook.com/pages/A-Pilgrims-Way-A-journey-on-the-Compostela/138742859567762?sk=info

Help usto get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

And most of all, pray for us!.

story:
Here's The Situation

I am a live-in nanny for two small children. I live in an apartment complex with my boss/best friend. She informed the apartment complex that I lived here, and offered to put me on the lease; the apartment complex assured her that it wasn't necessary. 

Now they are claiming the conversation never happened and are evicting me because I'm not on the lease.

  • I was given no warning about this whatsoever
  • I work for room and board, therefore I do not have much in the way of actual cash
  • I have to be out by Thursday, July 25

What I Need & What You Get

I've tallied up the costs that I would incur finding and paying for a deposit/first month's rent on an apartment, plus food and other expenses. It totals up to about $3000. 

  • I need around $3000. If 100 people donate $30, I'll be at goal. 
  • This money will be used to help me get a first month's rent/deposit taken care of, along with food and clothing expenses.
  • As a thank you, I will write fiction for just about anything. (With a few exceptions.)

 

What This Is

This is helping me maintain my independence. This is keeping me on my feet while I manage a creative coaching business. This is helping me resolve an emergency. This is a kindness that I will ALWAYS be thankful for. 

 This is a chance for you to get a story written exactly to your specifications.

Here are some samples of my work. 

The Caveats

There are a small list of things I won't write/don't have enough knowledge to write. Those include: 

  • noncon/dubcon
  • furry (I don't know much about this, sorry!)
  • anything in which pain is glorified
  • anything involving excessive bodily substances

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, no worries! Here are some ways you can help me out:

  • Reblog this on your Tumblr. 
  • Tell your friends about this! 
  • Remember to use indiegogo's share tools!

story:
The Pitch 

     

When life throws you a curve ball, do you hit it or whiff? I Swallowed the Camel is a God-inspired writing in which I share insights on lessons I've learned the hard way, by living through them. Sometimes I've singled, sometimes a home run, and many times I struckout. 

I had no intention of writing a book in 2012. However, through a series of events I had an aha moment when the Holy Spirit laid it all out, complete with title. I Swallowed the Camel comes from Matthew 23:24 when Jesus, while chastising the Pharisees for having their priorities misaligned, says "You blind guides, straining out a gnat and swallowing a camel!"

So I started writing and over eight months, it all came together. It came in spurts and after dry spells. If I ever felt it becoming forced, I backed off praying for God to get me out of the way. Once, after about six-weeks of not writing, I awoke at two in the morning and ten hours later had written one of the lessons.

Each chapter begins with a quote, some well-known, some you may be hearing for the first time. That is followed by a Bible verse relating to the quote. The rest of the lesson features my experiences (good and bad), thoughts, insights, and perhaps a little inspiration.

Here's a sample from the first few paragraphs of one of the chapters:

Fail Forward

   “Don’t look back.  Something might be gaining on you.” ~ Satchel Paige

   But Jesus said to him, “No one, after putting his hand to the plow and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.” Luke 9:62 (NKJV)

   People tend to dwell on the past; somehow believing that thinking about it and beating ourselves up over it will change it.  We mull over would’ve, could’ve and should’ve thoughts to the point of paralyzation.  

   I rued past failures and missed opportunities, crippling me and keeping me from moving forward.  Focusing on the past steals our today and dooms our tomorrow.

   Yes, we need to learn from the past but understand that it does not dictate the future.  Or as Anthony Robbins is fond of saying, “The past does not equal the future.”  This, however, does not apply to loan officers at your bank!

   Long before Satchel Paige admonished us not to look back, the apostle Paul became the cornerstone of moving ahead when, in his letter to the Philippians, he writes “but one thing I do; forgetting what lies behind and reaching forward to what lies ahead, I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.” (Phil 3:13-14) 

   Paul is not telling us to develop amnesia.  He clearly remembers the day on the road to Damascus when he saw the light.  There is great value in lessons learned from experience.  However, he heeds us not to let life’s failures, sin, and regrets enslave us to the past and stifle the healing process from such hurts and painful memories.

------------------------------------

While it is a good read for anyone, the focus of the book is not directed at nonbelievers or the person on your street living fully in God's will. It is for those of us living on the bridge of conflict between pleasing God and surviving and prospering in the world.  This is not a book about me, it's about how God has molded me as the potter molds his clay and how He can lead you to fulfill the unique plans He has for you - Jeremiah 29:11. Each lesson will fall upon you dependent on the condition of personal relationship with God. 

 

The Fund

      

The funding is all about pre-sales and the ability to execute a successful launch. The book is 99% complete, just some finetooth editing, dotting the i's and crossing the t's, followed by the pruduction cycle. A friend recommended a few sites such this to get the project funded and the book out into the marketplace. I selected Indiegogo for a variety of reasons.

Foremost is the safe way for you to support the project, receive a personal copy of the book at a discount and additional bonuses. 

The $4500 funding goal is based on printing, distribution and marketing budgets. With an average pledge of $15, a total of 300 contributors would accomplish the goal. All monies received over and above the funding goal will be directed to further marketing efforts such as book signings, advertising and additional printing.

All copies distributed from funding pledges will be personally signed and  hardbacks will be signed and numbered. See the rewards section for specifics.

 

The Impact  

“Have you ever wondered if the Bible is relevant today? I have and then I read, I Swallowed the Camel. Chet Wright brings many of the Bibles basic teaching to life in the context of his own life and within the context of some of the greatest quotes of modern day. Never preachy, Chet’s humble style, sharp wit and succinct writing style, is guaranteed to touch your heart and make you think about your relationship with God long after the last page is turned.”
~ Lowell Amos, Author and Songwriter
 
 
           

 

"Reading Chet's book, I felt like I was being exposed to a treasure trove of riches. The amazing thing was, they were the riches that had been deposited and stored up in his soul -- diamonds refined by years of true living. I'm thrilled that they are now being shared with others...for a greater good and for the glory of God!!"  ~ Christian Counselor Abbey Foard

My hope is for everyone to be challenged and in doing so, know yourself and God better and have a stronger personal relationship with God than before you opened the book. 

 

Taking the Next Step

         
 
If you would like a copy of the book, select your pledge.

The retail price on the books are proposed to be $15.95 (paperback) and $24.95 (hardback). Hardbacks in first printing will be numbered. The eBook is a $4 value and the poster - priceless!

Author! Author! 

I guess Dan Fogelberg summed it up best in his song Nether Lands - 

I`ve seen the bottom and I`ve been on top, but mostly I`ve lived in
between...

Blessed with wonderful parents who raised me in South Bend, Indiana, I enjoyed a blissful childhood and graduated from Miami University, not to be confused with the 'U' in Florida. I was married for 24 years and my ex is the best friend I have today. God gave us the gift of our son, Anthony, of whom we are quite proud. He and his wife, Nancy, are nearby with the grandchildren, Vince and Alice.

The path my life has traveled has taken me through various and sundry places with all the peaks and valleys one experiences in life.

I thank God for all the places I've been because it has bought me to the place where the most important aspect of life is my relationship with Him. And you know what? Now all my relationships are stronger than they have ever been. With my ex, with my son and his wife, my grandchildren, family and friends.

You'll read about some of the things I've done if you buy the book. But they are just things and the most important things in life aren't things. May God bless.

story_txt:
The Pitch 
     

When life throws you a curve ball, do you hit it or whiff? I Swallowed the Camel is a God-inspired writing in which I share insights on lessons I've learned the hard way, by living through them. Sometimes I've singled, sometimes a home run, and many times I struckout. 
I had no intention of writing a book in 2012. However, through a series of events I had an aha moment when the Holy Spirit laid it all out, complete with title. I Swallowed the Camel comes from Matthew 23:24 when Jesus, while chastising the Pharisees for having their priorities misaligned, says "You blind guides, straining out a gnat and swallowing a camel!"
So I started writing and over eight months, it all came together. It came in spurts and after dry spells. If I ever felt it becoming forced, I backed off praying for God to get me out of the way. Once, after about six-weeks of not writing, I awoke at two in the morning and ten hours later had written one of the lessons.
Each chapter begins with a quote, some well-known, some you may be hearing for the first time. That is followed by a Bible verse relating to the quote. The rest of the lesson features my experiences (good and bad), thoughts, insights, and perhaps a little inspiration.
Here's a sample from the first few paragraphs of one of the chapters:
Fail Forward
   “Don’t look back.  Something might be gaining on you.” ~ Satchel Paige
   But Jesus said to him, “No one, after putting his hand to the plow and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.” Luke 9:62 (NKJV)
   People tend to dwell on the past; somehow believing that thinking about it and beating ourselves up over it will change it.  We mull over would’ve, could’ve and should’ve thoughts to the point of paralyzation.  
   I rued past failures and missed opportunities, crippling me and keeping me from moving forward.  Focusing on the past steals our today and dooms our tomorrow.
   Yes, we need to learn from the past but understand that it does not dictate the future.  Or as Anthony Robbins is fond of saying, “The past does not equal the future.”  This, however, does not apply to loan officers at your bank!
   Long before Satchel Paige admonished us not to look back, the apostle Paul became the cornerstone of moving ahead when, in his letter to the Philippians, he writes “but one thing I do; forgetting what lies behind and reaching forward to what lies ahead, I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.” (Phil 3:13-14)  
   Paul is not telling us to develop amnesia.  He clearly remembers the day on the road to Damascus when he saw the light.  There is great value in lessons learned from experience.  However, he heeds us not to let life’s failures, sin, and regrets enslave us to the past and stifle the healing process from such hurts and painful memories.
------------------------------------
While it is a good read for anyone, the focus of the book is not directed at nonbelievers or the person on your street living fully in God's will. It is for those of us living on the bridge of conflict between pleasing God and surviving and prospering in the world.  This is not a book about me, it's about how God has molded me as the potter molds his clay and how He can lead you to fulfill the unique plans He has for you - Jeremiah 29:11. Each lesson will fall upon you dependent on the condition of personal relationship with God. 
 
The Fund


      



The funding is all about pre-sales and the ability to execute a successful launch. The book is 99% complete, just some finetooth editing, dotting the i's and crossing the t's, followed by the pruduction cycle. A friend recommended a few sites such this to get the project funded and the book out into the marketplace. I selected Indiegogo for a variety of reasons.


Foremost is the safe way for you to support the project, receive a personal copy of the book at a discount and additional bonuses. 
The $4500 funding goal is based on printing, distribution and marketing budgets. With an average pledge of $15, a total of 300 contributors would accomplish the goal. All monies received over and above the funding goal will be directed to further marketing efforts such as book signings, advertising and additional printing.
All copies distributed from funding pledges will be personally signed and  hardbacks will be signed and numbered. See the rewards section for specifics.
 


The Impact  


“Have you ever wondered if the Bible is relevant today? I have and then I read, I Swallowed the Camel. Chet Wright brings many of the Bibles basic teaching to life in the context of his own life and within the context of some of the greatest quotes of modern day. Never preachy, Chet’s humble style, sharp wit and succinct writing style, is guaranteed to touch your heart and make you think about your relationship with God long after the last page is turned.”~ Lowell Amos, Author and Songwriter
 
 
            



 
"Reading Chet's book, I felt like I was being exposed to a treasure trove of riches. The amazing thing was, they were the riches that had been deposited and stored up in his soul -- diamonds refined by years of true living. I'm thrilled that they are now being shared with others...for a greater good and for the glory of God!!"  ~ Christian Counselor Abbey Foard
My hope is for everyone to be challenged and in doing so, know yourself and God better and have a stronger personal relationship with God than before you opened the book.

story:
The Goal 

Hey I'm Casey Higgins (professionally) AKA Casey Clougherty (in reality).  First of all I want to thank you with all my heart for reading this!  My goal is to inspire guitar players with my books and to record beautiful music for you.    I'm really excited about releasing these books!  They are the first 2 installments of the Guitar Mechanics Series, Foundation/Rudiments, and Soloing.  After decades of searching for an instructional book that has everything in one place and teaches you fundamental things like how to figure out what key you're in or how to learn a song, I gave up and wrote one myself.  What started out as an exercise to see how much I knew about the guitar turned into a consolidation of almost my entire music library!  I honestly believe these books will help guitarists get to the next level and fill a huge gap in guitar education.  My hope is that they will inspire you to grow as an artist and help you get your music out into the world.  

  In appreciation of you I will be giving away my favorite tracks from the vault for free!  Stay tuned for more info and go here for a sample of my music:  http://soundcloud.com/casey-higgins  

 

The Plan

 I am asking for money to update my recording software so I can record examples for my ebook, a camera to record video examples, and funds to fix/update my equipment so I at least sound pretty.  Can't do anything about the face, sorry…  I also need to print books as well as pay for shipping to send the books to you, my sponsors, and colleagues for promotion.  If I don't get to my goal of $4000, the money I do get will go to making you your gifts and making the book into an ebook.  I'll just cut the promotional budget.    

 

What I Hope To Accomplish

 -My main goal is to inspire aspiring guitarists and make it easier for them to improve and find their own voice on the instrument. 

-I want to complete my home studio and rig so I can start recording video and audio examples for the ebooks. 

-I need to get my books and music to Curt Mangan Strings, whom I have an endorsement deal with. 

-I want to get my books and music online and in stores.  I already have a few stores interested!

In addition, this will allow me to finish an album for The Casey Higgins Band (real original name right?)

 


 What Sets These Books Apart 

Book I: Foundation/Rudiments

 -Multiple ways to figure out what key you're in

-Multiple ways to tune your guitar

 -Learn a fast and efficient way to learn songs 

-Gain better technique -Learn how to name chords 

-Tips to memorize the fretboard 

-Learn patterns on the guitar

 -Make the harmonization of scales easier and learn how to use this info  

 

Book II: Soloing 

-This is the only book that shows you more than one organization of scales 

-Learn tons of pentatonic tricks!

 -Arpeggio tricks

 -Learn my deadliest licks that get the chicks or dudes (my lawyer says I can't guarantee this) 

-Learn to solo over blues changes 

-Tips and strategies to visualize the fretboard and move between positions

 -Learn an easier way to sweep pick 

-Learn to build speed and impress your friends!

 -It also features ideas for soloing to get you out of a rut

  Both books feature a recommended reading section of books that have been very influential to me and in combination with my books will give you a more rounded education on the guitar.  Stuff like reading notation if you're into that sort of thing. 

 

  About me

 I've had an exciting career which started when I was 1 year old and got my first guitar which was bigger than me!  By 7 I started taking guitar lessons and had my first 2 gigs/recitals.  In junior high I jammed with and learned a ton from Erick Walls who now plays with Mary J. Blige.    

My 18th year was an amazing one where I got to play at the Bluebird Cafe in Nashville and was featured on NPR around the world.  It was unreal hearing myself on the radio and that was probably the second most awesome thing that has ever happened to me besides getting an endorsement deal with Curt Mangan Strings in 2007.    

In 2000 I was accepted to the Appalachian State University School of Music on the condition that I learn how to read music within 2 months.  Somehow I accomplished this goal and became the youngest member of 1st chair freshmen year and sophomore year I became the youngest section leader. 

The major turning point and best year of my life was 2003 when I attended the Atlanta Institute of Music.  It was amazing being around such cool and talented players!  I learned a ton and made lots of life-long friends.  I was also incredibly surprised that they asked me to headline the graduation concert!  While in Atlanta I jammed with members of Black Cherry (Outcast's backing band), I did a clinic with Sean O'Rourke (one of my favorite drummers!), started a summer camp called Rock U and I opened for Flock of Seagulls.  Yea they played that song… Twice!  

Next I moved to Savannah in 2007 and joined Hitman and the Blues Boys.  That same year we won best blues band from Connect Magazine!  The real thrill came when I got to play with Jack Sherman from the Red Hot Chili Peppers!  He could say more with 5 notes than I could with 20 and I learned a lot from him.  He also played with some guy named Bob Dylan. 

  From there things went downhill…  I tore three tendons in my left hand index finger and was diagnosed with TMJ disorder and chronic pain.  I have been struggling with chronic pain ever since, but now I have a great support system, awesome dog and I know how to better deal with it.  All thru this music has been my saving grace giving me hope and courage to keep following my dreams.  I guess that's what these books are really about, my humble attempt to inspire others to get better at guitar which I hope will make them feel better about themselves.  You're not just getting a book but a friend who wants you to succeed!    

Thanks again and please tell your friends and fellow guitarists!  Share on Facebook and friend me!

story:
SHOOTING SEX

I’m Erika Lust (www.erikalust.com), author and erotic filmmaker. I’m here to ask you for help to translate my book “Cómo rodar sexo” from Spanish to English. I’m very excited to present this unique book, based on my long experience of shooting indie adult cinema.

Back when I was in the University, even though I was studying, thinking and reading about porn, I didn’t actually like any of the porn that I saw, and I wanted to know: where was my lifestyle, my values, my sexuality? While I’d always thought of myself as sexually liberal and open to porn as an idea, what I saw in practice was just plain offensive. For that reason I decided to show my own vision of sexuality and I started my own production company. With this book about how to shoot sex, I want to help everyone to create his or her personal vision of sex.

I think of porn as a tool for excitement, education, and pleasure. It’s important that a new wave of adult cinema is produced and directed in a organic way, we’re holistic creatures – details, situations, fantasies, hints, and scenarios arouse us. And this book will reinforce this trend.

 

The original manuscript is in Spanish, and by contributing to this campaign you would be helping to translate it into English. SHOOTING SEX features over 120 pages of writing and pictures, my personal view and experience about how I’ve started in the adult industry and how I’ve started to create my own erotic movies. It’s a guide that follows the whole creative process, from the idea, the preproduction, the set, the postproduction, distribution and promotion of a movie. The book features the possible human and technical problems, examples and different possibilities about recording sex, even ethical and privacy problems.

SHOOTING SEX is going to be released for free in digital format (PDF and EPUB) in my website www.erikalust.com. In my site you can also have free access to some of my previous books, like Porno Para Mujeres, or a couple of my short movies like Room 33 and Handcuffs.

 

THE PROJECT

This guide is for those who are interested in the art of shooting sex or for those who really want to get further and make a professional erotic movie.

You will learn about:

 

  • How to write an erotic script
  • Financing
  • Casting
  • Preproduction and production tips
  • How to organize the shooting
  • How to solve last minute problems
  • Avoiding porn cliches
  • Distribution on the Digital Era
  • How to submit your film to Festivals

 

There are many guides about how to make movies, but this is your guide about how to make a sex movie.

 

ABOUT ERIKA LUST

“Porn is a huge part of the culture we’re living in. Women can not just ignore porn, we have to participate and discuss this very influential genre”

Erika Lust, born in Stockholm, Sweden, in 1977, is an erotic independent filmmaker, author, and founder of Erika Lust Films. After graduating from Lund University with a degree in Political Science with a focus on Feminism, Lust moved to Barcelona, where her production company was established in 2005. She has directed four award-winning erotic films - Five Hot Stories for Her, Barcelona Sex Project, Life Love Lust, and Cabaret Desire, as well as some shorts – and is currently working on her fifth. Her written works include Good Porn: a Woman’s Guide, The Erotic Bible to Europe, Love Me Like You Hate Me and La Canción de Nora. Lust is committed to forging a new concept of sexual expression: pledging, in her own words, "to create new waves in adult cinema, to show all of the passion, intimacy, love and lust in sex: where the feminine viewpoint is vital, the aesthetic is a pleasure to all of the senses and those seeking an alternative to porn can find a home."

 

WHY YOUR SUPPORT IS IMPORTANT/WHERE THE MONEY GOES

Our fundraising goal is to raise 1500 € to translate this eBook into English in order to reach a wider audience. I just need that exact amount of money to translate the book, we already have a budget from a translation agency.

Please help me by spreading the word out and making noise about Shooting Sex, contribute to an open and positive vision of sex.

If you can't afford to donate, please share this page with your friends on Facebook and Twitter, because that REALLY helps too!  You never know who might see it and decide to make a contribution! 

WHERE CAN I SEE THE eBook? In my personal website erikalust.com you will be able to download for free and enjoy it!

Thank you so much for your time and your support!

 Blessings,

Erika.

story:
We are Vici MacDonald and Tamar Yoseloff, the founders of Hercules Editions, an independent press specialising in chapbooks that combine innovative poetry and text with contemporary design and visual elements.

In February of this year, we launched a successful Indiegogo campaign for our second publication, Heart Archives, a family memento in sonnets and photographs by the acclaimed poet and translator, Sue Rose. With the help of our generous donors, we raised over £800, which went towards production and marketing. Baroness Julia Neuberger has said of the book that it is "evocative, painful and life-enhancing".

We are excited about our current project, a poem cycle by the award-winning writer Hannah Lowe, which charts the 1947 journey of the Ormonde, the first ship to carry immigrants from Jamaica to the UK. On board was the poet's father, R. Lowe, ready to start a new life in a new country. Hannah writes poignantly of his hopes and aspirations, of his fellow passengers, and the issues faced by immigrants arriving in Britain at the time. The poems are accompanied by unique personal and historical archives. Here is Hannah giving a brief description of her book and its background: 



We have launched this campaign not only to raise funds to produce this incredible book, but to invite our readers to be a part of the journey. We will be holding some very special events in the coming months, many in conjunction with the newly-opened Black Cultural Archives in Brixton. We also have some exciting offers for our backers, including an opportunity to have your name on our very own "passenger list" in the book, a chance to purchase the special edition (available only through this campaign) which will include an extra signed poem, and for our most generous donors, tea in the company of the author, who will be sharing some of the archival material that inspired the book.

Please note that if you would like to have your name in the book, you must sponsor the campaign by 18th October as the book will be going to press before the campaign ends. You will still be able to receive the special edition and to have tea with the author.

Please help us by supporting our work, or simply spreading the word. We are dedicated to providing new and exciting writing and great design, and we are grateful for your continuing interest in our projects and your generosity.

We are Vici MacDonald and Tamar Yoseloff, the founders of Hercules Editions, an independent press specialising in chapbooks that combine innovative poetry and text with contemporary design and visual elements. In February of this year, we launched a successful Indiegogo campaign for our second publication, Heart Archives, a family memento in sonnets and photographs by the acclaimed poet and translator, Sue Rose. With the help of our generous donors, we raised over £800, which went towards production and marketing. Baroness Julia Neuberger has said of the book that it is "evocative, painful and life-enhancing". We are excited about our current project, a poem cycle by the award-winning writer Hannah Lowe, which charts the 1947 journey of the Ormonde, the first ship to carry immigrants from Jamaica to the UK. On board was the poet's father, R. Lowe, ready to start a new life in a new country. Hannah writes poignantly of his hopes and aspirations, of his fellow passengers, and the issues faced by immigrants arriving in Britain at the time. The poems are accompanied by unique personal and historical archives. Here is Hannah giving a brief description of her book and its background: 

We have launched this campaign not only to raise funds to produce this incredible book, but to invite our readers to be a part of the journey. Short Summary

Hey there! 

I think you're awesome! 

Thanks for browsing my campaign! 

 

My name is Isaac Rayment - I've been directing videos and creating special effects and animating and working in theater and creating visual content for live events and concerts and awards galas and designing stages and a bunch of other fun stuff for the last ... o i dont know say 20 years or so! 

I've decided to finally pursue my writing! 

Here it is! My first publishing attempt! (and with your help success!)

It's a fun kids book (targeting the 3-8 year old wee ones) called "Has HUNGRY Been Fed?!" with a sing song rhymery that is both playful and infectious! 

Being my first publication - and being that I am a self starter! I decided to set up an independant publishing company to print and distribute the first draft of this book! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your contributions and preorders and perk purchases to finance the illustration of the book as well as the revenue to establish the business registration and ISBN registration to be properly distributed in book stores and libraries and to cover all the other expenses of printing and distributing this book!

You get the satisfaction of contributing to the development of an independent publishing company as well as share in the joy of participating in the pursuit of inspiring young imaginations around the world. 

 

 

The Impact

Without your participation - this wont happen, and i will scream to the heavens "has the world lost its ability to dream?!" with clenched fists and tears in a dischevveled slump.

But if you help out i will pump my fists in the air and yell "sweet!"  and my faith in humanity will be restored!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you dont want to buy the book (hey everyone has nieces and nephews) 

or invest in any of the other perk packages...

You can always buy some sweet merch at www.cafepress.com/hasHUNGRYbeenFED or just tell your friends about our campaign!

 

TIME IS SHORT! 

DONT DELAY!

INVEST TODAY!

(as in right now) 

 

cheers!

story:
About Us

Leapfrog Press is an independent literary publisher established in 1995. We have a diverse list that includes literary fiction and middle-grade fiction, as well as some nonfiction and the occasional poetry collection. Leapfrog is distributed by Consortium Book Sales & Distribution and sells through all chain, online, and independent retailers, as well as to libraries and educational markets.

Leapfrog’s mission is to seek out and publish fine literary works that are often overlooked by the larger presses. Leapfrog chooses its books based on literary merit rather than potential sales, with book sales covering approximately 70% of our operating budget. Grant funding and tax-deductible donations cover the rest.

Our Campaign

In October, our first young adult novel will be available: Lone Wolves by Native Alaskan author John Smelcer, which the late Ray Bradbury called "A beautiful and moving story of courage and love."

Lone Wolves is not only Leapfrog’s first YA novel; it is also our first hardcover book. We are printing simultaneous hardcover and trade paperback editions, and since this decision was made back in February, we have received more pre-orders from stores and libraries, of both editions, than our print budget can cover. With this campaign, we are raising funds to fill the unanticipated pre-orders and send more copies of this lovely book out into the world.

John Smelcer is the author of more than forty books. He is an Alaskan Native of the Ahtna tribe, and is now the last tribal member who reads and writes in Ahtna. In Lone Wolves, his fourth novel for teens, John introduces us to 16-year-old Deneena Yazzie, who is not like other teens in her village.

Lone Wolves is a thoughtful, realistic portrayal of the struggles of Native Alaskan teens as they feel the pull of modern culture against that of their families and their heritage, and the hopelessness to which this can lead. It is also a fine adventure tale, with a heroine who is in no way stereotypical.

"John Smelcer is Alaska’s modern-day Jack London." —W.P. Kinsella

Advance Praise for Lone Wolves

“Powerful, eloquent and fascinating, showcasing a vanishing way of life in rich detail.” —Kirkus

“Adept focus on coming of age and [an] illuminating glimpse of Native Alaskan cultures.”  —Horn Book

Smeler's work has a touch of the classical, combining good old-fashioned adventure and survival themes with heart-tugging moments of clarity and poignancy that recall Jean Craighead George's Julie of the Wolves." --Booklist

“A gifted storyteller with a unique perspective…. A breathlessly paced and thrilling ride for readers of all ages.” —Cambridge Book Review

“A vivid tale which draws the reader into the harsh, yet compelling, beauty of the North.” —Midwest Book Review, Reviewer’s Choice

Book Description

Deneena Yazzie isn’t like other 16-year-old girls in her village.

Her love of the woods and trail come from her grandfather, who teaches her their all-but-vanished Native Alaskan language and customs. While her peers lose hope, trapped between the old and the modern cultures, and turn to destructive behaviors, Denny and her mysterious lead dog, a blue-eyed wolf, train for the Great Race—a 1,000-mile test of courage and endurance through the vast Alaskan wilderness, across creeks and rivers, mountains and valleys, and the treacherous, frozen Arctic sea. Some in her village make fun of her, calling her a tomboy, while others demean her because she is only part Indian and has blue eyes. But Denny learns the value of intergenerational friendships, of maintaining connections to her heritage, and of being true to herself, and in her strength she gives her village new pride and hope.

Praise for John Smelcer’s Previous Novels

The Great Death

“The simple, lyrical language enhances the stark beauty of the winter setting.… The authentic details of survival in the winter wilderness are fascinating and should draw in reluctant readers.” —School Library Journal

“A gripping and poignant survival story.… Smelcer’s prose is clean yet rich; original yet unpretentious, and he provides more than enough detail to satisfy diehard survival-story junkies.” —The Horn Book, starred review

“This grim tale of the sisters’ struggle against the elements will leave readers wanting to know more about this little-known time in history.” —Booklist

“With a prose style by turns informative, poetic and graphic, Smelcer tells of the sisters’ journey away from their Alaskan village, a story of strength and courage.... An engaging tale of survival.” —Kirkus

“A classic survival story.” —Bulletin of the Center for Children’s Books

“An amazing story.” —Frank McCourt

The Trap

“Readers will be clinging to the pages of this graceful, haunting story…. How rare to find lyrical writing combined with real suspense…. Equally memorable and enjoyable for children, teens and adults. A small masterpiece.” —Kirkus

“A great addition to survival/adventure collections or Native American fiction.” —School Library Journal

“An unforgettable story.” —Ray Bradbury

“A lovely story, beautifully told, the kind that makes you wade in and sink warmly into the cold, cold north of Alaska.” —Winston Groom, author of Forrest Gump

“John Smelcer takes readers to the Alaskan Arctic Circle for an unforgettable survival tale.” —The Horn Book

Alaskan

“A celebration of the diversity of cultures. Undeniably important!” —James Michener

“An indispensible contribution to Alaskan literature.” —JD Salinger

“This writer speaks from the land, and for the land, and the people who belong to it.” —Ursula K. Le Guin 

“John Smelcer is an Alaskan literary treasure.” —Jay Hammond, former Governor of Alaska

“A compelling voice, unforgettable and highly recommended.” —Midwest Book Review

About John Smelcer

John Smelcer is the poetry editor of Rosebud magazine and the author of more than forty books. He is an Alaskan Native of the Ahtna tribe, and is now the last tribal member who reads and writes in Ahtna. John holds degrees in anthropology and archaeology, linguistics, literature, and education. He also holds a PhD in English and creative writing from Binghamton University, and formerly chaired the Alaska Native Studies program at the University of Alaska Anchorage.

His first novel, The Trap, was an American Library Association BBYA Top Ten Pick, a VOYA Top Shelf Selection, and a New York Public Library Notable Book. The Great Death was short-listed for the 2011 William Allen White Award, and nominated for the National Book Award, the BookTrust Prize (England), and the American Library Association’s Award for American Indian YA Literature. His Alaska Native mythology books include The Raven and the Totem (introduced by Joseph Campbell). His short stories, poems, essays, and interviews have appeared in hundreds of magazines, and he is winner of the 2004 Milt Kessler Poetry Book Award and of the 2004 Western Writers of America Award for Poetry for his collection Without Reservation, which was nominated for a Pulitzer. John divides his time between a cabin in Talkeetna, the climbing capitol of Alaska, where he wrote much of Lone Wolves, and Kirksville Mo., where he is a visiting scholar in the Department of Communications Studies at Truman State University. 

Recent Accomplishments of Leapfrog Authors

Mick Carlon received the 2013 Massachusetts Teachers Association Human & Civil Rights Award. His novel Riding on Duke’s Train, adopted by Jazz at Lincoln Center, is being made into a feature-length, animated movie by Emmy Award-winning filmmaker Ken Kimmelman. Both his children’s novels are being read this summer by hundreds of underserved children at the Harlem Children’s Zone, thanks to a generous gift from Jazz at Lincoln Center. Poet Charles Coe (All Sins Forgiven) has been named one of the “Literary Lights of 2014,” an honor awarded to six outstanding writers from the northeast by the Associates of the Boston Public Library. Helen Phillips (And Yet They Were Happy) received the prestigious Rona Jaffee Foundation Writer’s Award in 2009. George Rosen’s The Immanence of God in the Tropics was named a Top-10 Travel Book of 2012 by Publisher’s Weekly. Michael Mirolla’s Berlin was just translated into Latvian, and B.B. Wurge’s The Last Notebook of Leonardo, winner of the 2011 Moonbeam Book Awards for Pre-teen Fiction, into Korean. Suzanne Kamata (Losing Kei) had been awarded the Society of Children’s Book Writers and Illustrators’ 2013 Work in Progress Grant in multicultural fiction. John Smelcer’s novel Lone Wolves — called “a beautiful and moving story of courage and love” by the late Ray Bradbury — will be released in October, adding to the positive portrayal of Native Americans in teen literature. Finally, in partnership with Guernica Editions in Toronto, we have launched a new journal of fiction, Crossborder.


Leapfrog Press is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non‐profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Leapfrog Press must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only and are tax‐deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Sweet What?

Sweetheart is a collection of erotica for a mature, kink-positive audience. Consisting of 25 vignettes which explore everything from petplay to spankings to threesomes, Sweetheart is an e-book best read with one hand. 

With an emphasis on safe, sane and consensual sexual practices, as well as a desire to provide an intelligent, literary perspective, Sweetheart hopes to further the canon of smart, sexy erotica. 

Because, let's face it, in a world where the fanfiction of 50 Shades of Grey gets a movie deal, perversion has become confused with poor taste.

For those who like numbers: Sweetheart is over 22,000 words and about 83 pages long.

How Sweetheart Was Born

Two years ago, I started a blog about kink - my experiences with it, my opinions about it, my fantasies involving it - with the expectation of being able to express myself and connect with a few people. Instead, the blog exploded. What began as an effort to understand aspects of my sexuality through writing became something that other people resonated with in ways I had never anticipated.

Recently, I received several suggestions from followers asking if I would ever seek to publish any of the erotica from my blog. After fielding interest from a larger pool, I realized that producing original content could be an interesting direction to go in. 

However, the real push came from, unfortunately, financial need. In August, I will begin graduate school. While I have some financial support from my program, I am otherwise mostly financially independent. But, in order to get to my dream program 500 miles away, I'll need to raise some funds. Although I'm working, producing erotica seemed like a suitable way to put a dent in some of my expenses. Although it initially felt a little like selling out, I soon found that producing Sweetheart was enjoyable and fulfilling.

And, after receiving tons of support and positive feedback from the samples I shared with my followers, I decided Sweetheart and a gig in erotica on the side could be a real thing. So, after some suggestions to crowdfund a little, I've decided to start promoting Sweetheart here and offer the opportunity to preorder the e-book before its August 1 release.

Update: Sweetheart has been released and will be delivered to you via email within 24 hours of your generous donation. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

Where that $2000's going:

  • $200 - See the sexy lady on the cover? See the reflection of the very talented photographer (Dominic von Stösser) in her eye? Aint nothing for free.
  • $100 - General editing and formatting expenses.
  • $1700 - A laptop. Right before Sweetheart was conceived, my laptop broke. Hence, most of my stories were written on my phone or on a borrowed laptop for a friend. Want a sequel to Sweetheart? I don't think I could do this on a phone again.
  • And hopefully: Moving me 500 miles to the school of my dreams. Who doesn't love a Cinderella story?

What you get:

  • $5 - Sweetheart, the E-book. Donations prior to August 1, 2013, will be treated as pre-orders. Donations afterwards will have the book delivered within a day. E-books are pdf formatted and delivered via email. 
  • $40 -  A hand-printed 5x7" fine-art print on fibre-based paper of the cover photograph of Sweetheart, numbered and signed by the photographer, Dominic von Stösser, along with a custom note of thanks by the author on the back. Limit 20. 
  • $80 - A hand-printed 8x10" fine-art print on fibre-based paper of the cover photograph of Sweetheart, numbered and signed by the photographer, Dominic von Stösser, along with a custom note of thanks by yours truly written on the back. Limit 10.
  • $100 - A custom story in Sweetheart. I will not write anything that violates consent or involves minors, death or scat. You will be credited in Sweetheart under the name you choose. These must be submitted by July 27, 2013 to appear in the e-book. Limit 5.
  • NEW: $100 - A custom story. I will not write anything that violates consent or involves minors, death or scat. These can be private or, with your permission, will be featured in a future collection of erotica. Please let me know how to credit you if you allow me to use this story in the future.
  • The highest donation receives a bound, print, softcover copy of Sweetheart with a note of gratitude written on the inside cover.

Note: All donations over $5 also have the e-book included.

 

Excerpts of Sweetheart

Find a sneak preview on here. Once again, 18 and over only.

And hopefully: Moving me 500 miles to the school of my dreams. Who doesn't love a Cinderella story?

What you get:

$5 - Sweetheart, the E-book. Donations prior to August 1, 2013, will be treated as pre-orders. Donations afterwards will have the book delivered within a day. E-books are pdf formatted and delivered via email. 
$40 -  A hand-printed 5x7" fine-art print on fibre-based paper of the cover photograph of Sweetheart, numbered and signed by the photographer, Dominic von Stösser, along with a custom note of thanks by the author on the back. Limit 20. 
$80 - A hand-printed 8x10" fine-art print on fibre-based paper of the cover photograph of Sweetheart, numbered and signed by the photographer, Dominic von Stösser, along with a custom note of thanks by yours truly written on the back. Limit 10.
$100 - A custom story in Sweetheart. I will not write anything that violates consent or involves minors, death or scat. You will be credited in Sweetheart under the name you choose. These must be submitted by July 27, 2013 to appear in the e-book. Limit 5.
NEW: $100 - A custom story. I will not write anything that violates consent or involves minors, death or scat. These can be private or, with your permission, will be featured in a future collection of erotica. Please let me know how to credit you if you allow me to use this story in the future.
The highest donation receives a bound, print, softcover copy of Sweetheart with a note of gratitude written on the inside cover.

Note: All donations over $5 also have the e-book included.
 

Excerpts of Sweetheart

Find a sneak preview on here. Once again, 18 and over only.

story:
About the book

Tapestry 5 - Rapid web application development in Java is a comprehensive guide, introducing Apache Tapestry and its innovative approach to build modern web applications.

The book walks you through Tapestry 5, from a simple Hello World application to rich Ajax-enabled applications. Written by a core committer this book provides a deep insight into the architecture of Tapestry 5. It does not only show you how to achieve a certain goal but also teaches you the “why”. You learn how to build modern, scalable Web 2.0 application with component-oriented approach. This book also shows how Tapestry brings scripting language productivity within reach of Java developers without sacrificing any of Java's inherent speed and power.

Table of contents

  1. Introducing Tapestry
  2. Tapestry templates
  3. Page navigation
  4. Developing stateful applications
  5. Localization
  6. Creating Forms with Tapestry
  7. Converting and validating user input
  8. Generating UI for JavaBeans
  9. Developing reusable components
  10. Mixins
  11. Creating Ajax-enabled applications
  12. Persisting domain objects
  13. Integrating Spring framework
  14. Dependency Injection and Tapestry IoC (not available yet) 
  15. Testing Tapestry applications

 

Highlights

  • Covers Tapestry 5.3
  • Addresses all Java developers: from novice to professionals
  • Easy introduction for beginners, only Java and HTML prior knowledge is required
  • Advanced readers learn undocumented features from a Tapestry expert
  • Shows how to build web applications with unprecedented high level of productivity
  • Makes you enjoy web development in Java again
  • Highly practical book containing a lot of examples

About the author

Igor Drobiazko is a member of the Tapestry developer team and a trainer for Tapestry. He is a Tapestry evangelist, speaking frequently at java user groups and conferences and writing articles about Tapestry. Igor is the author of the first German book on Tapestry 5 and maintains a blog.

 

About Tapestry

Apache Tapestry is a component-oriented web framework for building fast, scalable and reliable applications from simple and reusable components. Tapestry features concise templates, minimal amounts of Java code, high performance, and important productivity features such as live class reloading and convention over configuration.

Developing Tapestry applications involves creating HTML templates using plain HTML, and combining the templates with small amounts of Java code. Java developers love it because they can make Java code changes and see them immediately ... no redeploy, no restart! And it's blazingly fast to boot. HTML designers love it because Tapestry templates are so close to ordinary HTML.

In Tapestry, you create your application in terms of objects, and the methods and properties of those objects -- and specifically not in terms of URLs and query parameters. Tapestry brings true object oriented development to Java web applications.

What you get

By claiming the $1 Perk you can support me even if you are not interested in this book. If you claim the $5 Perk, your name will be listed on the book's website in the Acknowledgement section. 

By claiming the $25 Perk you get a PDF copy of the book after this campaign is closed and the goal is reached. Currently the book consists of 14 chapters (around 400 pages). You receive the current PDF, new draft chapters as they are being written and the final PDF copy of the book.

If you claim the $55 ($50 for the book + $5 for shipping) Perk you additionally get a pint copy of the book (black and white). Please note that it will take me some time to get the current manuscript into a shape which is acceptable for printing. Although the quality of the content is good, there are still a lot of minor improvements needed.

The $250 Perk gives you the possibility to have a Skype chat with a Tapestry guru. Use this unique opportunity to talk about your existing Tapestry application. Considering to use Tapestry in your next project? This Perk might help you to make your desicion. Please note tha my time zone is CET (Central European Time). You have to be flexible in time if you are in a time zone which is several hours behind or ahead of CET.  

How you can help

Apart from claiming a Perk of your choice you can make some noise about this campaign. Please spread a word about this book on Twitter, Facebook, Google+ or wherever. Please also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Questions?

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask. I'd love to answer any of your questions.

story:
So what the heck is RASCAL, anyway?
 
Allison Maloney and Cynthia Robinson (avid readers, critics and all-around geeks) came together in early 2011 with a mutual frustration with the magazine content they'd been consuming. Colloquial, honest prose, humor and high art rarely find themselves in the same publication: they've all been replaced with mind-numbing lists and tired profiles of whichever Kardashian's rump.
 
Backed with the power of way too much coffee, they decided to change that.
 
RASCAL magazine was created to serve as an emotionally and aesthetically intriguing collection of literary writing, art, and cultural commentary, aiming to both inspire and connect with readers who are hungry for a little more truth and grit.
 
A call out to our community brought in about fifty young, creative minds who collectively believe in producing a magazine worth showing off. We are the brightest, most ambitious group of writers, artists, designers, photographers, videographers, and internet-ers you'll ever come across.
 
Our identity is a subtly with teeth. As humans, we are personified substance and attitude. As creators, we strive to be the same.

We are reaching out to you all in hopes of making our ambitious goal of printing a magazine into a reality. People stopped believing in print with a furious mob mentality, but we still believe that paper between our fingertips directly drives words to the heart and mind.

All of the money we raise with your help will go directly towards printing RASCAL. Our goal is to print 3,000-5,000 copies to distribute in both our community and by mail, to you, to share in your pockets of the world.

Those who donate will also be a part of the tangible RASCAL, too. We plan to include the names of each contributor in a special page within the magazine.

If you're unable to donate, or even if you already have, help us by spreading the word! Post our page to Facebook and Twitter! Follow us on Tumblr to help direct attention to our project, or check out RASCALonline, where we are creating a digital voice for the rascal in all of us. Click the "share tools" on our page to spread the word!

story:
We are Katelyn and Jessie and we are climbing a mountain. 

We love to take on challenges (in every respect) in our lives. We believe that if we put our mind to it, we can do anything. We've jumped in the cold Atlantic ocean to raise money for the Sons of Ireland and when we wanted to go on senior week and couldn't afford the trip, we sold breakfast to hungover college kids to get us there.  Now we're climbing 14,000 feet up Mt. Shasta to raise money for the American Liver Foundation!

We've spent the last four months training from across the country. That's the easy part. The real challenge here is our commitment to raise $5,000 for liver education advocacy, treatment, and research funding.  Any of you who have fundraised before know how difficult this can be. We know we can do it, but we need your help.

Any amount you can afford to donate really makes a difference. And as a way to say, "Thanks, you're awesome!" we came up with a series of perks....

  • $25 - A handwritten, personalized postcard sent right to your front door!
  • $65 - A poster-sized print of Mt. Shasta with an inspiring quote. To remind you that you can do anything and to let the world know how hipster you are.
  • $100 - Ice-cube trays in the shape of either Mt. Shasta or livers (you're choice) made from food-grade silicone. Can you imagine a better conversation starter? 
  • $500 - A piece of artwork made by either of us (again...your choice!) These are one of a kind masterpieces. 

(Note: None of the proceeds that we raise will go to the cost of making these perks!)

We understand that not everyone is able to help us out financially. But we can still use your support. 

  • Share our campaign page on Facebook or email.
  • Send us words of encouragement!

**All donations are tax deductible!**

story:
In Summary

Rose of Eibon is a new publishing venture seeking backing to get the ball rolling in the best way possible! We aim to produce a range of genre and specialist publications, including prestige magazines and prose fiction books, plus some comic book content.


Please note that although the deadline for this start-up campaign has now passed, we are still taking donations and offering rewards. For full details, e-mail us at darkmattersmagazine@gmail.com.


What We Need & What You Get

But we need a bit of help! A computer systems upgrade, website hosting and general expenses for starters; project development and labour costs can also be something of a drain. Help us get things started up and we'll give you some free stuff in return! :) Plus all contributors get a subscription to our newsletter mailing list.


Please note that although the deadline for this start-up campaign has now passed, we are still taking donations and offering rewards. For full details, e-mail us at darkmattersmagazine@gmail.com.


Future Plans

We've already published Chrissie Harper's collection Halloween Comix. Future projects include: the genre magazine Dark Matters, edited by Steve Green and Chrissie Harper; The Dispossessed and Other Weird Tales, a charitable anthology dedicated to the late Joel Lane; The Camera Never Dies, a spooky novelette by Liz Black. More will be announced in the near future at the Rose of Eibon and Dark Matters Facebook pages, and at our forthcoming website.

Please note that although the deadline for this start-up campaign has now passed, we are still taking donations and offering rewards. For full details, e-mail us at darkmattersmagazine@gmail.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD! That's it, really. All your support is massively appreciated!! :)

story:
Homeless Horror Story


Thanks for reading my proposal, I appreciate your time and hope this is something you can get genuinely excited about. This is the chance to be part of a major project with a published author AND to be a character in this, my third novel: Homeless Horror Story.

First, some background…

I almost hit the big time.

Almost. My first novel, a black comedy called 3, had been published to critical acclaim in 2004 and ultimately found its way onto the desk of a fabulous London agent.

How did it find its way onto his desk? Well, okay, I sent it to him because I knew he was fabulous.

I was living in England at the time (on a working farm in North Yorkshire to be precise) and he rang to say how much he’d loved the novel. He asked me to meet him at his Piccadilly Circus office. I said ‘Can I come now?’ He made some lame excuse about a hundred actual clients who kind of needed his attention first and set up a meeting for two weeks hence.

I got the train down to London from Northallerton a day early to ensure I wouldn’t be late and stayed in a hotel five minutes’ walk from his office to ensure the only public transport I had to rely on was my legs.

‘I absolutely love 3,’ he said moments into that meeting before telling me how he had read it over a long weekend in the South of France with friends who had become utterly sick of him laughing out loud.

‘Here we go!’ I thought. ‘This is it! The moment every novelist dreams of!’

‘But I can’t sell it.'

'What?'

'Undoubtedly it’s one of the funniest books I’ve ever read, but it’s a very insular, isolated story and very Australian; I’m just not sure it will resonate with a European market. I want you to write me something I can sell here. Something set here, but equally funny.’

I stumbled off into Piccadilly Circus wondering if I could ever take my writing career seriously enough to be funny again.

Two years later I sent him the manuscript for a new novel called Nothing but Animals.

I wrote it in England. I set it there. I made all but one of the characters English; an Antipodean animal activist trying to marry into the family of a North Yorkshire battery hen farmer. I made it funny.

As an animal lover I also made it provocative, controversial and thought provoking. I spared no one in the business of exploiting animals on the English landscape: battery hen farmers, sheep and cattle farmers, fox hunters and pheasant shooters. They all copped it.

But, most importantly as per mission statement, I made it funny.

‘I love it, my soon-to-be London literary agent said. ‘I can sell this.’

He wasn’t wrong. Transworld Publishers, part of the largest publishing group in Europe, jumped on it, loved it, raved about it.

‘It’s a very funny, extremely well written novel,’ they said.

'Thank you,' we said.

‘But it’s a funny novel with a very serious theme.’

‘Yes!’ we said with enthusiasm.

'That's actually...a bad thing,' they said.

'It is?' we said.

‘Well, Ben Elton kind of has the monopoly on issue-based comedy, and he’s a client.’

‘He is? He does?’ I said.

‘It also gets a bit didactic. Your ALF terrorist is a sharp character, but very preachy. Can you tone him down a bit?’

I did.

A bit.

But not enough.

They were still scared of the controversial content. And Ben Elton. My big break became ‘a reluctant pass.’

That was then…

This is where you come in.

If Nothing but Animals is the world class novel the world never quite got to see, my new offering, Homeless Horror Story, promises to be an even better book; even better than my critically acclaimed first novel 3 (currently in development as a 24 episode black comedy television series called Box Freezer).

In Homeless Horror Story I get to revel in my love for all things Gothic and ghastly, giving the horror genre a hearty kick up the bum with some deliciously black comedy. It’s a novel set in Australia, but with a ghostly international flavour. I can’t tell you too much for fear of concept theft (and we will all know if someone steals this idea - the time stamp is in place), but here’s a tiny synopsis:

Eddie Haverford is a 35 year old homeless Englishman, widowed and woeful and living in his car along the disparately wonderful beaches of Australia’s Sunshine Coast while he waits for the courage to start his car one last time, exhaust connected to a length of discount garden hose (no snap-locks required). But when the ruins of a three hundred year old sandstone inn from a condemned English village rupture the beachfront grass beneath a Kings Beach children's playground in the dead of night and begin to rise inexorably inch by media-watched inch tumbling earth and swings and slides aside in a grass-growingly slow, yet riveting rise from the bowels of the earth until the entire decayed, derelict building sits ugly, eerie and incongruous before the sparkling apartments of Kings Beach, Eddie Haverford gets out of his car. He has somewhere new to sleep, somewhere so much colder than his sweat box station wagon - so much colder. But as more buildings from that condemned English village begin to rise randomly around South East Queensland and shadowy figures begin to leave long dead houses and head north for the inn on foot, Eddie Haverford's homeless hell of a life is about to take a ghoulish new twist.

I assure you, Homeless Horror Story will be a fiendishly funny novel with plenty of shocking twists and turns; I can’t wait to get stuck in as it has all the ingredients of a best seller! I almost got that big break once before. All the indicators say that this will be the book that gets me there. But I can’t do it without your help.

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is $50,000 which will allow me to write Homeless Horror Story full time through 2014 and live modestly, but comfortably. While both my previous novels took two years to write, I do believe that I can write this one in one year; maybe even less if the bills are covered and I don’t have to take on other writing projects to make ends meet.

Now all I need is the funds to make it happen!

Here is what I offer in return:

·  For $10, you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating you on how Homeless Horror Story is advancing.

·  For $25, you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating you on how Homeless Horror Story is advancing AND your name on a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch web site (once published).

·  For $50, you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating you on how Homeless Horror Story is advancing with sneak preview chapter samples AND your name on a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch web site (once published) AND I will email you a digital copy of my (almost huge) novel, Nothing but Animals AND I will make you a cameo (one off) character in Homeless Horror Story. Yes, YOU will be a character in the book! Would you like to be a tourist? A surfer? A waitress? A council worker? A bus driver? I’ll email you to make sure you’re happy with the character I’ve chosen for you. NB. To minimise the risk of plagiarism, you will need to digitally sign a confidentiality agreement.

·  For $100, you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating you on how Homeless Horror Story is progressing with sneak preview chapter samples AND your name on a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch Site (once published) AND I will email you a digital copy of my (almost huge) novel, Nothing but Animals AND I will make you a recurring supporting character in Homeless Horror Story. Yes, YOU will be a character in the book with a recurring role! Would you like to be a fellow homeless person? A ghoul? A visiting reporter? A cop? A hapless victim? A life saver? A nurse in a retirement home? A local hoon? I’ll email you to make sure you are happy with the character I have chosen for you. NB. To minimise the risk of plagiarism, you will need to sign a confidentiality agreement.

·  For $500, you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating you on how Homeless Horror Story is progressing with sneak preview chapter samples AND your name on a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch Site (once published) AND I will email you a digital copy of my (almost huge) novel, Nothing But Animals AND I will make you a recurring integral character in Homeless Horror Story. Yes, YOU will be a central character in the book with an important recurring role! NB. These ARE integral roles requiring plot disclosure, so to minimise the risk of plagiarism, you will need to sign a confidentially agreement before we can discuss roles.

·  For $5000, you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating you on how Homeless Horror Story is progressing with sneak preview chapter samples AND your name on a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch Site (once published) AND I will email you a digital copy of my (almost huge) novel, Nothing But Animals AND I will make you a major (recurring) character in Homeless Horror Story – one of the central six (but not the lead). Yes, YOU will be a regular character in the book with a central ongoing role! NB. These ARE integral roles requiring plot disclosure, so to minimise the risk of plagiarism, you will need to sign a confidentially agreement before we can discuss roles.

NB. While I will do everything I can to fit you to a role, I can’t guarantee it if your name or gender isn’t right for a particular character. In most cases you will be that character in name only – age, appearance and background may vary significantly – but if I can make you YOU, I will.

________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who'd like to contribute but can’t do so financially, that's okay. Here's how you can help... and yes, will it really help!

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Let your Facebook friends know about Homeless Horror Story and give them the link. Check out the Indiegogo share tools to help you spread the word!

Thanks heaps.
