‘Here we go!’ I thought. ‘This is it! The
moment every novelist dreams of!’
‘But I can’t sell it.''What?''Undoubtedly it’s one of the funniest books
I’ve ever read, but it’s a very insular, isolated story and very Australian;
I’m just not sure it will resonate with a European market. I want you to write me
something I can sell here. Something set here, but equally funny.’
I stumbled off into Piccadilly Circus wondering if I
could ever take my writing career seriously enough to be funny again.
Two years later I sent him the manuscript for a new
novel called Nothing but Animals. I wrote it in England. I set it there. I made
all but one of the characters English; an Antipodean animal activist trying to
marry into the family of a North Yorkshire battery hen farmer. I made it funny. As an animal lover I also made it provocative, controversial and thought provoking. I spared no one in the business of exploiting animals on the English landscape: battery hen farmers, sheep and cattle farmers, fox hunters and pheasant shooters. They all copped it. But, most importantly as per mission statement, I made it funny.
‘I love it, my soon-to-be London literary agent said. ‘I can sell this.’ 
He wasn’t wrong. Transworld Publishers, part of the largest publishing group in Europe, jumped on it, loved it, raved about it. 
‘It’s a very funny, extremely well written novel,’ they said.
'Thank you,' we said.
‘But it’s a funny novel with a very serious theme.’
‘Yes!’ we said with enthusiasm.'That's actually...a bad thing,' they said.'It is?' we said.
‘Well, Ben Elton kind of has the monopoly on
issue-based comedy, and he’s a client.’
‘He is? He does?’ I said.
‘It also gets a bit didactic. Your ALF terrorist is a
sharp character, but very preachy. Can you tone him down a bit?’
I did. 
A bit. 
But not enough.
They were still scared of the controversial content.
And Ben Elton. My big break became ‘a reluctant pass.’
That
was then…
This is where you come in.
If Nothing but Animals is the world class novel the
world never quite got to see, my new offering, Homeless Horror Story, promises
to be an even better book; even better than my critically acclaimed first novel 3 (currently in development as a 24 episode black comedy television series called
Box Freezer). 
In Homeless Horror Story I get to revel in my love
for all things Gothic and ghastly, giving the horror genre a hearty kick up the
bum with some deliciously black comedy. It’s a novel set in Australia, but with
a ghostly international flavour. I can’t tell you too much for fear of concept
theft (and we will all know if someone steals this idea - the time stamp is in place), but here’s a tiny synopsis:
Eddie Haverford is a 35 year old homeless
Englishman, widowed and woeful and living in his car along the disparately wonderful beaches
of Australia’s Sunshine Coast while he waits for the courage to start his car
one last time, exhaust connected to a length of discount garden hose (no snap-locks required). But when the ruins of a three hundred year old sandstone inn from a condemned
English village rupture the beachfront grass beneath a Kings Beach children's playground in the dead of night and begin to rise inexorably inch by media-watched inch tumbling earth and swings and slides aside in a grass-growingly slow, yet riveting rise from the bowels of the earth until the entire decayed, derelict building sits ugly, eerie and incongruous before the sparkling apartments of Kings Beach, Eddie Haverford gets out of his car. He has somewhere new to sleep, somewhere so much colder than his sweat box station wagon - so much colder. But as more buildings from that condemned English village begin to rise randomly around South East Queensland and shadowy figures begin to leave long dead houses and head north for the inn on foot, Eddie Haverford's homeless hell of a life is about to take a ghoulish new twist.
I assure you, Homeless Horror Story will be a
fiendishly funny novel with plenty of shocking twists and turns; I can’t wait
to get stuck in as it has all the ingredients of a best seller! I almost got
that big break once before. All the indicators say that this will be the book that gets me there. But I can’t do it without
your help. 

What I Need & What You Get
My goal
is $50,000 which will allow me to write Homeless Horror Story full time through
2014 and live modestly, but comfortably. While both my previous novels took two
years to write, I do believe that I can write this one in one year; maybe even
less if the bills are covered and I don’t have to take on other writing
projects to make ends meet. 
Now all I
need is the funds to make it happen!
Here is
what I offer in return:
· 
For $10,
you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating
you on how Homeless Horror Story is advancing.
· 
For $25,
you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating
you on how Homeless Horror Story is advancing AND your name on a dedicated
Supporters Page on the Book Launch web site (once published).
· 
For $50,
you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating
you on how Homeless Horror Story is advancing with sneak preview chapter
samples AND your name on a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch web site
(once published) AND I will email you a digital copy of my (almost huge) novel,
Nothing but Animals AND I will make you a cameo (one off) character in Homeless
Horror Story. Yes, YOU will be a character in the book! Would you like to be a tourist?
A surfer? A waitress? A council worker? A bus driver? I’ll email you to make sure you’re happy with
the character I’ve chosen for you. NB. To minimise the risk of plagiarism, you
will need to digitally sign a confidentiality agreement.
· 
For $100,
you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating
you on how Homeless Horror Story is progressing with sneak preview chapter
samples AND your name on a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch Site (once
published) AND I will email you a digital copy of my (almost huge) novel,
Nothing but Animals AND I will make you a recurring supporting character in
Homeless Horror Story. Yes, YOU will be a character in the book with a
recurring role! Would you like to be a fellow homeless person? A ghoul? A
visiting reporter? A cop? A hapless victim? A life saver? A nurse in a
retirement home? A local hoon? I’ll email you to make sure you are happy with
the character I have chosen for you. NB. To minimise the risk of plagiarism,
you will need to sign a confidentiality agreement.
· 
For $500,
you will get a personal thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating
you on how Homeless Horror Story is progressing with sneak preview chapter
samples AND your name on a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch Site (once
published) AND I will email you a digital copy of my (almost huge) novel,
Nothing But Animals AND I will make you a recurring integral character in
Homeless Horror Story. Yes, YOU will be a central character in the book with an
important recurring role! NB. These ARE integral roles requiring plot
disclosure, so to minimise the risk of plagiarism, you will need to sign a
confidentially agreement before we can discuss roles.
· 
For $5000, you will get a personal
thank-you email AND quarterly progress emails updating you on how Homeless
Horror Story is progressing with sneak preview chapter samples AND your name on
a dedicated Supporters Page on the Book Launch Site (once published) AND I will
email you a digital copy of my (almost huge) novel, Nothing But Animals AND I
will make you a major (recurring) character in Homeless Horror Story – one of
the central six (but not the lead). Yes, YOU will be a regular character in the
book with a central ongoing role! NB. These ARE integral roles requiring plot
disclosure, so to minimise the risk of plagiarism, you will need to sign a
confidentially agreement before we can discuss roles.
NB. While
I will do everything I can to fit you to a role, I can’t guarantee it if your
name or gender isn’t right for a particular character. In most cases you will
be that character in name only – age, appearance and background may vary
significantly – but if I can make you YOU, I will. 
________________________________________________________________________
Other Ways You Can Help
For those
of you who'd like to contribute but can’t do so financially, that's okay.
Here's how you can help... and yes, will it really help!
Get the
word out and make some noise about this campaign. Let your Facebook friends
know about Homeless Horror Story and give them the link. Check out the Indiegogo
share tools to help you spread the word!
Thanks
heaps.

Short Summary & Introduction

Hi, I’m Hemlock Inyx, and I’m a geek.  I’ve loved Japanese Anime and Japanese culture since I discovered Sailor Moon, Gundam Wing and ninjas.  Toss in a healthy love of reading,  creative imagination, and a penchant for dressing up in costumes, and that’s my life in a nutshell.  Oh, and buttons.  I’ve made and sold a lot of buttons at Anime Cons.


After spending ten years traveling the con-circuit of New England, I’ve been to a lot of conventions of varying degrees of success. And I’ve had some amazing opportunities.  From booking Anime Guests for I-Con, to Heading the Artist Alley at AnimeNext, and just volunteering at Anime Boston.  Over the years I’ve had a lot of ideas about conventions, how to run panels, how to schedule events, how to manage them, and most of all, that we need more in my neck of the woods.


And all the time I was thinking, ‘this’.  This is the sort of feeling of belonging that I want to bottle and carry around with me every day.  This community of fans, these people who understand my love, my passion for my fandoms,  and who don’t think it’s just a phase, or immature.  


Finally, I have been blessed to be surrounded by other awesome people who share my passion for Conventions, and we decided it was time to stop talking about starting our own con and actually do it.


So here we are, we currently have a wonderful location booked for the August 20th and 21st of this year.  We have booked some awesome guests, and are looking for some more.  We have a ton of interesting events and other activities to do, and more to plan.  And now we are looking for are fellow fans who want to invest in our community and help us build a con that will last.


What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to create a convention that will be both financially stable and diverse with fun events and guests we are hoping to raise $20,000 or more.  

  • $10,000 towards securing a second year at our current location, and adding more space for events.

  • $5,000 towards equipment, such as Projectors, TV’s and other AV equipment for Panels, Workshops and the Video Game room.

  • $3,000 towards bringing in a high profile guest.

  • $1,000 towards bringing in more local guests and performers.

  • $500 towards expanding staff and covering human resource needs.

  • $500 towards miscellaneous expenses and fees for running this campaign.

Any extra funds raised will go towards bringing in more guests and performers, expanding the space at the hotel, and investing in more and better equipment for panels and workshops.  Should we fall short of our goal, the funds will go towards equipment first, then bringing in more guests, then securing a second year with more hotel space.


In order to reach our goal, we have created perks that let fellow fans ‘Put Their Name on It’. We want our community of fellow fans to be invested in our convention, be able to take pride in supporting a local con, and help us truly succeed for years to come.


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is not selling enough tickets to cover the costs of year one, and then not being able to secure a second year.  However, Popcult Productions, LLC, which is the overseeing company for PopCult Anime Con is my own personal investment into the community I love, and I’m willing to take my own financial risk in order to support the convention for the first year.  As an experienced business person and convention staffer, I feel confident that I can lead PopCult Anime Con to be successful by using its funds wisely and with careful investment in equipment and marketing.  Fans can feel secure in knowing that we take the business of running PopCult Anime Con very seriously, and that investing in our con is well worth doing.


Other Ways You Can Help

So what else can you do to help?  Well the first thing you can do is go to our Eventbrite page and purchase your pre-reg ticket, and plan to have a very fun weekend with me and the rest of the staff.  You can also share this information with other fans, every share on Facebook, or Tweet or Snapchat helps us expand our audience and spread the word.  The more people we can get to invest and come to PCAC, the better and stronger our convention will be.

story:
Short Summary

My "World Tour" of Comic Cons and bookstores in support of Sidekick: The Misadventures of the New Scarlet Knight and its upcoming sequel Brothers in Arms kicks off September 6th at Baltimore Comic-Con, with other dates added as time and funds allow. My hope is to be able to add stops in New York, Chicago, Portland, Louisville, Toronto, and any other con or bookstore that will have me.

What We Need & What You Get

Booking these events is expensive. I will need to pay for tables at cons. I will need promotional materials. I will need copies of the book (and eventually both books) to sell at the events. I will need gas money to get me to each event.

My current goal will cover my most immediate needs:

  • Paying for my table at Baltimore Comic-Con, where I'm launching the tour.
  • Laying in a sufficient stock of copies of Sidekick to autograph and sell during the tour.
  • Designing and printing special promotional materials. I would really like to be able to have a giveaway mini-comic "prequel" to Sidekick, and the cost of a print run and paying the artist for the work is included in my goal.
  • Should I be accepted, paying for my table at New York Comic Con in October.
  • Any remaining funds would go toward funding additional dates on the tour.

To make it worth your while, I'm going to offer some keepsakes from the tour, autographed books, a shot at immortality, and even the shirt off my back!

The Impact

Funding this tour will give me a chance to get out there and promote these books. Sadly, it's hard for small presses to compete nowadays and even harder for relatively unknown authors to get their books noticed. This tour will help me get my books in front of my target audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Keep spreading the word! Let people know about this project and the book! And if you can lay your hands on a copy, read it!

story:
What is This Campaign About?

It's about raising funds to publish Lexus Sam -- a fast-paced story that reads like a film noir on the printed page. This story is for anyone who likes suspense, mystery, and stories that are off the beaten path, and I hope you’ll consider contributing to its success.

What's the Novel About?

It is about a man who calls himself Lexus Sam. He doesn't know his real name or where he came from. He lives in a Manhattan apartment but he only remembers ever living in California. In a bungalow on the beach.

The apartment is rented out to someone named Adam Williams, who the landlord insists is Lexus. He has Adam's wallet, too; the picture on the driver's license inside looks like him. But Lexus thinks it's a fake, a prop, because he knows he's not him. That's not his life.

His life is back in California with Sarah. He only remembers a few details about her but he's sure they were together -- in love and happy. That's his life.

He just has to prove it.

Can I read some of it?

Sure. Here's an excerpt:

The blowing snow cut across his path in a downward slant, drawing stinging lines of white over the empty plain.  A path of footprints, little craters in the sheet covering the hard ground, trailed away in a gently curving arc over the horizon — each print a signpost pointing the way to his girl with green eyes.  But the drifting, falling snow filled them in bit by bit and unless he caught up soon, it’d cover her tracks forever.

He pulled his scarf up over his mouth against the blowing snow and stepped off the road.  He matched her stride step for step, walking in her footprints.

Something caught his eye and–

–the scene burned away.  The plain of blowing snow became tangled sheets of green snaked around a twisted, sprawled form in bed.

He raised his head off the pillow and sat up, propped on his elbows, and stared.  Stared straight ahead, past his physical sight and through to the fading dream, those footprints in the snow.

 

Who is the Author?

I was born and raised in the suburbs of Toronto and began writing at an early age.
The first time my name appeared in print was back when I was in Kindergarten. I wrote a (very) short story called The Little Big Feet for a school-wide creative writing contest. Amazingly, my story won and was selected to represent my school in the anthology.
I was hooked after that and have been writing and telling stories ever since.
Although I move around a lot, right now I live in MidTown Toronto with my (soon-to-be) wife Jillian Rose and our extra fluffy tuxedo cat Errol.

Where does all this money go you ask?

 All the money from this campaign will go directly into funding the publication of Lexus Sam. Specifically, these funds will pay the editors at Iguana Books, cover the costs of formatting and layout for print and the eBook, pay Amanda Tamane and Paul Mellon for their amazing design work, and help market the book when it comes out in the fall of 2013. 

 

What's the Impact of this Campaign?

A successful campaign would mean the fulfilment of a lifelong dream -- it's not just getting my work published, it’s about sharing a story that I know people will enjoy; one that's mysterious and dark while still being about people, about what makes us who we are.
 

A Giant Thank You

A giant thank you for taking the time to read, consider and contribute, if you have, to my campaign. Without your interest this book would not be possible. If you cannot contribute now, please consider spreading the word on your social media platforms or by word-of-mouth to friends and family.

story:
Hero Wanted: Inquire Within™

When heroes are hard to find, you must learn to become your own Hero.

Hero Wanted: Inquire Within shows you how to reconnect with your true inner Hero.

  • Rediscovering Your Hero's Voice
  • Beating the Odds
  • Following Your Vision
  • Finding Your Voice
  • Living the Dream
  • Gratitude As A Springboard To Abundance
  • A Life of Endless Possibilities
  • The Courage To Be Yourself
  • Staying Balanced: A Few Steps To Peace Of Mind
  • A New Paradigm Of Personal Freedom
  • Keeping True To Your Vision By Keeping It True To Yourself
  • Creating Your Future

Chapters will feature interviews with visionary thought leaders, including:

  • Actor, healer, and bestselling author Dee Wallace. You know her best as Mom in the blockbuster movie ET.
  • Motivational speaker, bestselling author, radio and TV personality Kandee G, whose Vision Program has transformed thousands of individuals and businesses.
  • Eight time Emmy winner and Grammy-nominated musician Kat Epple, whose music has been featured on National Geographic, Nova, PBS, The Travel Channel and more.
  • International speaker, coach, and author Chris Gloss, dubbed The Possibilitarian for his ability to recognize and seize possibilites.
  • Published science fiction author Colie Scoggin, who began her series, The LaSora Project, when she was 14 years old.
  • Poet/illustrator Barbie Angell, who transformed herself from homeless teen to published children's author.

Hank Eder is a writer, PR professional, and lifelong seeker of truth. His purpose for publishing Hero Wanted: Inquire Within is to help others become empowered by rediscovering their own Hero's Voice.

Join us! Help fund our Indiegogo campaign and be part of the emerging new wave of growth and transformation that is reshaping our lives and our world  

Our Indiegogo Campaign

Our campaign seeks to raise $3,000. These funds will be used to launch the project, including:

  • ePublishing costs
  • Cover design
  • Trademark registration: The name Hero Wanted: Inquire Within will be used for books, workshops, webinars, teleconferences and more.
  • Publicity for the launch, including several press releases sent out via PR Web

Perks will range from special shoutouts on our blog site, a "Hall of Fame" page in the book, a special dedication page in the book, a signed 8X10 print of Hank's photo, "She Watches the Sun," pictured at the top of this page, and an exclusive teleconference with Hank on "Creating Your Life."

The Impact

World and national news these days makes people feel powerless. Nothing could be further from the truth. Discovering your true inner Hero empowers you to live the life you've always dreamed. Your contribution to this campaign will help spread the news and empower a great number of people who are beginning to find their Hero's Voice.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your friends and social networks, and please use our Indigogo sharing tool: http://igg.me/p/562862/x/402367

Hank Eder is a writer, PR professional,
and lifelong seeker of truth. His purpose for publishing Hero Wanted: Inquire
Within is to help others become empowered by rediscovering their own Hero's
Voice.
Join us! Help fund our
Indiegogo campaign and be part of the emerging new wave of growth and
transformation that is reshaping our lives and our world  


Our Indiegogo Campaign
Our campaign seeks to raise $3,000. These funds will be used to launch the project, including:


ePublishing costs
Cover design
Trademark registration: The name Hero Wanted: Inquire Within will be used for books, workshops, webinars, teleconferences and more.
Publicity for the launch, including several press releases sent out via PR Web

Perks will range from special shoutouts on our blog site, a "Hall of Fame" page in the book, a special dedication page in the book, a signed 8X10 print of Hank's photo, "She Watches the Sun," pictured at the top of this page, and an exclusive teleconference with Hank on "Creating Your Life."



The Impact
World and national news these days makes people feel powerless. Nothing could be further from the truth. Discovering your true inner Hero empowers you to live the life you've always dreamed. Your contribution to this campaign will help spread the news and empower a great number of people who are beginning to find their Hero's Voice.
Other Ways You Can HelpPlease share our campaign with your friends and social networks, and please use our Indigogo sharing tool: http://igg.me/p/562862/x/402367

story:
The fan behind the book on the American Game.

I'm a fan just like you. Five years ago I decided that there should be a book about American soccer - about all of it. There were a lot of stories - the game had changed a lot and no one had combined them all into one book. So I traveled around the country, talked to as many people as I could and wrote that book. Love Thy Soccer it's a product of my travels around the country and conversations with fans of all stripes - anyone who had a hand in advancing the game. I looked for:

  • Supporters, historians, players, pundits, league and club officials. Smart voices.
  • Stories at all levels of the pyramid, all regions of the country.
  • Everything fans discuss: playing abroad, youth development, pro/rel, the women's game, FIFA, American values, American convention, and the role of the fan.

I want something that American soccer fans can celebrate. Something important, proud, relevant, and above all, true.

What it's for.

I'm asking for a lot of money. But there are a lot of soccer fans in America who will LOVE reading this book. Let me explain what the funding is for and what it's going to.

  • I've already spent my own money on travel - this last bit is to get Love Thy Soccer, or LTS, published the way we envision it.
  • LTS will have a strong artistic component and will feature select full-color tifo and artwork from fans across the country. See examples below from contributors like New England fan Prairie Rose Clayton and Brent Diskin, out of Portland!

  • To encourage readers to support local soccer, we want the book's center section to feature gorgeous, regional maps showing teams at all levels of the pyramid and where they are in the US. Widgets & Stone, a graphic design house in Chattanooga will be illustrating these and the overall layout of the book. Their demo pages are below.

  • Scarves will feature heavily in the book - a different American scarf on each page from the extensive collection of scarf aficionado, Kenneth Tebo. This will increase printing and design costs but the book will be all that more unique.
  • I need to travel out east to photograph Kenneth's collection and work the layout at Widgets & Stone.

What you get.

The LTS Digitial Sticker

Express your #EpicAmericaness to the internet with the Love Thy Soccer Fan Funding campaign digital sticker! Looks great on Facebook, Twitter, Tumbler, Pinterest, or Instagarm. Show you're a Believer of the 100% fan-driven effort to publish the most comprehensive book about American soccer ever written. Designed, like the LTS Logo by incredible Indy soccer fan, Patrick Cummings.

The LTS Bumpy Pitch shirt

If you don't know Bumpy Pitch, you need to. Creative, original, vintage lifestyle wear for the soccer fan everywhere. Wear your heart on your chest with a high quality, casual tee sporting the LTS crest, slightly distressed, in a clear statement that requires no explanation. *Colors/design subject to change.

The LTS Epic Americaness scarf

From Alexi Lalas's lips to fans' ears, your perk is this exclusive Love Thy Soccer Epic Americaness™ gameday scarf. Perfect for cheering on your men's and women's national teams. The 100% high quality acrylic, Jacquard knitted scarf by industry leader Ruffneck will endure from Brazil to Canada. Omnes nos!

BELIEF limited edition print by Prairie Rose Clayton

Prairie Rose Clayton is one of the most prominent tifo artists in America. Her work is coveted by players as well as fans. Instantly recognizable, the BELIEF print will represent the central arc of the book, regional stories of fandom from across the country, and will be an iconic, lasting piece of art for all seasons. High-quality, 18" x 24" rolled print, signed by the artist herself.

If you can't give...

No worries! Tweet, share, talk it up. I appreciate anything. This is a five-year grassroots effort by a fan for fans, celebrating the game we all love. And if you've made it this far down the page, thanks for the time!

story:
¿Qué?

Terra incognita, más que novela histórica, es una historia que refleja pensamientos y sentimientos medievales y su choque inevitable con el Renacimiento y la fiebre de descubrimientos y conquistas que marcaron el inicio del siglo XVI. ¿Qué es Gonzalo Guerrero? es la pregunta central de esta novela, que no deja respiro al lector una vez la comienza.

Corre el año 1511. Tras un violento naufragio en el mar de las Antillas, un viejo bote arrastra a los primeros hispanos a lo que hoy es la península de Yucatán, México. Cuando se encuentra con el mundo maya, Gonzalo Guerrero tiene que tomar la difícil decisión de adaptarse y sobrevivir lo mejor posible para llegar a formar una familia y comandar los ejércitos mayas en contra de sus propios compatriotas. Los recuerdos de Guerrero se borran en la arena de los tiempos. Su vida y obra permanecen ocultas bajo el velo del misterio y el olvido de conquistadores, frailes y cronistas. ¿Fue realmente un traidor a Castilla, un hereje, un apóstata? Hernán Cortés afirmó categóricamente que «jamás sería bueno» y el adelantado Francisco de Montejo le instó a «apartar al diablo de su corazón». ¿Quién era Gonzalo Guerrero, entonces?

La novela cuenta con el apoyo del máximo teórico del personaje, el Dr. Salvador Campos Jara, cuyo prólogo se podrá encontrar en el libro, y la portada quedará a cargo del muralista Otoniel Baruck Sala, artista de talla internacional y cuyo ejemplo podemos ver en la parte superior.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Mauro Barea.

Nacido en Cancún en 1981, estudió la maestría en Creación y Apreciación Literaria en el IEU Puebla. Fue finalista en el I Premio Hispania de Novela Histórica de Madrid y consultor del documental sobre Gonzalo Guerrero Entre dos mundos (2013) producido por Sherefe y TV UNAM y presentado por National Geographic. Dedicado a la Historia y el periodismo, fue articulista para la Revista Pioneros, publicación historiográfica de Quintana Roo. Publicado en diversos medios y antologías, destaca haber sido finalista en el certamen Relats d’amor del Ajuntament de Constantí (Tarragona, 2017) y finalista del V Concurso de Microrrelatos del Ateneo de Mairena (Sevilla, 2017). Fue ganador del Premio de Narrativa Breve del Certamen Jóvenes Creadores 2017 de Ávila. Además, fue incluido recientemente en Sureste, antología de cuento contemporáneo de la península (Ficticia, 2017). Actualmente colabora para las revistas literarias RSC Relatos sin contrato, Bitácora de vuelos y El Rendar, de España, México y Argentina respectivamente.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«¿El hombre es dueño de su propio destino?
       Otra pregunta navegaba con él y sobresalía ante todas las demás.
       ¿Está escrito ya ese destino?
       Si es así, estamos todos jodidos. ¿Para qué hacerse entonces la jodida pregunta? Dependemos de movimientos en los confines del universo, rotaciones y traslaciones de los astros, de niños jugando en la penumbra. Nuestro cuerpo se mueve gracias a largos hilos, invisibles; somos marionetas a merced de risas y aplausos en un inmenso retablo. ¿Acaso Dios nuestro Señor, el Santísimo, puede atravesar con la mirada miles de leguas, a través de los mares, en territorios donde el evangelio le es ajeno a las fieras? Es más, ¿qué hago yo aquí? Maldigo la mala hora en que me embarqué de Sevilla a esto llamado "Edén de la Tierra" y "Paraíso terrenal" por ese Cristóbal Colón y sus castas.
       Tumbado sobre los maderos viejos de la cubierta, tomó conciencia de su última pregunta cuando un viento de bolina ondeó las velas raídas y produjo un suave crujido que se extendió hacia proa. Al punto recordó Huelva, la tierra suave que recibía la caricia de los veranos tibios, la tierra de los inviernos que tiznaban de blanco brillante las sierras de Andalucía, aquellas colinas de sus recorridos y travesuras en una infancia nebulosa.
       Sin embargo, siempre sucedía lo mismo cuando recordaba su niñez: la pesadilla aleteaba como un cuervo apenas cerraba los ojos; empantanaba las visiones de su niñez, y convertía Huelva en un ser sin forma ni sentimientos, como los indios que se revolvían feroces en las batallas bajo el lacerante sol y el picor de los insectos. Era una pesadilla que siempre empezaba con sus manos, de palmas blancas y pequeñas, de un niño que intentaba aferrarse a una cruz empapada de sangre. De las nieblas surgían más cruces negras, y un rostro cadavérico levantaba su índice contra él.
       Terribles estertores, hogueras y cruces se degustaban en el trago amargo del agua salada mezclada con la dulce de los pellejos; sabía que estas tierras estériles no pertenecían a la absolución del Altísimo. Duerme, Gonzalo, duerme, susurraba, gritaba sin una voz saliendo del pecho tatuado de ronchas y cicatrices; ni su respiración provocaba la mínima arruga en el agua estancada. Duerme, Gonzalo, se repitió, no sientas nada, piérdete en los sueños de la infancia, sueños de Andalucía, inocente bálsamo para un alma excomulgada por errores humanos, errores del destino, fallos en la conjunción del universo. Dormir era una buena idea esa noche, una buena razón para morir en el olvido de la historia».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Mauro Barea vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Short Summary

You've been following us on social media for nearly 3 years and read our digital magazine for the past 12 months. You've enjoyed the local spin we provide on everything health and fitness related in the Edmonton area. Now it's time to grow. 

YEG Fitness has been the source for health and fitness related content connecting readers with local businesses that provide great products and services. We're not going to be changing that. We're just going to make the experience better. 

We've listened to our readers over the past 12 months and now it's time to act. Many of you enjoy the digital format of the magazine for it's ease of use and option to be able to take it with you on your smart phone or tablet. But many of our readers mentioned that they still like the feel of holding a magazine in their hands. It's time to act on that request. 

By contributing to our campaign, you will be helping us launch our first print edition in time for a January launch. We have lofty goals to get YEG Fitness into studios, apparel and nutrition stores and therapist offices to continue to showcase all that is wellness in Edmonton. Your funds will be used to help offset costs of creating a print source. Digital is inexpensive to create other than the time invested in the design. Print has higher overhead. 


What We Need & What You Get

We will be using the funds obtained in this campaign to help develop the first edition so that we can use the advertising revenue from the first edition to support the development of the next edition. We hope to launch our first print edition with 2500 copies which has a cost of just over $5000. 

We have spent the past four months researching different print options and will be creating a high quality magazine using a local printer. We believe in supporting the local community and while we could have sourced the magazine overseas for a lower cost, we want to continue making this a locally developed project. 

In addition to the Indiegogo campaign, we will be hosting a launch party to celebrate the first edition. Funds from this event will be used to develop future editions of the magazine. 

We've created a number of great connections in the fitness and wellness communities over the past three years and have secured some great PERKS for contributors. Fitness passes, apparel, and nutrition products and services are just some of the PERKS available. For business owners, we're also offering some discounted pricing on our ad rates as a thank you for helping us launch this next stage of YEG Fitness. 

We've set a modest goal of $5000 for this campaign. The more we raise, the better the product and the greater reach we will have. If we raise over the $5000, we will print and distribute more magazines to expand our reach. If we receive less (which hopefully doesn't happen), we have a plan that will still allow us to release the January edition using the funds collected. 


The Impact

By supporting this project, you will be allowing us to reach more Edmontonians to show them how to lead a healthier lifestyle and some of the local businesses that they can use to achieve their own form of personal wellness. We have never been about showing fitness as a certain body shape or size. We are all about creating a lifestyle where fitness and wellness go hand in hand and that fitness has a different meaning for everyone. 

We love hearing from our readers over the past three years about how we've offered them an avenue to better themselves physically and mentally. How we've shown them options and services in the Edmonton area that they didn't know existed. We've heard from businesses who have grown over that time because of their involvement with YEG Fitness. But all of this wouldn't have been possible without our readers and followers on social media. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We don't charge for our magazine. We never have. We never will. It will be available for free at studios and wellness locations throughout the Edmonton area. Health and fitness doesn't always have to have a cost associated with it and we feel that by providing a free source of information, we can help people find their now level of personal fitness and wellness regardless of the financial abilities. 

If you are unable to help us financially, please help us by spreading the word about our project through your social media channels. As a bonus, the person who helps us spread the word the most using the built in Indiegogo channels will get a double pass to our launch party. 

Once the magazine launches in January, let us know what you think. We're always aiming to improve our product and appreciate the feedback whether good or bad. It's all valued.

   What We Need & What You Get We will be using the funds obtained in this campaign to help develop the first edition so that we can use the advertising revenue from the first edition to support the development of the next edition. We hope to launch our first print edition with 2500 copies which has a cost of just over $5000. 
We have spent the past four months researching different print options and will be creating a high quality magazine using a local printer. We believe in supporting the local community and while we could have sourced the magazine overseas for a lower cost, we want to continue making this a locally developed project. 
In addition to the Indiegogo campaign, we will be hosting a launch party to celebrate the first edition. Funds from this event will be used to develop future editions of the magazine. 
We've created a number of great connections in the fitness and wellness communities over the past three years and have secured some great PERKS for contributors. Fitness passes, apparel, and nutrition products and services are just some of the PERKS available. For business owners, we're also offering some discounted pricing on our ad rates as a thank you for helping us launch this next stage of YEG Fitness. 
We've set a modest goal of $5000 for this campaign. The more we raise, the better the product and the greater reach we will have. If we raise over the $5000, we will print and distribute more magazines to expand our reach. If we receive less (which hopefully doesn't happen), we have a plan that will still allow us to release the January edition using the funds collected. 

    The Impact By supporting this project, you will be allowing us to reach more Edmontonians to show them how to lead a healthier lifestyle and some of the local businesses that they can use to achieve their own form of personal wellness. We have never been about showing fitness as a certain body shape or size. We are all about creating a lifestyle where fitness and wellness go hand in hand and that fitness has a different meaning for everyone. 
We love hearing from our readers over the past three years about how we've offered them an avenue to better themselves physically and mentally. How we've shown them options and services in the Edmonton area that they didn't know existed. We've heard from businesses who have grown over that time because of their involvement with YEG Fitness. But all of this wouldn't have been possible without our readers and followers on social media. 


    Other Ways You Can Help We don't charge for our magazine. We never have. We never will. It will be available for free at studios and wellness locations throughout the Edmonton area. Health and fitness doesn't always have to have a cost associated with it and we feel that by providing a free source of information, we can help people find their now level of personal fitness and wellness regardless of the financial abilities. 
If you are unable to help us financially, please help us by spreading the word about our project through your social media channels. As a bonus, the person who helps us spread the word the most using the built in Indiegogo channels will get a double pass to our launch party. 
Once the magazine launches in January, let us know what you think. We're always aiming to improve our product and appreciate the feedback whether good or bad. It's all valued.

story:
What is Works in Progress?

  • Works in Progress is a multimedia project started by MA publishing students at University College London. It is a collection of short stories written by New York-based authors, each with its own individual soundtrack and illustration created by artists from around the world.

How does it work?

  • The collection will be published in both print and E-book format, and each story will be allocated a QR-code that readers can scan using an electronic device such as mobile or tablet. The QR-code will link readers to our website for additional content, as well as more information about the authors and artists.

What do we hope to achieve?

  • Works in Progress is all about discovering young and exciting new talent! As student publishers, it is our goal to become a platform for which artists can establish themselves as authors, illustrators, and musicians. We are a multinational project, bringing to life the creativity of a diverse group of people through the medium of storytelling, art, and music.

Why do we need your help?

  • We are starting entirely from scratch, and as MA publishing students, we ourselves do not have the necessary funds to complete our project. We need money for print, shipping and distribution, website expenses, and marketing. Any sum you would be willing to donate is greatly appreciated as we try to reach our goal of £3,500. All contributors will be acknowledged in the dedication pages of the book, but be sure to check out our perks list for extra benefits!


Below you can see a few quotes from our stories!

story:
December 12, 2013 - Update!

Thanks to the generosity of a few fabulous donors, we beat our $1,500 goal in one day last week. Our initial goal aimed to cover the cost of just one aspect of our pilot: the sanitary pads. So now, we're upping the ante.

We've raised our goal to $7,500.

Fully funded, this will cover the costs of a three month pilot from beginning to end (it will involve more women than we had initially planned for, too!).

More women (for you nerds out there) means more data on what women like and want, which in turn will help us build the case for how a simple product like a sanitary pad can help women live more productive and healthy lives. This pilot will also allow us to explore and refine our model as we learn more about community preferences, ability to pay and price points, and baseline education levels regarding menstrual hygiene management. Long-term, our hope is to identify a model which generates more than enough revenue to cover its operating costs.

Make a tax-deductible donation today!

--

About Us

Globally, over 500 million women lack access to options for managing their periods. Lack of access to sanitary pads can limit a girl's ability to participate in school, work and life. In order to improve women's access to safe and effective solutions, we are working to increase access to low-cost, eco-friendly sanitary pads for girls in Chibuto, Mozambique.

Our team came together as a result of several “Aha!” moments shared across the globe. As a Peace Corps Volunteer in Mozambique, Gracey collaborated with girls in an after school group. Once the young women grew comfortable with her, they began showing up regularly at her house to ask for sanitary pads. Gracey will always remember one girl, Maria, describing how challenging it was for her to be active during her period without adequate menstrual protection. For all of us, such stories drive our passion to make this situation better for all women.

Gracey and Binaisa worked together from 2008-2010 to create a cultural center in Chibuto. This cultural center will now act as the “hub” of our micro-consignment model to distribute sanitary pads locally.

Next Steps

Currently, we are looking to bring several types of eco-friendly sanitary pads to a small community -- Chibuto -- to learn more from local women about the products they prefer, and explore sustainable models to deliver more sanitary pads to women. This campaign will cover some of the costs associated with conducting the Chibuto pilot (i.e., product costs, shipping costs and capacity building). 

The Pilot

Three women in the community will be selling eco-friendly sanitary pads, and providing health education around menstrual hygiene. These three women will earn a commission for each product sold. Girls and women in the community will benefit from increased access to sanitary pads, and have the opportunity to give input on the products they prefer. The results from this pilot will be used to inform scale up and to achieve a permanent solution to address the local lack of access to sanitary pads. 

If we don't reach our goal, we'll have to buy fewer pads, but we will be sending them no matter what!

What You'll Get

Your support is foundational in a long-term plan to support women in Chibuto. In return, we'll offer social media shout-outs, postcards, stories from those you've supported, and love from us and our global team.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out!
  • Share your knowledge in this area.
  • Make introductions, help us build our network of solution-seekers.
  • Tweet!
  • Share this campaign on Facebook.

story:
SINOSSI di Simone Ignagni 

"Cos’è, per voi, l’orrore?

Demoni? Mostri deformi? Sangue che fuoriesce a fiotti da una ferita?

Vi basta così poco per tremare?

O forse… pensateci bene… forse è quel brivido che sentite quando vi fermate a osservare un incidente, allungando lo sguardo in cerca di un possibile cadavere. O magari è l’ipocrisia nascosta dentro una vecchia, lurida bugia. Oppure – ecco, forse ci siamo – sta nei vostri occhi, voltati dall’altra parte di fronte a una nefandezza, nel vostro far finta di niente.

Tanto poi passa, vi dite.

Ma, attenzione, niente passa senza lasciare tracce.

I SEGRETI DELLA SCOGLIERA parla proprio di questo, di te che leggi e di me che scrivo, del marcio che abbiamo dentro tutti, che condiziona le nostre azioni e reazioni e ci trasforma in animali capaci di fare del male, o che ci rende conniventi grazie all’aiuto del silenzio.

È facile il silenzio, è comodo… solo che rischia, alla lunga, di turbare i sonni tranquilli di chiunque.

Ed è una particolare forma di silenzio, creativo, quello che cerca il protagonista del romanzo, Giuseppe Scrimieri, scrittore di successo, quando decide di acquistare una casa a Torre Del Fiume, paesino del Salento arroccato sulla scogliera, in cui aveva trascorso le sue estati fin da bambino.

 

Proprio a quel piccolo angolo di paradiso Giuseppe deve il suo grande successo, essendosi ispirato a luoghi e personaggi del posto per dar vita al suo primo best-seller Il Villaggio Dell’Orrore.

Il libro era stato un caso letterario, ma oltre alla fama gli aveva portato fin troppi guai, e quello che poteva sembrare il semplice esordio di uno scrittore di belle speranze aveva scatenato l’ira degli abitanti del paese, colti nel vivo, in quell’anima nera che era rimasta nascosta al mondo esterno per così tanto tempo.

Di questo Giuseppe Scrimieri è consapevole, ma pensa sia tutto finito alle spalle ormai, cicatrizzato in qualche ricordo spiacevole, qualche insinuazione di troppo, qualche turista curioso. Ciò che lo scrittore ignora, è che il suo ritorno risveglierà quel male oscuro, mai del tutto sopito, pronto a cibarsi ancora di sangue e follia.

Nadia e Guendalina Mele, Maria Cipressi e Pasquale Vivaldi, Giovanni e Aldo Scarcia, personaggi a tutto tondo, descritti e animati con mano sapiente, saranno i figuranti di un dramma così mostruoso proprio perché autentico, universale, tanto che il vortice in cui verrà risucchiato Giuseppe diventerà il baratro nel quale tutti rischiamo di precipitare.

Perché il mostro è in ognuno di noi, pronto ad attaccare, disposto a negare fino alla fine, capace di mentire e di cambiare maschera continuamente, per semplice sopravvivenza.

Facendo sua la crudezza e l’efficacia dei maestri del brivido, da Poe a Lovecraft, passando per Stephen King, Marco Esposito confeziona un thrilling diretto e tagliente, con sfumature horror, capace di sedurvi pagina dopo pagina, fino a travolgervi nel crescendo finale, in cui il ritmo incalzante e i colpi di scena vi lasceranno senza fiato."

CHI SONO

Mi chiamo Marco Esposito, sono un ingegnere leccese di 29 anni e scrivo da quando ne avevo dieci. Tre anni fa, nel 2010, pubblicai una raccolta di racconti brevi scritti in adolescenza, "SOGNI DI UNA NOTTE INSONNE", totalmente esaurita (salvo 4 copie) e ormai fuori produzione. 

A questo link (www.facebook.com/sogninotteinsonne) trovate la pagina di quel libro.

Questo nuovo romanzo è stato scritto nella solitudine della mia casa al mare, in pieno inverno, e credo che trasudi di quegli odori, suoni e sensazioni.

Perchè scrivo? Perchè mi piace da morire. 

COSA MI SERVE

Non so quale potrebbe essere il sogno di ogni scrittore, ma so con certezza qual'è il mio. CONDIVIDERE. Sogno che tutto il mondo possa un domani leggere le mie storie. Vorrei arrivare a più gente possibile, trasmettere anche solo in parte le emozioni che provo quando scrivo le mie storie, o meglio, quando le vivo portandole su carta.

Per poterlo fare si ha bisogno soprattutto di una casa editrice che ci creda veramente. Ma sopratutto, in un mercato in crisi come quello di oggi, scommettere su un esordiente ha dei costi esorbitanti, specialmente se si vuole investire in promozione. 

Ecco perchè ho bisogno di voi, di tutti voi che credete in me, che magari avete già letto I SEGRETI DELLA SCOGLIERA o gli altri racconti, e ne siete rimasti colpiti. I soldi che riuscirò a raccogliere serviranno per coprire in parte i costi di produzione, in modo da dare all'eventuale casa editrice la possibilità di investire sopratutto sulla promozione del libro, per renderlo un vero BEST-SELLER. 

Tutti coloro che contribuiranno, anche solo con un euro, saranno menzionati nei ringraziamenti del libro; a chi investirà di più offrirò il vecchio romanzo in pdf.

Chi offrirà almeno 10 euro, riceverà la copia del romanzo, una volta pubblicato, con tanto di autografo e dedica (il prezzo di copertina finale sarà di 14 euro).

Metterò inoltre in palio alcuni racconti inediti e, per pochi fortunati, le ultime 4 copie del vecchio romanzo ancora in circolazione, con tanto di dedica.

LA RICOMPENSA PIU' GRANDE SARA' LA MIA GRATITUDINE IMMENSA, PER OGNUNO DI VOI.

story:
This has been quite an adventure, this life.  I can remember reading my children's book "Funny Pennies" to my adopted son, trying to get him to go to sleep.  Fast forward through a blur of twenty-odd years, my son all grown up with children of his own...and now it appears to have come full circle, since his own daughter, Sofia (my grand daughter), wrote her own children's book, which she reads to me (but not to help me sleep).

Raising a "troubled teen" as a single parent was challenging enough, but I decided to challenge myself even further by attempting a writing career.  Not always successful, I realize now that I often chose my son over my literary aspirations.     My choice.  No regrets.  But now I have the awesome opportunity to merge my two loves and create a small press with my grand daughter, publishing books for children by children.

Sofia is our spokesperson for Minky Ink, and will be promoting our organization wherever and whenever needed (provided it's not past her bedtime).  Reading to children in groups will allow them to see what someone their own age can accomplish, perhaps giving them the confidence and the inspiration needed to write their own book.  This is our diabolical plan, at least.

But.

Publishing children's books can get expensive.  Although it is free to publish online, we will need funds for the hiring of illustrators, purchasing copies of the actual books to give away to school libraries and children's hospitals, promotional materials from VistaPrint, such as posters, banners, business cards, stress balls (and other fun giveaway items), the rental of tables or booths at comic conventions or book fairs.  

This all adds up rather quickly.  

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU TO EVERYONE FOR ALL OF THEIR HELP!  WE HAVE HAD GREAT RESPONSE TO OUR CAMPAIGN (but can still use the financial aid - the clock is ticking!).  

THANKS TO ALL WHO ARE ON BOARD.  YOU KNOW WHO YOU ARE.

LATEST UPDATE:

SOFIA HAS HER VERY FIRST READING IN SANTA MONICA, CA. ON JUNE 1ST AT A FAMILY LITERACY EVENT, SPONSORED BY MYSTIC JOURNEY BOOKSTORE.  SHE'LL BE READING HER BOOK AND THEN SIGNING COPIES FOR ANYONE WHO WANTS ONE.  WE ARE ALL SO VERY PROUD AND EXCITED!

Oh! And we just got some business cards made.  If we've got the cards, we must be in business.

 

Light, love, laughter, Keith Malinsky & Sofia Trujillo

story:
For me, it was all about the genes not the gender.  My father, grandfather and uncles were all orthodox rabbis born and schooled in Poland. But I was my father’s Yentl, always curious about my father’s passion for studying Torah but not able to secure a seat at the table of learners. No one expected me to become a rabbi until I did at the age of forty-eight.

Fast forward 22 years, and I am on Indiegogo because I have written about my unlikely journey. Today, I am asking for your generosity to help me share my life lessons.

 My memoir, You Are the Book, records the struggles and rewards of being a female clergy in the 21st century.  It takes the reader behind the scenes and gives you a sneak preview into the life of a female rabbi whose destiny was shaped by her immigrant family, a traditional marriage, a disruptive divorce, gender discrimination, racial violence, and the growth of interfaith and inter-religious dialogue.
 
This book is for anyone who has ever pursued a dream and, even though there were obstacles and detours, fulfilled it against all odds.
 
If you would like to contribute, we have levels of perks to thank you for your support.


 Thank you for your financial consideration enabling me to share my story with the greater public so that future readers may be able to forge their own path towards fulfillment.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have put my heart and soul into this memoir, and it truly has been a labor of love. The book is in the final stages of productions, and I'm seeking $5,000 to offset the costs of editing, publishing, and printing the book.

If you would like to contribute, we have levels of perks to thank you for your support. 

$18 You will receive a personal thank you note.
 
$36  A signed copy of the book to anyone.
 
$180 Public recognition at launch party and two signed copies of the book.
 
$360 I will come to your organization or group to speak about the book (Transportation will need to be provided when outside of the DC area)
        
$1800 Shabbaton Friday evening or Saturday afternoon or evening (Transportation and lodging fees required)

 

The Impact

I hope to begin a conversation about contemporary Judaism and the role of women in the clergy.  I want to take my book to synagogues, churches, and other places of worship and encourage women to "lean in" to realize their true potential.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, perhaps you could share my crowdfunding campaign on Facebook, Twitter, blogs, email and other social media outlets. You could also buy a book for a friend, family member or colleague or ask your community to sponsor a reading.

I appreciate your consideration of helping me share my story so that future readers might be inspired to take challenges that no one has before.

 

Book launch

Please join us for our book launch celebration

When: Sunday, June 11, 2017 at 5:00 p.m. 

Where: Historic Sixth & I Synagogue

 

For questions or inquiries, please email tamara.i.miller@gmail.com

story:
Our Story

Necropolis Press is a small publishing company.  We formed in January 2011 wth a few hundred dollars and a dream.  Our staff consists of two college professors and graphic designer.  Our backgrounds are in history, psychology, and literature, with several publishing credits.  We do not get salaries for our work.  The only compensation allotted to our contributors comes from book sales. 


Our primary goal is to produce inexpensive titles in our "Classroom Classics" series: works of classic literature (especially genre fiction - sci-fi, fantasy, horror, mystery, thriller, suspense, supernatural, etc.) for use in both the classroom and the living room.  Our secondary goal is to locate and publish fresh works of genre fiction by new and emerging writers.


Our Classroom Classics include new introductions, explanatory footnotes, study guide questions, and - utilizing the talents of new and emerging artists - custom cover art.  The volumes are easy to read, informative, educational, and attractive.  For teachers looking for something different in the classroom - for readers who always meant to read "that book" but have not.  We want these titles preserved and read, as inexpensively as possible.


The Impact

We all know how expensive textbooks have become.  At the same time, genre fiction is often ignored as a useful supplement in high school and college classrooms.  Our Classroom Classics series seeks to address both of these issues, publishing sturdy, attractive, but inexpensive volumes, with extra information and study guide questions for application in English, History, and other appropriate courses.  We keep our prices as low as possible (usually between $8-$15, depending on page count), while still compensating contributors.  By keeping our overhead low, we can keep our costs low, thus making our publications attractive to a wider audience.


What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $1000.  This amount will cover the administration costs for more than a dozen Classroom Classics titles, freeing up money from sales to compensate our contributors and search for new writers to publish.


We produce four volumes in the Classroom Classics every six months (June / Dec).  For example, in June 2011, we published:

1) "Dracula" - Bram Stoker

2) "War of the Worlds" - H.G. Wells

3) "A Picture of Dorian Grey" - Oscar Wilde

4) "The Thing from the Lake" - Eleanor Ingram.

We also published the 2nd Edition of original novel "A Life in Chiaroscuro" by author Paul-Thomas Ferguson.

You can look inside these volumes at Amazon.com if you would like to see the work we are doing.


Achieving our fundraising goal would allow us to cover administrative costs at least through the end of 2012, for a minimum of 12 new Classroom Classics.  Titles slated for publication in December 2011 are:

1) "The Geneva Collection - Frankenstein / The Vampyre / and Fragments (Mary Shelley, John Polidori, Percy Shelley, and Lord Byron)"

2) "Journey to the Center of the Earth" - Jules Verne

3) "The Murders in the Rue Morgue and other Mysteries" - Edgar Allan Poe

4) "The House on the Borderland" - William Hope Hodgson


June 2012 titles are still under review, but will continue along the same vein.  If we do not reach our entire goal, we will produce as many volumes as we can and supplement our funds with future fundraising efforts.  Every dime donated goes toward administrative costs (and whatever incentives your donation trigger.) 


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to donating, we sell our products at Amazon.com.  Please look up our titles.  And, of course, the more you spread the word, the better chance we have of finding donors who appreciate what we are trying to accomplish.  Feel free to liberally use the various share buttons to carry our message to your friends in email and on social media sites.  Thank you!

story:
Life mirroring art

A term often heard, but how often can we point to incidences of it actually happening. Now comes the opportunity to be involved in a literary project that has a ‘shot’ at having a tangible, grass-roots impact in real-life.

The novel at the heart of this, The Second Amendment, is already mostly finished. Copies are already available on Amazon Kindle as an e-book (so you can partly check out this project in advance) – so what will the funds be used for?

The book has already gone through two edit phases. There’ll be a final edit phase, plus getting The Second Amendment produced as both a trade paperback and hardback. Those ‘final edit’ editions will also include the names (in an acknowledgement section at the back) of all the people who have helped take this project to the ‘next level’ – which means YOU (picture Lord Kitchener pointing to you from a poster).

 

The Next Level

At the core of the plot in ‘The Second Amendment’ is a thesis which could have impact in real life on the way gun control is viewed in the USA. In the book, the far-right want to ensure it doesn’t come to fruition. The battle lines are drawn and a hard-edged conflict ensues. 

Now that thesis was based on my own research at the time of what might work in real life. Using my experience and contacts as a past political magazine editor and novelist, I was in touch with numerous gun control supporters: Congressmen, Senators and Brady Campaign supporters (including veteran actor Paul Newman three years before his death, a keen gun control advocate). Many were supportive, and out of that a thesis gained shape.

But that thesis is still in raw, embryonic form. Only so much detail was needed for it to play a part in a thriller, and the main research was done some ten years ago. It needs updating, fleshing out and shaping as a final document that could actually work in practice. This will entail exhaustive further research amongst gun-control support groups, political leaders and lobbyists. Hard facts and figures will be required to back up the thesis/proposal.

Most importantly, once completed, it will be sent to Congressmen, Senators, lobbyists and support groups who might actually be able to guide that thesis/proposal towards implementation in real life. Therefore transforming an initial art/literary project into one which could have real grass roots impact on future gun control legislation. And that final thesis, as with the last edit of book, The Second Amendment’, will also include the names of all those who’ve offered their support in taking the project to that ‘next level’ (again, YOU). This is what the majority of funding will go towards.

 

A brief history lesson 

The problem with gun control is that it’s written in the Constitution as a core right of the people, straight after The First Amendment on free speech. Now the reasons for that are perfectly understandable: without guns in the American War of Independence, Americans might still be sipping tea or have a picture of the British Queen above their fireplaces. Of course, the Brits, being polite and accommodating, also had their soldiers wear bright red uniforms so that they were easy to pick off.

But the actual wording of the Second Amendment (possibly in light of that history), didn’t simply give leave for all Americans to carry arms on a loose, general basis. It was tied specifically to militia and national defence, as follows: ‘A well regulated Militia, being necessary to the security of a free state, the right of the people to keep and bear arms, shall not be infringed.’

Now unfortunately that isn’t what has happened in the evolution of gun distribution and/or limited control. ‘Some’ sections of US society are reasonably regulated and trained and could be seen as a valuable militia to support national defence; but the vast majority are not, and ‘Saturday night specials’ can come out for anything from fender benders to a neighbour playing their radio too loud.

So this made me look towards a nation that does have a proliferation of guns specifically for the purpose of national defence: Switzerland. Partly as a result of its neutrality, Switzerland historically (until a partial reduction in 2004) has had an ‘on call’ private militia army constituting almost 30% of all eligible Swiss males between the age of 18-50, making it pro-rata the second largest reservist army in the world (after Israel). In the USA this would equate to an on call reservist army of almost 20 million, six times its current size (standing army and reservists).

However, 90% of the weapons of this Swiss ‘on call’ militia army are held in the private homes of militia members (generally in secure, locked cupboards). Furthermore, upon induction militia members are trained in the use of those weapons and have regular refresher courses. But despite such a proliferation of weapons in private homes, incidences of these weapons being used against their fellow Swiss are practically unheard of. Would this then better represent the ethos of what the original Constitution drafters had in mind when they linked arms to ‘militia’ in The Second Amendment? And, more to the point, could such a system possibly work in practical terms in the USA?

 

Shaping the proposal for today’s USA?

The Swiss model has many merits which would transpose well to the USA: the locked cupboard or casing would deter casual shootings; it should also prevent guns being fired by accident, as in the case of children, an increasing hot-button area of concern. The induction and training, apart from aiding a militia to be more efficient, should also help people be more responsible with the use of firearms. Driving a car requires passing a rigid test, so why not guns as well?

But in order to satisfy The Second Amendment, those arms (in a locked case at home, with initial induction training) should be available to all Americans upon request. Guns would not be allowed to be carried freely on the street (which follows more the Canadian model and is the law in a number of US states). Those uncomfortable about having a gun at home could nominate a local neighbourhood warden to carry their gun for them. A local warden could also be an option for the carrying of automatic weapons.   

The initial thesis in The Second Amendment added an extra twist to that home gun case; a glass front, similar to fire alarms, with the sticker: ‘Only to be smashed in the case of national emergency’. The only other allowable incidence would be if there was a cogent threat (an intruder or burglar). The act of smashing the case would then ring an alarm in the local police station. Handy, being able to call reinforcements for that intruder, but not so handy if your aim was to shoot your neighbour; all things being equal, the police should arrive while the gun was still smoking (or in an ideal world, before you’d fired – but let’s not get too carried away here about police efficiency :)

A pin-numbered case would be another option. Also, in the age of GPS, an alarm if that gun case was moved from the house. These are all elements the final thesis would investigate and expound upon.

The other key element the final thesis would study is that of amnesty. An enormous number of guns are already in circulation in the USA, so perhaps some sort of trade off between those weapons and the newly ‘allowable’ weapons to be held in a case at home? Also, what sort of time scale would be workable for such an amnesty to take effect? What restrictions and penalties would then be placed on the weapons that fell outside of the new regulations?

 

Main aim and pricing structure

The main aim is to get as many support names as possible for the final thesis proposal to be presented to the powers that be. Fifty or so names probably wouldn’t make much of an impact, but several hundred or a thousand (or more) would. So I’ll be pricing this lean and mean and offering exceptional value for money.

So as a high-volume-name and low-price exercise, I won’t be adding fridge magnets, posters or Second Amendment T-shirts and bathrobes to inflate the upper-level packages. Besides which, wearing the latter within telescopic range of GOA or NRA members might get you shot :)

It will just be the plain book in its different formats and the final thesis, with your name added with thanks in both. So that for the price of the average Grisham or Clancy novel (far less in e-book format), you can be a part of a unique ‘life mirroring art’ project and have your name included in the roster of those who actually tried to make a difference.  

 

About the author

John Matthews is the British author of nine novels: Basikasingo, Crescents of the Moon, Past Imperfect, The Last Witness, The Shadow Chaser, Ascension Day, The Prophet, BlindSchool and The Second Amendment. And two film screenplays: Of Lesser Angels and BlindSchool. In between writing novels, he has been a travel courier, war-zone journalist and editor of a range of magazines from decor and architecture to computer technology and politics. Between 1996-1998, he was editor of European Brief, the main magazine for the European Parliament.

His books have sold a total of 1.2 million and been translated into twelve languages. In 2007, Past Imperfect was included in a list in The Times (London) of top ten all-time best legal thrillers.

story:
Hi!

My name is Gilles DeCruyenaere, and I'm working on self-publishing my first novel, a science fiction story titled “I Dreamt of Trees”.


What's It About?

Flasher in training Jason Crawford has dedicated his life to fighting the mysterious alien race which threatens the massive city-ship he calls home. Just weeks away from graduation, however, Jason discovers a terrible secret which could mean an end to his way of life forever. Fearing government reprisal for this newfound knowledge, Jason takes refuge in the Rim, a walled-off section of the ship where citizens are left to fend for themselves while the government ruthlessly plunders its resources.

While there, Jason forms an uneasy alliance with fellow exile Greg. Though they share the same goal of exposing the government's terrible secret, their relationship is strained; Jason is selfish, profane and morally ambiguous, while Greg is generous, kind and liberal-minded.

Will Jason and Greg manage to achieve their goals despite their ideological differences? Will Jason ever escape the Rim, and if so, can he hope to regain anything even resembling the life of entitlement to which he was accustomed?

"I Dreamt of Trees" is a story of struggle and survival in a dystopian society built on fear and greed, where no one is quite as good, nor quite as bad as they seem.


How Will Your Contributions Help?

Your contributions through this campaign will help cover the cost of self-publishing and marketing of my novel. More specifically, you will be helping with:

– The conversion of my manuscript to digital reader formats, and distribution of my ebook to various online retailers.

– The printing of physical copies of my book to stock at local retail booksellers.

– An official book launch at a local book store here in Winnipeg, along with a newspaper ad for said launch.

– Artwork commissioned from local artist Graeme Borland, which will be used for marketing purposes both during and after the campaign.


What Are the Perks?

As a contributor you will be able to choose from a variety of exciting rewards, such as digital and physical copies of the book, t-shirts, and prints of Graeme Borland's excellent artwork. See the “Perks" section on the right of this page for details.

Digital and/or print copy of "I Dreamt of Trees". (Print copy signed by the author).T-shirt bearing the logo of the Elite Flasher Squad – designed by the author.

Hi!

My name is Gilles DeCruyenaere, and I'm working on self-publishing my
first novel, a science fiction story titled “I Dreamt of Trees”.



What's It About?

Flasher in training
Jason Crawford has dedicated his life to fighting the mysterious
alien race which threatens the massive city-ship he calls home. Just weeks away from graduation, however, Jason discovers a terrible
secret which could mean an end to his way of life forever. Fearing
government reprisal for this newfound knowledge, Jason takes refuge
in the Rim, a walled-off section of the ship where citizens are left
to fend for themselves while the government ruthlessly plunders its
resources.


While
there, Jason forms an uneasy alliance with fellow exile Greg. Though
they share the same goal of exposing the government's terrible
secret, their relationship is strained; Jason is selfish, profane and
morally ambiguous, while Greg is generous, kind and liberal-minded.


Will Jason and Greg
manage to achieve their goals despite their ideological differences?
Will Jason ever escape the Rim, and if so, can he hope to regain
anything even resembling the life of entitlement to which he was
accustomed?


"I Dreamt of Trees" is
a story of struggle and survival in a dystopian society built on fear
and greed, where no
one is quite as good, nor quite as bad as they seem.
