story:
Intro to my Book Project:   

I'm an author with a degree in Art and Education and a qualified guidance counsellor specialist. I've had a rewarding career for over 35 years in many art related fields from a television art director, University art instructor, designer and freelance radio Art talk show host, but always been an artist. I was told I had a pencil in hand at age two.   

I would like to relate back my experiences in this new book that will be helpful to creative people with anxiety related issues. The book shares my knowledge and experiences with motivating ideas to focus on the ups and those downs in an arts career. There  are some interviews by well known artists and how they dealt with their anxieties. Anxiety still has false assumptions by the public. The focus here in on strategies you can use to help your angst diminish; regain your love of creating art. My state wasn't uncommon.

As an artist, have you ever lost interest in the thing you love doing the most? Have you ever looked at a large white paper and all it did was bring on anxiety. It's happened to me! 

I suddenly lost interest in creating watercolours several years ago, which was a passion for along time, and what occurred after was rather profound.  

Added to my state of being I was in a car accident not long after. I was hit by a car going through a red light. Lucky to stumble out of totalled new and well built VW, which insurance replaced. I got PTSD, two neck discs compressed. I became disinterested in more things, rather distressed and restless. I also had memory lapses and off and on depression. Treatment as pain relief medication and chiropractic therapy and more. It dragged on as I had to take funds from my Investments, which I should never have had to. My lawyer took care of that.

This incident set me back, not able to teach, lack of focus and multi-tasking was not to be. My mind and body lost its old schedule, and needed renewal and did. Soon something began to click and was creating with a new mixed media.

My art website of new artwork at:  http://artistprints.ca

One thing that helped was my doctor advising me to get away from the stressors in my environment. So I went to Toronto and Miami 4 months after. It was an amazing change; more inspiring state, also with less pain. I brought my art portfolio, did some prior planning and sold art. Great!

Back at my home studio, I began scanning prior art & photographs into my computer, manipulating them into new creations using appropriate applications. That was therapeutic, back into the love of creating in a new way. Yoga and regular exercise was helpful and meditation. 

What Purpose Does this Book Have.

There are so many creative people that I have read about that have lost their creative urge, not on the same happy path as before. I hope this book will help to bring out that Artist within you, as I convey my experiences, with writings, advice from doctors, psychologists to artists' interviews of their issues, in collaboration. 

This book called 'ANXIETY AND THE ARTIST WITHIN' is more about Art as therapy to re-inspire your inner creative self which has been stuck in some void psychologically as anxiety to depression. It is keeping  you from moving ahead being off a schedule. It could be the fear of failure. For me things often became overwhelming. If you have had a love of creating art then it can surely be rekindled again. That's what my book is about- To help you confront those blocks, get ahead.

Does this art bring on an emotive feeling? 'Distant Island' can relate back to the viewer a feeling of loneliness to sadness. My art confronts my 'separation anxiety'.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding needed is $5500. [CAD] to Publish this 2nd book of mine related to Art.     ~It will be self published and I am looking for a wide audience that will benefit from this book. The incentives for your $5. to $400. contributions are quite generous, as you may be getting my special thank you art card, a copies of the book, to my artwork and neat t-shirt.  

My website is: http://artistprints.ca  [to view and choose an artwork] if you donate $400. Simply if you do, I would need your address/e-mail. See PERKS! >

The Impact

Whatever CONTRIBUTION you make it adds up to help create this important self help book on rediscovering that inner artist IN YOU and control anxiety, getting rid of roadblocks that are stopping you from that passion for art. It is not uncommon to lose interest even in what you love. Art Therapy is the key to help let out your emotions and see art in a new way. I've been there and I got re-inspired. If I can, so can you. This book is not about how to get rich, but gives strategies; it is to get you working, resilient again in a better direction. The book will focused on attitude and being positive. Money comes when you find yourself clear minded and regain that buying audience. Don't let anxiety label you as failing. It's quite the opposite. Go travel to be away from stressors and discover new way of seeing things. 

My previous book, [See Perks]being my first published in 2011 was called; ‘Culturally Submerged, Journey of a White Rez Teacher’. It is a unique book about my experiences as an Art Instructor in many First Nations remote reserves in N.W. Ontario. I had 'separation anxiety' at times, being away from family; it helped taking time off between, then back to teaching. I stayed a 'survivor'.

It related about the good and not so good perceptions, from the funny to the shocking, [as student suicides] Those experiences of teaching in remote Aboriginal Communities in N.W. Ontario, away from my home in Thunder Bay, Ontario. 

Art as Therapy

The artwork above 'Distant Island' is about looking at art and creating 'Art as Therapy' as in this focus it is anxiety. However when you observe art, looking at it with an emotional relation can help you see art in a different way. An artwork can bring on emotive feelings of sadness, beauty, love, nature as what artist intended.  

When you have come out of the haze, as I did, you'll begin to create more art. You'll be more assertive in finding that buying audience. Again this is not a make a million dollars book, but it is a path to realize each moment is important. You won't lose that Artist in you.

More Stuff and Other Ways You Can Help

ADDED Bonus Incentive: If you donate $50.or more you'll receive a 'I Survived My Angst' t-shirt. Just specify the size, by e-mail. This is added to the existing 'Perks'.

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Tweet. Facebook. Email.
Thank you kindly.
~Vesa Peltonen   B.F.A.  B.Ed /Guidance counsellor, artist, art educator
Thunder Bay, ON. Canada  > Inquiries + Info: E-mail: vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com

Website:  http://artistprints.ca   [Also my BIO is there as well as accomplishments].

Short Summary

I want to write a book about the Istrian exodus (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Istrian_exodus).
The book will be a mix of interviews, story facts, pictures and poems.
I also want to check the status of the italian language in the slovene and croatian side.
---------------
Voglio scrivere un libro sull'esodo istriano.
Questo raccoglierà interviste, fatti, fotografia e poesie.

What We Need & What You Get

First of all I need the money for the travel. I'm going to visit Gorizia, Nova Gorica, Trieste, San Dorligo della Valle, Capodistria, Fiume, Pola, Pirano and Rovigno.
As I said I want to interview some people and check the status of the italian language.
-------------------
Prima di tutto mi servono i soldi per il viaggio. Visiterò Gorizia, Nova Gorica, Trieste, San Dorligo della Valle, Capodistria, Fiume, Pola, Pirano e Rovigno.
Come ho detto voglio intervistare alcune persone e vedere lo stato della lingua italiana e soprattutto scrivere

The Impact

A lot of things were done and said. All I want to do is to try to tell the truth and more than that give the world something to remember what happened.
-----------------
Tante cose sono state fatte e dette. Ciò che voglio fare e dire la verità e soprattutto dare al mondo qualcosa per ricordare cosa è successo.

story:
Short Summary

What if you could take the lessons from martial arts to supercharge your life and career? In this book, I introduce 6 principles that will enable you to achieve just that. It is a book about achieving peak performance no matter where you find yourself, on the mat, in the ring, or in life.

Written for both martial artists and non-martial artists alike (entrepreneurs and success minded people will love this book too), you will learn,

  • Built into peak performance is imperfection, without it there is no success. Embracing imperfection is the only road to true personal success.
  • Your thoughts can get you into trouble in a performance environment. Find out how you can use your thinking mind the right way, to harness the power of peak performance.
  • How you show up in the world matters more than you think. Learn to change your body attitude, and you can change not only how you feel about yourself, but how others see you.
  • Being mindful is crucial to living in our chaotic world. But what you need more than anything is to be mindful in the action of life, not on a zafu. Learn how to cultivate mindfulness-in-action.
  • Breathing is something you should do more than just to survive. Learn about how breathing enlivens movement, and can calm you down in stressful moments of peak performance.
  • The true mark of successful people, are those who can bounce back from set-backs. Learn about the crucial ingredients to becoming more resilient.


What We Need & What You Get

Here is why I need your help:

  • Writing a book is a labor of love. But it takes time and money to bring to life. Your support will enable me to do this.
  • I have put some awesome perks together to the right. Your help, will enable me to get this book out to the world.
  • The money raised will be used primarily for paying the editor and for design costs. 

The Impact

Modern martial arts has become focused almost exclusively on the fight, either in a competitive arena, or reality based self defense. The Art, or what martial arts can do for a person beyond the 'fight' has been lost. This book is an attempt to heal the split between Martial and Art - in doing so I hope to show that the lessons learned on the mat in training, have far reaching consequences beyond simply learning to fight.

The main aim of this book, was to write a 'how to manual' that could be used by current martial artists and non-martial artists alike, and show them how to cultivate embodied intelligence, that could not only supercharge their martial art game, but help them achieve success off the mat, in life and career.

I believe that anyone, regardless if they have an interest in martial arts or not, will gain greatly from reading this book. The lessons presented will help anyone achieve peak performance be that in the boardroom, in a tough negotiation or to live more fully in life.
 

    Risks & Challenges

    Writing a book is a daunting task. It takes  a lot of time, sweat, and frustration. However with that said 90% of the work is already done. The only remaining obstacle now is,

    • Getting the book professionally edited.
    • Ensuring the book is professionally formatted for publishing.
    • While this book will be self-published, I am looking into further distribution channels (and that costs money).
    • I expect the book to be completed no later than end of February 2014. But I am aiming for sooner.


    Other Ways You Can Help & Art Exhibition

    I have teamed up with my artists friend, and fellow martial artists on the mat, Andy Robertson. What you will see in this book is some of his amazing work. Each piece was custom drawn to represent each section in the book.

    Going forward these are some extra ways you can help us out:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the book.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Along with the book, we will be presenting all the amazing art pieces Andy drew for this book at an art exhibition next year in Johannesburg (2015 - to be announced). When that happens, we would love to see you there, and of course, please tell the world.

story:
Honor Among Thieves 

"Mary-Anne has left East Africa and traded in her dusty cargo pants for business suits at the World Aid Corps (WAC) headquarters in Washington, D.C. Her first major assignment, planning a new corporate-funded project in a rural village in Cambodia, seems simple enough—at first. Before long, she is caught in a web of high-stakes (for the aid world) board room deals, conflicting priorities, and hidden agendas that threatens not only to rob her of her career, but devour her soul.

From the iridescent rice fields of the Mekong Delta, to the curiously named bars and teeming backstreets of Phnom Penh, Mary-Anne finds her journey inextricably tied to others: a bereaved Cambodian mother, an arrogant colleague with something to prove, and a demanding donor with something to gain. As she searches for the sweet spot between humanitarian idealism and donors’ expectations, will she be able to do what she knows in her heart is  right? Whose version of “helping” really helps? And in end, will she embrace the code of honor among humanitarians and thieves?

Veteran aid worker, blogger, and indie author J.   is weeks away from releasing book #2 in the Mary-Anne humanitarian fiction trilogy and sequel to the ground-breaking 2013 release, Missionary, Mercenary, Mystic, Misfit.

The manuscript is already written (currently at 97,000+ words) and will absolutely be published in early 2015. It just needs a little professional help to get ready. 
Contributions to this campaign will go toward that getting ready process, and help make the eventual released version of Honor Among Thieves as good as it can possible be!

What We Need & What You Get

Want to know more? Here's your support will be used, and what you get.

  • Contributions to this campaign/project will all go toward professional editorial assistance. J.'s last three books have been edited pro bono by a small team of editoresses (they slap J.'s manuscript around and he likes it). It's been awesome of them to help J. out for free, but we think they deserve to get paid something. Every last dime of your contribution goes to the editoresses, regardless of the total amount raised.

  • The Evil Genius Publishing reward system:
  • $10 or more gets you mentioned by name on the "Special Thanks" page of the published version (both ebook and print), plus a free ebook (PDF).
  • $50 or more gets you mentioned by name on the "Special Thanks" page of the published version (both ebook and print), plus a first edition printed copy.
  • $100 or more gets you mentioned by name on the "Special Thanks" page of the published version (both ebook and print), plus a first edition printed copy, signed by the author.
  • $500 or more gets you mentioned by name on the "Special Thanks" page of the published version (both ebook and print), a first edition printed copy signed by the author, and the author will name a character in the story after you.

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign/project, you're directly making the world better in three ways:

  • You're helping to further establish Evil Genius Publishing, a tiny indie publisher that focuses on the humanitarian industry: books by, for, and about aid workers. This will be Evil Genius' fourth unique publication. Every little bit of experience we get makes us all that much better.
  • You're contributing to the amount of writing and literature out there specifically for and about the humanitarian aid industry... that isn't dry, boring, pretentious, technocratic, academic drudgery. The medical field has Dean Koontz and Grey's Anatomy; the spy world has Robert Ludlum. But what do the aid world have? (Please, not Angelina Jolie or Ben Affleck.) Make the world better: support Evil Genius.
  • You're helping up to three aspiring editoresses gain real world experience. Writing is hard, and editing is harder. The world needs more of both. Be part of the solution.

Risks & Challenges

As we said above, the manuscript for this book has already been written: Honor Among Thieves will absolutely be published. It's just a matter of time, and a matter of what the final, published version will look like. Some of the primary challenges in releasing a book like this is that things tend to take longer than projected. 

Some specific things that might delay the release of Honor Among Thieves:

  • A big disaster happens and J. gets deployed.
  • The editoresses get slammed with real life (kids, day jobs, etc.), and take longer than expected.
  • Beta-readers (see below) take longer than expected to give their feedback.
How Evil Genius Publishing and the author work with these kinds of challenges:
  • Total transparency about delays, challenges, revised deadlines. We'll update the Evil Genius and Tales From the Hood (author's personal) Facebook pages with regular updates so that contributors and readers know what's going on.
  • Prioritize early release of the ebook, with later release of the print version. In our experience, the process of releasing the ebook tends to move more quickly, and so in a situation where real life takes over and we're more pressed for time than we'd anticipated, we'll still get the ebook out as quickly as possible, but hold off on the more labor-intensive print version release.
  • Make it right: If anyone--contributor to this project, reader--feels that we've not lived up to our promises, whether here or elsewhere, we welcome that feedback, and will do all we can to make it right.

"I made a contribution, but I want to do more..."

There are ways to support this project besides/in addition to financial contribution:

  • Be a beta-reader. You commit to reading and giving feedback on an early draft of Honor Among Thieves. 
  • Be a reviewer. Got a blog or a website? Help get the word out by reading a pre-release version of Honor Among Thieves and publishing your review on your site.
  • Want to edit pro bono? Okay, cool!
  • Good at design? Want to take a crack at putting the cover together (pro bono)?

Interested in any of these? Drop a line to evilgenius.pub1@gmail.com, or to the author at talesfromethehood@gmail.com.

Honor Among Thieves  
"Mary-Anne has left East Africa and traded in her dusty cargo
pants for business suits at the World Aid Corps (WAC) headquarters in
Washington, D.C. Her first major assignment, planning a new corporate-funded
project in a rural village in Cambodia, seems simple enough—at first. Before
long, she is caught in a web of high-stakes (for the aid world) board room
deals, conflicting priorities, and hidden agendas that threatens not only to
rob her of her career, but devour her soul.
From the iridescent rice fields of the Mekong Delta, to the
curiously named bars and teeming backstreets of Phnom Penh, Mary-Anne finds her
journey inextricably tied to others: a bereaved Cambodian mother, an arrogant
colleague with something to prove, and a demanding donor with something to gain.
As she searches for the sweet spot between humanitarian idealism and donors’
expectations, will she be able to do what she knows in her heart is  right? Whose version of “helping” really
helps? And in end, will she embrace the code of honor among humanitarians and
thieves?

story:
Your help is needed to publish an exciting new book.

The International Institute for Research and Education (IIRE) provides activists and scholars worldwide with opportunities for research and education in three locations: Amsterdam, Islamabad and Manila.

Since 1982, when our Institute opened in Amsterdam, its main activity has been the organisation of courses for activists and the publishing of books. We have organized educational courses and seminars for hundreds of activists and published dozens of books.

We believe that societies can and must be changed democratically from below. This change must be made primarily by those who suffer from exploitation, oppression and injustice.

Returns of Marxism was the name given to a seminar series that took place at the IIRE. The title of the series was intended to highlight the return of the discussion of Marxist themes. In recent years we have witnessed a renewed interest in Marx's thought, as a younger generation of scholars and activists have rediscovered Marx as a crucial source for the critique of the neo-liberal face of capitalism. In times of crisis like ours, there's a need for radical critiques of exploitation, inequality and alienation. Marx's thought is an immensely rich resource for such critiques.

The texts collected in this volume are all revised texts originally presented as papers during the seminar series. Returns of Marxism brings together contributions from scholars and activists from different traditions and generations for an urgent renewal of radical critique. Contributors include Guglielmo Carchedi, Chiara Bonfiglioli, Jeffery Webber, Katja Diefenbach, Marcel Van Der Linden and Peter D. Thomas. The book is edited by Sara R. Farris. Have a look at the complete table of contents here.

The IIRE has a lively publication program and the manuscript of Returns of Marxism is almost ready for the printer. What we need now is support for the costs of lay-out and printing. We only need to 1000 euros to finalize the book.

Have a look on our website to see all the other books we have published.

story:
Bones In The Dirt is a collection of memoir/investigative essays exploring narratives of trauma in Cambodia. I will be moving to Phnom Penh for the research and writing of Bones In The Dirt, and am seeking funding for living expenses while I work on the project.


My Story

I became interested in effects of war trauma in the Cambodian community through growing up with the children of Khmer Rouge survivors. As a child, I witnessed the powerful ways in which wartime experiences--which were rarely discussed--continued to affect my friends' family, through PTSD and family violence. Ultimately, the latter issue took my friends' parents' lives.

For many years I'd wanted to travel to Cambodia to understand what I had witnessed: to learn about the history that had never been openly discussed, and to place what I had seen into a larger context. This past spring I had that opportunity. As a Spring 2011 Glimpse Correspondent, I spent 2+ months living in Phnom Penh researching both Khmer Rouge history and its long-term effects, and published a feature piece, "Bones Surfacing in the Dirt, Thirty Years Later," based on this experience.

I came away, however, with the overwhelming feeling that I had only begun. In my limited time, I was able to learn only a little. The main thing I learned was how much more complex, difficult and muddled the issues are, and how deeply rooted the Khmer Rouge and the effects of trauma have become in the culture. I also realized that I had my own experiences with personal trauma, which began to resurface while I was in Cambodia.

I've decided to move back to Phnom Penh to expand my initial Glimpse project into a book-length collection of narrative essays, both investigative and memoir, exploring the personal and societal effects of trauma. I am committing to an initial period of one year, though I suspect I'll be out there longer.

I'll be spending my time in Phnom Penh researching and writing. I'm an established freelance writer already working in the narrative genre. My work has appeared in 7x7, San Francisco Chronicle, Huffington Post, World Hum and Matador, and I hold a BA in Creative Writing from San Francisco State University. I also maintain a narrative travel blog, Lonely Girl Travels, which is syndicated on lonelyplanet.com. To aid my research, I will be volunteering with two local NGOs that deal with issues of domestic violence, poverty and literacy, and taking Khmer language lessons.

I will be posting regular updates about the project, my findings and experiences on my blog, so you can all follow along!

The Impact

The ultimate goal of Bones In The Dirt is to give voice to the "new" generation of Cambodians, growing up in the shadow of the Khmer Rouge, and by extension, all of us who live with trauma and/or inherited trauma. The long-term, intergenerational effects of trauma have been studied among the children of Holocaust survivors but not yet, to my knowledge, among the descendants of Khmer Rouge survivors. I believe this is an important story, one that has yet to be told. I hope to be able to do it justice.


What I Need

Funding will be used to cover my living expenses while researching and writing Bones In The Dirt.


Monthly living expenses in Phnom Penh will be approximately $600, including:
  • $150 / rent and utilities
  • $50 / health insurance
  • $100 / Khmer language lessons
  • $300 / food, transport, etc

The remaining revenue will be generated through a combination of personal savings and income from continued freelance writing.

Other Ways To Help

Spread the word! Let folks know about my project. And if you have any contacts in Cambodia, or know of people/NGOs working on similar issues, let me know about them!

story:
The Project

Lentil as Anything: Everybody deserves a place at the table is Shanaka Fernando’s autobiography. In this book he shares his childhood in Sri Lanka, his travelling years exploring the lifestyles of indigenous people all around the world, and his creation of the Lentil as Anything pay-as-you-feel vegetarian restaurants. The book has recently been published (at our expense and for no profit).  This project is about raising money for the second print run of this book, and so that we can continue to spread the message that generosity, tolerance and an inclusive attitude to community are what the world needs.

Who I am

My name is Greg Hill and I have been writing and editing for many years now, usually long term projects for myself or others, sometimes academic and other work for clients. I live in Melbourne with my wife and son and two cats and a dog.

The path I try to walk involves my own personal growth, education and betterment, so that I can hopefully make a positive difference on this planet. Publishing and promoting Lentil as Anything: Everybody deserves a place at the table is a significant part of this.

About Shanaka and his book

Lentil as Anything: Everybody deserves a place at the table is about a man who has started  a social revolution in Melbourne. Shanaka inspires by example, leading  a simple, modest life as he challenges us in advocating an inclusive, ethical approach to business and life, and a belief in the innate goodness and generosity of our fellow humans.

Shanaka was named Local Hero in the Australia Day awards in 2007 for his non-profit, socially responsible Lentil as Anything restaurants. In his restaurants it is people, not property, that qualify life: ‘You get fed and treated with dignity even if you don’t have any money, and the colour of your skin and your education and your beliefs only put you on a par with everyone else.’

He is a modern day folk hero, offering an alternative way of living which is not based on consumerism, profit and greed. This alternative is being recognized. His Holiness the Dalai Lama asked for Shanaka to join him when he appeared on MasterChef late last year, and from 2009 the Australian Government’s Values Education program, administered by the Department of Education, Employment and Workplace Relations, has delivered to all Australian schools At What Price, a Primary School resource about Lentil’s values. 

The book has a very strong media presence and Shanaka will be speaking at many events, including at Adelaide Writer’s Week where he will be sharing the platform with Andrea Hirato, the author of the The Rainbow Troops, to discuss the topic: It Starts in a Village.

For further information about Shanaka, look online. His very prominent 18 minute TEDxTalk, for example, is sensational and can be found at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jodpW59On7g.

What is ‘Lentil’?

Lentil as Anything restaurants – currently existing in Abbotsford, St Kilda and Footscray – are restaurants where money takes a back seat to good food and good company. Patrons of the restaurants ‘pay-as-you-feel’ for their food, depositing whatever they choose to give into a money box. No one knows what anyone pays, and no one is watching to see if patrons even pay anything at all. The restaurants are challenging because patrons (many who soon become members of the loosely defined ‘Lentil community’) are faced with pondering questions like: What can I afford? What do I think the food is worth? Will I pay a reasonable amount for my meal? What can I afford to pay? Will I donate more than the food is worth to make up for someone who cannot afford to pay much at all? Will I volunteer my services?

The restaurants not only provide about a million healthy meals a year, they also provide a venue for volunteers to be part of a unique community: they provide paid work for hundreds of people, often refugees who otherwise struggle to fit in to life in Australia.

The chefs, the staff, the volunteers and the patrons all provide a warm, inclusive atmosphere around the restaurants. It is this, after the example of Shanaka himself, which provides the inspiration for many who have had their lives enriched and even turned around by this ‘Lentil community’.

Rationale

The first print run is out, and selling well in book stores. However, the initial production, printing, and publicity costs have been high. We are making a loss from this initial printing of the book, and cannot afford another print run. This now creates an opportunity for all Lentil supporters, and those who want to be, to pledge assistance and receive attractive rewards for doing so.

Lentil as Anything: Everybody deserves a place at the table (Vivid Publishing) is an inspiring and in some ways revolutionary book. Without painting Shanaka as a saint, it portrays a background which has led him to be the person he is today, and explains some of the influences behind his radical approach to social issues. Shanaka’s approach has provided millions of meals and created hundreds of jobs, as well as allocating funds to other social and welfare issues.

The book promotes a very worthy cause. It has the capacity to contribute to changing the world and portraying another way – a way of living which minimalizes materialism and fosters generosity, equality and the preservation of each individual’s dignity.

It has been my dream, and still is, to promote Shanaka and the Lentil restaurants. This has been the driving force behind my co-authoring of his memoirs.

Endorsements

'Shanaka's stories inspire in me the desire to be and do the best for the world around me. I challenge anyone who reads this book to remain indifferent and unengaged! A must for every would be change-maker.' - Rob Wood, Initiatives of Change, a Global Network of people committed to making Gandhi's 'be the chage' practical and possible, through seeking of inner wisdom and in the application of universal values of honesty, unselfishness, love and purity to everyday life. 

‘Fernando is one of those rare pioneers who are prepared to live by their convictions, flaunt social convention and challenge the status quo. The story of his lifelong quest for meaning - and the 'experiment in generosity' that became Lentil As Anything - is inspiring and challenging in equal measure. Few autobiographies are likely to evoke the senses and soul quite as much as Fernando's tale of global travel, self-exploration and cultural innovation.’  - Dr Wayne Visser, Director of Kaleidoscope Futures and author of "The Quest for Sustainable Business" and "The Age of Responsibility"

 ‘It [Shanaka’s memoirs] reveals Shanaka’s rebellion against a privileged upbringing, the evolution of his political consciousness and concern for social justice, and his ongoing struggles to find inner peace and harmony in the face of the many challenges his alternative vision have triggered. The book records a remarkable journey across numerous cultural boundaries, and the evolution of a true global citizen whose ideals and impact have come from acting locally.’ - Arnold Zable, award-winning Australian author

'Creativity, commitment and courage are the three words that for me sum up Shanaka Fernando’s story. This book will be a source of inspiration for all those who aspire to change the world…’ - Professor Paul Komesaroff, Medical Researcher and Philosopher, Monash University 

Where your money will go?

The book has already been printed and released. Distribution has been organised and the book is well-received in book stores throughout the country. However, our return from book stores doesn’t even pay off the initial debts in preparing and publishing the book. Thus we have no funds for a further print run, and we are seeking to print 1000 or 2000 more books, at a cost of up to $10,000. From this crowdraising we need to raise at least $5000 (and the full $10000 would be fantastic).

These books will continue to be sold in bookstores, as well as at speaking events, and through the Lentil restaurants. Hopefully, with your support, we will also one day be able to implement a pay-as-you-feel set-up for the purchase of these books in some locations – perhaps in the restaurants, perhaps at events, as we are currently sometimes doing. Such an action, following Shanaka’s lead in the Lentil pay-as-you-feel restaurants, will be somewhat of a revolution in the book industry, in making Shanaka’s motivating and transforming story available to all people, regardless of their income or financial resources.

If you can't donate you can still support us by sharing this project and liking the facebook page!

Some useful links:www.vividpublishing.com.au and http://lentilasanything.com

Our Facebook page is www.facebook.com/lentilbook

Our Youtube channel is www.youtube.com/lentilbook

Thankyou for taking the time to look at our project!

The chefs, the staff, the volunteers and the patrons all provide a warm, inclusive atmosphere around the restaurants. It is this, after the example of Shanaka himself, which provides the inspiration for many who have had their lives enriched and even turned around by this ‘Lentil community’.
Rationale
The first print run is out, and selling well in book stores. However, the initial production, printing, and publicity costs have been high. We are making a loss from this initial printing of the book, and cannot afford another print run. This now creates an opportunity for all Lentil supporters, and those who want to be, to pledge assistance and receive attractive rewards for doing so.
Lentil as Anything: Everybody deserves a place at the table (Vivid Publishing) is an inspiring and in some ways revolutionary book. Without painting Shanaka as a saint, it portrays a background which has led him to be the person he is today, and explains some of the influences behind his radical approach to social issues. Shanaka’s approach has provided millions of meals and created hundreds of jobs, as well as allocating funds to other social and welfare issues.
The book promotes a very worthy cause. It has the capacity to contribute to changing the world and portraying another way – a way of living which minimalizes materialism and fosters generosity, equality and the preservation of each individual’s dignity.
It has been my dream, and still is, to promote Shanaka and the Lentil restaurants. This has been the driving force behind my co-authoring of his memoirs.
Endorsements
'Shanaka's stories inspire in me the desire to be and do the best for the world around me. I challenge anyone who reads this book to remain indifferent and unengaged! A must for every would be change-maker.' - Rob Wood, Initiatives of Change, a Global Network of people committed to making Gandhi's 'be the chage' practical and possible, through seeking of inner wisdom and in the application of universal values of honesty, unselfishness, love and purity to everyday life. 

‘Fernando is one of those rare pioneers who are prepared to live by their convictions, flaunt social convention and challenge the status quo. The story of his lifelong quest for meaning - and the 'experiment in generosity' that became Lentil As Anything - is inspiring and challenging in equal measure. Few autobiographies are likely to evoke the senses and soul quite as much as Fernando's tale of global travel, self-exploration and cultural innovation.’  - Dr Wayne Visser, Director of Kaleidoscope Futures and author of "The Quest for Sustainable Business" and "The Age of Responsibility"
 ‘It [Shanaka’s memoirs] reveals Shanaka’s rebellion against a privileged upbringing, the evolution of his political consciousness and concern for social justice, and his ongoing struggles to find inner peace and harmony in the face of the many challenges his alternative vision have triggered. The book records a remarkable journey across numerous cultural boundaries, and the evolution of a true global citizen whose ideals and impact have come from acting locally.’ - Arnold Zable, award-winning Australian author
'Creativity, commitment and courage are the three words that for me sum up Shanaka Fernando’s story. This book will be a source of inspiration for all those who aspire to change the world…’ - Professor Paul Komesaroff, Medical Researcher and Philosopher, Monash University 
Where your money will go?
The book has already been printed and released. Distribution has been organised and the book is well-received in book stores throughout the country. However, our return from book stores doesn’t even pay off the initial debts in preparing and publishing the book. Thus we have no funds for a further print run, and we are seeking to print 1000 or 2000 more books, at a cost of up to $10,000. From this crowdraising we need to raise at least $5000 (and the full $10000 would be fantastic).
These books will continue to be sold in bookstores, as well as at speaking events, and through the Lentil restaurants. Hopefully, with your support, we will also one day be able to implement a pay-as-you-feel set-up for the purchase of these books in some locations – perhaps in the restaurants, perhaps at events, as we are currently sometimes doing. Such an action, following Shanaka’s lead in the Lentil pay-as-you-feel restaurants, will be somewhat of a revolution in the book industry, in making Shanaka’s motivating and transforming story available to all people, regardless of their income or financial resources.
If you can't donate you can still support us by sharing this project and liking the facebook page!
Some useful links:www.vividpublishing.com.au and http://lentilasanything.com
Our Facebook page is www.facebook.com/lentilbook
Our Youtube channel is www.youtube.com/lentilbook
Thankyou for taking the time to look at our project!

story:
Short Summary

A while ago I received via Upworthy a video of a test done by an organization in Johannesburg.

It was the failure of the neighbors to react in this video that struck me. Would we really rather have someone die than call 911 when we can hear violence in action? Johannesburg loses 1400 women every year this way.  Murders. This alone, however, did not spur me to write this book. It was the lack of reaction to this video when I shared it on Facebook. It made me realize that this really is a dis-ease of silence.  I’ve been silent myself for 25 years.  And it’s time to speak up.

Having written in many forms working as a professional writer, I know that I can produce the book, Love Beyond Reason.

It was 25 years ago that I sought after the relationship that would nearly kill me. This is a true story, and I assure you that the memories are clear. It's time for me to tell it.

What We Need & What You Get

The first $3000 ($600 x 5 months) of this funding truly does supplement my wages so I can focus on writing the book. I'm allowing $400 for edits and formatting.

A new computer is required and cannot be a basic model because of the work I do. I'm allowing $1,000 for this, and $250 is for the online course. The remaining $350 goes to Indiegogo for the wonderful work they do.

The perks will give you something to read right away! Peg has a chapbook describing her fascinating trip across Canada to visit friends and family. With a mixture of poetry and prose, spirituality and heartwarming moments, you are sure to enjoy this account of her trip. It's called "E-mail is not Enough". For the $10 level, you'll get the pdf and  a grateful "Tweet". You also get it in every perk thereafter.

For $20, you'll get the new e-book, "Love Beyond Reason", in March, plus the pdf chapbook right away. For $30, you get both e-books PLUS an autographed, hard copy version of "E-mail is Not Enough" just in time for gift-giving.


There are lunch and dinner meetings with Peg and you can even book her for a speaking engagement or get full page recognition in "Love Beyond Reason"!

The Impact

By purchasing one of the perks, you help me write this book, and by doing that, you may help one someone, somewhere gain the courage they need to seek help. You may even tell someone over lunch sometime that personal violence is “Not OK”. We have to start talking about it. It has been going on too long, and it’s time for it to stop. It hasn’t stopped on its own, so we need to do something. I am starting with this, and  need your help.

There are Public Information programs existing in Emergency Shelters everywhere. If I go over my goal, I will be donating funds to those programs to help get the word out. I will begin right here in Southern Alberta with Rowan House. In the first two months they were open in High River, they had to turn away 53 children, from babies to teens. Imagine what these young ones are experiencing.

There are organizations and corporations who would like to deliver information to their employees/clientele about all manner of social emergencies - domestic violence being one. This will be the foundation for spreading information - for breaking the silence. With a book, I will be a more appealing speaker and able to attempt to open the minds of more people. We cannot continue to build emergency facilities. Let's reduce the need for them instead.

My stance is that everyone is in trouble – both the abuser and the person receiving the abuse. It’s true that reported victims are 80% women, but there are men too, and some emergency shelters accommodate men leaving abusive relationships. Victims are also grandparents, children, and now we hear regularly about students who are being bullied to death. These kinds of abusers certainly represent both sexes.

I am inviting people who have been out of their abusive situation for at least five years to contact me. If there are enough of us willing to speak up, perhaps we can create a collection of stories to share. Help me break the silence.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please forward the info about the campaign through the handy share tools that Indiegogo supplies. And just talk about it at work, school, or play. Even that helps break the silence. Follow my campaign to see how it goes - you'll have something new to talk about over coffee. Or "Like" my Peg's Palate FB page!

story:
Show me the english version

ANNULATION DU PROJET- PROJECT CANCELED.

En concertation avec l'équipe, nous avons décidé d'annuler notre campagne sur Indiegogo.com, avant que cela ne soit trop tard.

Je vous invite à ne pas financer le projet qui se trouve sur cette page.

Les dons correspondant au 162 euros déjà versés, seront soit transférés sur la nouvelle campagne en septembre sur Kisskissbankbank, soit remboursés auprès de leurs propriétaires.

Tous les dons faits après cette annonce seront directement transférés sur la nouvelle campagne début Septembre.

Pourquoi l'annulation du projet?

Trois raisons nous poussent à annuler notre campagne:
 
1) Notre manque de stratégie pour promouvoir le projet. Nous avons fait des erreurs, nous nous sommes précipités sur certains points. Nous devons revoir par étape notre façon de communiquer, et arrêter la campagne nous permet d'avoir le recul nécessaire pour mieux agir.
 
2) Un objectif financier un peu trop élevé et le besoin d'un challenge. Nous n'avions pas eu le choix d'un financement fixe,  le financement flexible  (qui nous autorise à garder les fonds sans atteindre l'objectif) est une bonne idée mais peut ne pas insuffler suffisamment de confiance dans un projet.
 
3) Le retour du projet sur Paris: nous avons décidé de tester le concept auprès de nos amis, de nos familles, qui seront plus à même de nous aider dans l'amélioration de nos services. Nous tenons aussi à entreprendre en France d'abord, par principe de ne pas faire partie des jeunes exilés français qui tentent l'aventure entrepreneurial ailleurs. 
 
Tout cela explique un virage stratégique qui amène à une nouvelle identité de notre projet: on vous garde la surprise pour début Septembre!
 
J'espère que ceux qui nous suivent comprennent notre démarche.
 
Moustachement vôtre
 
L'équipe Yellowstache
 
PS: La boîte à dialogue reste ouverte, si vous avez des questions, des remarques ou des réactions, exprimez-vous!
 

 L'histoire du projet.

 

Nous sommes quatre étudiants, bien décidé à développer un projet qui allie application et magazine, le projet Yellowstache.

Arrivés à Montréal en mai 2013, nous voulions découvrir la ville, connaitre et vivre l'ébullition culturelle dont tout le monde parle. En pleine recherche active, une difficulté nous faisait face: celle de l'information.

Qui aujourd'hui peut trouver un événement sur internet si il ne sait pas ce qu'il recherche? N'existe-t-il pas un moyen d'avoir des suggestions qui nous correspondent?

Combien de forums, de sites avons nous parcouru, épuisant notre envie de vivre de nouvelles choses, au fur et à mesure que les gros événements prenaient toute la place dans les résultats de recherche, au fur et à mesure que l'information s'accummulait pêle-mêle, nous rendant incapable de choisir dans un océan de possibilités.

C'est à ce moment là que nous avons eu l'idée de Yellowstache: un magazine mobile, pour l'avoir toujours avec soi, personnalisable, pour trier l'information selon nos centres d'intérêts, et autour de l'événementiel, afin de vivre une expérience dans la réalité physique.  

Yellowstache, c'est un accès toujours plus facile aux événements de petites et moyennes envergures. Il s'agit de créer un média qui fait exister l'information en lien avec ce que l'on est et ce que l'on aime. Vos contributions donneront naissance à une nouvelle façon de s'informer et de vivre des événements dans votre ville.

 

      La page d'accueil            Les événements                Votre e-ticket                  Les médias

 

 

 Notre philosophie

Yellowstache, c'est une nouvelle façon d'aborder notre navigation sur internet, c'est aussi l'opportunité de vivre des événements de qualité que l'on ne voit pas car leurs budgets de communication ne sont pas assez importants.

Nous considérons que les organisateurs d'événements doivent rencontrer le public qu'il mérite et inversement. Tout nos efforts sont menés vers ce seul et unique but. L'idée de recourir au crowdfunding vient de cet esprit. Un événement sans organisateur et sans public ne peut pas exister, comment concevoir Yellowstache sans eux!

Nous avons fait des contributions avec les contreparties les plus intéressantes possibles: nous voulons que vous faisiez partie intégrante du projet, que vous tiriez avantages de notre existence, vous qui avez décidé de nous soutenir à ce moment décisif.

Yellowstache c'est aussi votre aventure.

 

 

 Les questions que vous pouvez vous poser.

 

Pourquoi 25000 euros (34000 $CAD)?

Nous avons estimé le budget de la façon suivante:

  • 12000 euros ( 16000 $CAD) pour soutenir financièrement l'équipe informatique dans son développement web, IOS et Androïd
  • 13000 euros (18000 $CAD) pour permettre à Arnaud et Benoit de rester dans cette magnifique ville de Montréal, afin de développer le marché chez nos cousins québécois!
  • Avec la commission de Indiegogo et le coût des contreparties, nous arrivons à un total de 25000 euros (34000$ CAD).

 

Pourquoi Montréal ?

Montréal est une ville Hors norme lorsqu'il s'agit d'événementiel: le bouillonnement culturel nous a vraiment surpris, même si nous avions été prévenus avant de partir! Développer le projet ici est une occasion formidable de rapprocher nos deux pays, nos deux cultures et de se connaitre le mieux possible. 

Montréal est notre ville-test: elle est l'étape décisive avant un développement sur Paris en Septembre 2014.

 

Pourquoi Yellowstache?

La moustache est à la fois une référence à notre état d'esprit et à la nature de l'application.

La moustache est quelque chose d'unique à chacun, deux moustaches identiques ne peuvent exister. Elle symbolise la totale liberté de personnalisation proposée à l'utilisateur dans l'App'zine.

La moustache recquiert aussi de la patience, du travail et un entretien irréprochable: elle symbolise notre philosophie de tous les jours dans le développement du projet.

 

 

 D'autres façons de nous aider.

Avant de vous énoncer les autres façons de nous aider, nous précisons que toutes les contributions incluant des crédits d'achats sur notre site sont valables à la fois sur Montréal à partir de Janvier 2014 et sur Paris en Septembre 2014 (hormis les invitations aux événements, qui se dérouleront exclusivement sur Montréal).

Si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider, pour des raisons évidentes, aidez nous à rendre ce projet visible. Tenez compte que moins de 10% des gens que l'on sollicite décide de supporter financièrement un projet.

De manière totalement gratuite, vous pouvez:

-Parler de notre site de présentation de Yellowstache en diffusant le lien ci dessous:

http://yellowstache.fr/

-Nous aider à atteindre les 30.000 invités, en partageant l'évènement que nous avons créé sur Facebook à vos amis:

http://www.facebook.com/events/147830152083690/

- Sans oublier les outils de partage présents sur Indiegogo!

 

Nous vous aimons,

Moustachement vôtre

Valentin, Thomas, Arnaud et Benoit, de Yellowstache.

 

Conversion Euro-Dollars Canadien

10 euros 14 $CAD
20 euros 27 $CAD
40 euros 55 $CAD
75 euros 100 $CAD
190 euros 260 $CAD
370 euros 505 $CAD
750 euros 1025 $CAD
7500 euros 10250 $CAD

 

  

 

English Version

 

PROJECT CANCELED

We decided to cancel our campaign Indiegogo.com, before raising too much to cancel.

I urge you not to finance the project from this page.

Donations corresponding to 162 euros already paid, will be transferred to the new campaign in September on Kisskissbankbank or refunded to their owners.

All donations made after this announcement will be directly transferred to the new campaign beginning in September.

Why the cancellation of the project?

Three reasons lead us to cancel our campaign:

1) Our lack of strategy to promote the project. We made mistakes, we rushed on certain points. We need to revisit step by step how we communicate, and stop the campaign allows us to have the necessary perspective to be better.

2) We seek a more reasonable financial goal and lsouhaitons a challenge. We did not have the choice of a fixed financing, flexible financing (which allows us to keep the money without achieving the goal) is a good idea but may not inspire enough confidence in a project.

3) The return of the project in Paris: we decided to test the concept with our friends, our families, who will be better able to assist us in improving our services. We also wish to develop the project in France first.

All this explains a strategic shift brings a new identity for our project: Wait a surprise for early September!

I hope that those who follow us understand our approach.

Moustachelly yours

The team Yellowstache

PS: The dialog box remains open, if you have any questions, comments or feedback, express yourself!

 

 

 

 The story of our project.

 

We are four students, well decided to develop a project which links application and magazine, the Yellowstache project. Arrived in Montreal in May, we wanted to discover the city, know much more about this amazing culture, which make everybody talking about it. In a deeply research, we had to face to something difficult: the information.

Who can today find an event on internet if he doesn’t really know about what he really want to do? Can we find a real way to have suggestions about what we do dealing with what we are? How many forums, websites we’ve been through, wearying our desire to live something new?

Time after time the biggest events of the year were taking all the websearch results, avoiding us from finding something more special. And then came the idea of Yellowstache : a mobile magazine, that you can always have with you, wherever you are, to do what you really want to do. An application in which you can choose, classify the information related to your tastes. And all this turns around events, to make you live experiences, which really look like yourself.

Yellowstache is an easier access to events from small and middle scales. This is all about creating a media, which makes exists the information linked with who you are and what you like. Your contributions will give life to a new way of information and a new way to live some event around where you live.

 

        Homescreen                    Events                Your tickets                  Your memories

 

 

 

 Our philosophy.

Yellowstache, it’s the new way of finding events on internet, but it’s also the opportunity to live new things, things that we could not have find in some other ways because of the small advertising budget they often have. We consider that the event organizers must know their public and vice versa. All our effort are concentrated on one aim : resort to the crowd funding. An event can’t exist without any organizer and public. How think about Yellowstache in an other way?

We did contributions, with perks, the more interesting possible. We wanted you to make part of our project; we wanted you to have many advantages from us, you guys who decided to support ourselves in this precious moment.

Yellowstache is also your adventure.

 

 

 The questions you can ask.

 

Why 25000 euros (34 000$ CAD )?

We have estimated the budget in this way :

  • 16000$ CAD to support financially the computer hardware team in the web development, IOS and Android.
  • 12000$ CAD to allow Benoit and Arnaud to stay in Montreal, and makes them develop the Canadian market.
  • With the commission from Indiegogo and the cost of compensations, we finally arrived to 34 000$ CAD.

 

Why Montréal?

Montréal is a city out of the range when you talk about event : and even if we were warned about it, we were totally surprised when we saw how the city was full of life ! Develop this project here is a perfect occasion to get our two countries closer and know much about each other.

 

 

Why Yellowstache?

The reference to the mustache is related to our state of mind and also to the nature of the application. The mustache is something unique to anybody; two same mustaches cannot exist. It symbolizes the whole freedom to personalize your profile in the App’zine.

The mustache requires patience, work and a full upkeep: it symbolizes our everyday philosophy in the development of the project.

 

Other ways to help us :

If you cannot help us for obvious reasons, help us trying to make the project being popular by posting about it.

Consider that 10% of the people you request decide to support financially a crowdfunding project.

In a totally free way you can :

  • Talk about our website, with the link which is following:

http://www.yellowstache.fr

 

  • Invite your friends to the event page we created on Facebook.

http://www.facebook.com/events/147830152083690/

 

  • With the sharing tools on Indiegogo.

 

We love you.

Mustachelly yours.

Valentin, Thomas, Arnaud and Benoit, from Yellowstache.

 

 

Select a Perk, for your contribution:



10 euros (14 $ CAD)- "La moustache Crayon" - "The Pencil mustache"

Also, you have a choice of:
-1 RFID/Qrcode customized wristband, to have all your event ticket on an unique pass.
or
- You are not living in Montreal? With our Partner, addmefor.fr,  you will be offered  1 social  Qrcode wristband, to share your profile and meet new people!

Delivery announced : January 2014

Or

Do you want to visit Montreal? The Yellowstache team invite you at home, in couch-surfing way, one week, anytime in 2014! Furthermore, Benoit will cook you a home-made risotto when you will arrive.

Pourquoi l'annulation du projet?
Trois raisons nous poussent à annuler notre campagne:

 
1) Notre manque de stratégie pour promouvoir le projet. Nous avons fait des erreurs, nous nous sommes précipités sur certains points. Nous devons revoir par étape notre façon de communiquer, et arrêter la campagne nous permet d'avoir le recul nécessaire pour mieux agir.
 
2) Un objectif financier un peu trop élevé et le besoin d'un challenge. Nous n'avions pas eu le choix d'un financement fixe,  le financement flexible  (qui nous autorise à garder les fonds sans atteindre l'objectif) est une bonne idée mais peut ne pas insuffler suffisamment de confiance dans un projet.
 
3) Le retour du projet sur Paris: nous avons décidé de tester le concept auprès de nos amis, de nos familles, qui seront plus à même de nous aider dans l'amélioration de nos services. Nous tenons aussi à entreprendre en France d'abord, par principe de ne pas faire partie des jeunes exilés français qui tentent l'aventure entrepreneurial ailleurs. 
 
Tout cela explique un virage stratégique qui amène à une nouvelle identité de notre projet: on vous garde la surprise pour début Septembre!
 
J'espère que ceux qui nous suivent comprennent notre démarche.
 
Moustachement vôtre
 
L'équipe Yellowstache
 
PS: La boîte à dialogue reste ouverte, si vous avez des questions, des remarques ou des réactions, exprimez-vous!
 

 L'histoire du projet.
 
Nous sommes quatre étudiants, bien décidé à développer un projet qui allie application et magazine, le projet Yellowstache.
Arrivés à Montréal en mai 2013, nous voulions découvrir la ville, connaitre et vivre l'ébullition culturelle dont tout le monde parle. En pleine recherche active, une difficulté nous faisait face: celle de l'information.
Qui aujourd'hui peut trouver un événement sur internet si il ne sait pas ce qu'il recherche? N'existe-t-il pas un moyen d'avoir des suggestions qui nous correspondent?
Combien de forums, de sites avons nous parcouru, épuisant notre envie de vivre de nouvelles choses, au fur et à mesure que les gros événements prenaient toute la place dans les résultats de recherche, au fur et à mesure que l'information s'accummulait pêle-mêle, nous rendant incapable de choisir dans un océan de possibilités.
C'est à ce moment là que nous avons eu l'idée de Yellowstache: un magazine mobile, pour l'avoir toujours avec soi, personnalisable, pour trier l'information selon nos centres d'intérêts, et autour de l'événementiel, afin de vivre une expérience dans la réalité physique.  
Yellowstache, c'est un accès toujours plus facile aux événements de petites et moyennes envergures. Il s'agit de créer un média qui fait exister l'information en lien avec ce que l'on est et ce que l'on aime. Vos contributions donneront naissance à une nouvelle façon de s'informer et de vivre des événements dans votre ville.
 

      La page d'accueil            Les événements                Votre e-ticket                  Les médias


 
 
 Notre philosophie
Yellowstache, c'est une nouvelle façon d'aborder notre navigation sur internet, c'est aussi l'opportunité de vivre des événements de qualité que l'on ne voit pas car leurs budgets de communication ne sont pas assez importants.
Nous considérons que les organisateurs d'événements doivent rencontrer le public qu'il mérite et inversement. Tout nos efforts sont menés vers ce seul et unique but. L'idée de recourir au crowdfunding vient de cet esprit. Un événement sans organisateur et sans public ne peut pas exister, comment concevoir Yellowstache sans eux!
Nous avons fait des contributions avec les contreparties les plus intéressantes possibles: nous voulons que vous faisiez partie intégrante du projet, que vous tiriez avantages de notre existence, vous qui avez décidé de nous soutenir à ce moment décisif.
Yellowstache c'est aussi votre aventure.

 
 
 Les questions que vous pouvez vous poser.
 
Pourquoi 25000 euros (34000 $CAD)?
Nous avons estimé le budget de la façon suivante:

12000 euros ( 16000 $CAD) pour soutenir financièrement l'équipe informatique dans son développement web, IOS et Androïd
13000 euros (18000 $CAD) pour permettre à Arnaud et Benoit de rester dans cette magnifique ville de Montréal, afin de développer le marché chez nos cousins québécois!
Avec la commission de Indiegogo et le coût des contreparties, nous arrivons à un total de 25000 euros (34000$ CAD).

 
Pourquoi Montréal ?
Montréal est une ville Hors norme lorsqu'il s'agit d'événementiel: le bouillonnement culturel nous a vraiment surpris, même si nous avions été prévenus avant de partir! Développer le projet ici est une occasion formidable de rapprocher nos deux pays, nos deux cultures et de se connaitre le mieux possible. 
Montréal est notre ville-test: elle est l'étape décisive avant un développement sur Paris en Septembre 2014.
 
Pourquoi Yellowstache?
La moustache est à la fois une référence à notre état d'esprit et à la nature de l'application.
La moustache est quelque chose d'unique à chacun, deux moustaches identiques ne peuvent exister. Elle symbolise la totale liberté de personnalisation proposée à l'utilisateur dans l'App'zine.
La moustache recquiert aussi de la patience, du travail et un entretien irréprochable: elle symbolise notre philosophie de tous les jours dans le développement du projet.
 
 


 D'autres façons de nous aider.
Avant de vous énoncer les autres façons de nous aider, nous précisons que toutes les contributions incluant des crédits d'achats sur notre site sont valables à la fois sur Montréal à partir de Janvier 2014 et sur Paris en Septembre 2014 (hormis les invitations aux événements, qui se dérouleront exclusivement sur Montréal).
Si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider, pour des raisons évidentes, aidez nous à rendre ce projet visible. Tenez compte que moins de 10% des gens que l'on sollicite décide de supporter financièrement un projet.
De manière totalement gratuite, vous pouvez:

Nous vous aimons,
Moustachement vôtre
Valentin, Thomas, Arnaud et Benoit, de Yellowstache.

We decided to cancel our campaign Indiegogo.com, before raising too much to cancel.

 The story of our project.
 
We are four students, well decided to develop a project which links application and magazine, the Yellowstache project. Arrived in Montreal in May, we wanted to discover the city, know much more about this amazing culture, which make everybody talking about it. In a deeply research, we had to face to something difficult: the information.
 Who can today find an event on internet if he doesn’t really know about what he really want to do? Can we find a real way to have suggestions about what we do dealing with what we are? How many forums, websites we’ve been through, wearying our desire to live something new?
 Time after time the biggest events of the year were taking all the websearch results, avoiding us from finding something more special. And then came the idea of Yellowstache : a mobile magazine, that you can always have with you, wherever you are, to do what you really want to do. An application in which you can choose, classify the information related to your tastes. And all this turns around events, to make you live experiences, which really look like yourself. 
Yellowstache is an easier access to events from small and middle scales. This is all about creating a media, which makes exists the information linked with who you are and what you like. Your contributions will give life to a new way of information and a new way to live some event around where you live.

 Our philosophy.

Montréal is a city out of the range when you talk about event : and even if we were warned about it, we were totally surprised when we saw how the city was full of life ! Develop this project here is a perfect occasion to get our two countries closer and know much about each other.

MISSION

Welcome on board sailor! Join us on a maritime journey in order to bring about the most detailed yet visually stunning book on ocean liners ever published. With your help, our trilingual book will feature 150 exclusive profiles of famous ships manufactured by 30 companies throughout the 19th and 20th century. 

From technical drawings to paintings, builder's models to virtual plans there are just so many modes of ship portrayal. However, one specific form is the profile. Ship profiles had been made in varying details and for rather different purposes. During warfare at sea, recognition silhouette illustrations from booklets served marines by helping to identify enemy ships and assess speed and firepower in time. In peacetime, line drawings, elevation plans and longitudinal sections were produced for ship constructions. 

Ship profiles are too a popular feature of nautical books. In anthological series published in the last few decades, however, these profiles are typically appear small scale and rough thus providing ship lovers with merely a superficial glimpse into the rich and visual world of ship portraying. The last great ship portrait collection book - containing large scale, colour plates which could be removed from the book for decoration purposes - had been published back in 1965, and only featured 12 ships. With the exponential growth taking place in digital imaging industries and the availability of original shipyard documents, builder’s models, and photo archives, ship portraying is now more accurate and spectacular than ever before.

Thomas Balogh is a lover of ocean liners. According to his plans, a hundred and fifty large scale, coloured ship profiles will be created, covering the most famous liners of the 19th and 20th century. These profiles will appear in a representative volume, making a commemorative gesture to the golden ages of transoceanic liners.

Before the dawn of aviation, ocean liners represented the sole mean of travelling between continents. In the beginnings, this type of travelling, like many other, was rather dangerous than comfortable. Over time though, as mankind’s technical and aesthetics abilities further refined, and the 5-6 days long journey between Europe and America on board of a great ship carrying thousands, was inevitably a memorable experience for passengers. 

The best ships were elegant and comfortable, equipped with splendid furniture and powerful machines that were designed to break records for fastest transoceanic trip. It’s no surprise these liners frequently elevated to the level of national symbols. The experience of today’s giant cruise ships is somewhat akin to this, though the magic of a timetabled, week-long transoceanic voyage on board had vanished forever in the sixties. Nowadays only objects - like well made ship profiles - remind us of these times.

The applied colouring and shading techniques are pushing the limits of two dimensional illustration and plasticity. As a result of his previous work and research, the author will realise highly detailed ship profiles which are visually pleasing, yet - together with the short history of each ship collected in one comparative volume, in three languages - offer a rare experience for liner lovers too.

We are kindly asking for your help to realise and publish a book that surpasses every previous effort made in ship portraying book traditions both in quality and quantity in. Be a part of this fantastic journey with us! What’s being made is not only a book. One one hand, individual sheets can be removed from the book for framing purposes. On the other, the design can be ordered (customers receive digital copies of ship profiles from which they select and order the desired ones printed on wrapping paper, binders, or any other home decoration (carpets, wallpaper, etc) items.

Moreover, by the use of ship profiles, a “who is who” type memory game for children will be created on the long run. So the book that’s being developed is actually the first, introducing piece to a larger collection aimed at ocean liner fans.

HU

KÜLDETÉS

Üdv a fedélzeten tengerész! Csatlakozz hozzánk egy tengeri utazásra annak érdekében, hogy kiadhassuk az óceánjárók jellegrajzairól valaha megjelent legrészletesebb, mégis látványos könyvünket. Segítségetekkel, a háromnyelvű könyvben megjelenik 30 cég 150 híres hajójának exkluzív profilja, amely egyben bepillantást enged a 19. és 20. század történetének egy izgalmas fejezetébe. LINERS. A történelem ott lesz a polcodon.

A hajóknak a műszaki rajzoktól a festményeken át az élethű valódi és virtuális modellekig számos ábrázolásmódja létezik. Ezek speciális formája a jellegrajz. A hajóprofilok különböző részletességgel és céllal készültek: A világháborúkban a tengeren harcolók zsebében lapuló sziluett-könyvek ábrái segítették az ellenség azonosítását, erejének és sebességének időben történő felismerését.

A hajóprofilok a hajózási könyveknek is kedvelt témái. Az utóbbi évtizedekben megjelent ilyen témájú gyűjteményes kötetekben mégis csak jellemzően kisméretű, ezért elnagyolt ábrázolásokat közöltek, amelyek sajnálatosan kevéssé részlet-gazdagok, a megismerésnek csak vázlatos lehetőségét biztosítják. A legnagyobb – kiemelhető és önálló képként akár be is keretezhető – nagy, színes táblákat tartalmazó hajóportré-kötet utoljára 1965-ben jelent meg, ám az is csak 12 hajóportréval.

Azóta a digitális ábrázolási technikák ugrásszerű fejlődése és az egykori hajókra vonatkozó adatok – eredeti hajógyári tervek, építői modellek és archív fotódokumentumok digitális feldolgozása és elérhetővé tétele révén az ábrázolás lehetőségei minden korábbinál pontosabbá és látványosabbá váltak.

Balogh Tamás az óceánjáró személyhajók szerelmese. Tervei szerint összesen mintegy 150 hajóprofil készül, a XIX. és a XX. század leghíresebb óceánjáró személyszállító hajóinak nagyméretű, színes jellegrajzaival. Ezek egy reprezentatív kötetbe gyűjtve jelennek meg, amely rendhagyó emléket állít az óceáni személyhajózás nagy korszakának.

Az óceánjárók az emberiség legnagyobb technikai-, munkaerő- és anyagi ráfordítással készültműszaki alkotásai közé tartoznak, amelyek a repülőgépek megjelenéséig az egyetlen átkelési lehetőséget biztosították a kontinensek között. Kezdetben ez a közlekedési mód is – mint minden más az életben – elsősorban inkább veszélyes volt, mint kényelmes. Az emberiség technikai-műszaki (és nem utolsó sorban esztétikai) fejlődésével azonban az egyszerre több ezer embert befogadó hatalmas hajók fedélzetén az Európa és Amerika között eltöltött 5-6 nap a transzóceáni átkelést az utasok számára egyedülálló élménnyé avatta.


A legkiválóbb hajók pedig gyakran nemzeti szimbólumokká magasztosultak, amelyeket a leggyorsabb átkelés rekordját biztosító erőteljes gépek, a legpompásabb berendezés, elegancia és kényelem jellemzett.A mai óriási kirándulóhajók fedélzetén átélhető élmény sokban hasonlít ehhez, a menetrend szerinti óceáni átkeléssel töltött egyetlen hét varázsa azonban az 1960-as években örökre elenyészett... Ma már csak a rá emlékeztető tárgyak – köztük az igényes kivitelű hajóprofilok – segítenek felidézni ezt a kort.

Balogh Tamás rajzai digitális technológiával készültek, olyan felbontásban, amely gyakorlatilag majdnem tetszőleges méretű nagyítást tesz lehetővé.

Az alkotó több száz korabeli fotóra és tervre, valamint a fennmaradt eredeti hajógyári modellekre is kiterjedő előzetes kutatómunkájának köszönhetően az általa készített hajóprofilok a legkisebb részletekig valósághűek, azokon szinte minden külső szerkezeti elem látható. Az alkalmazott színezési és árnyékolási technikák pedig a kétdimenziós megjelenítés során a lehetőségek határáig fokozzák az ábrázolás plasztikusságát. Munkája eredményeként így a szemnek is kellemes, az óceánjárókért rajongók számára pedig ritka élményt nyújtó alkotások jönnek létre, amelyeket Balogh Tamás most – a hajók történetéről szóló rövid leírással kiegészítve – egy kötetbe gyűjtve kíván átnyújtani az Olvasóknak.

Ehhez várjuk segítségüket, amellyel meghaladjuk az összes korábbi hasonló ábrázolás minőségét és mennyiségét egyaránt. Legyen részese Ön is ennek a csodálatos utazásnak!

Ami készül, az nem csak egy könyv. Egyrészt mar maguk a lapok is kiemelhető, keretezhető képek. Másrészt a design rendelhető (a megrendelők digitálisan kapják a hajókat ábrázolásait, amelyeket aztán tetszés szerint a legkülönfélébb formában használhatnak) – a megadott mintákból történő választást követően a kérésüknek megfelelően – iratgyűjtőre, csomagoló papírra, lakásdekorációs anyagokra (szőnyegre, tapétára, stb.) feldolgozva.

story_txt:
ENMISSIONWelcome on board sailor! Join us on a maritime journey in order to bring about the most detailed yet visually stunning book on ocean liners ever published. With your help, our trilingual book will feature 150 exclusive profiles of famous ships manufactured by 30 companies throughout the 19th and 20th century. From technical drawings to paintings, builder's models to virtual plans there are just so many modes of ship portrayal. However, one specific form is the profile. Ship profiles had been made in varying details and for rather different purposes. During warfare at sea, recognition silhouette illustrations from booklets served marines by helping to identify enemy ships and assess speed and firepower in time. In peacetime, line drawings, elevation plans and longitudinal sections were produced for ship constructions. Ship profiles are too a popular feature of nautical books. In anthological series published in the last few decades, however, these profiles are typically appear small scale and rough thus providing ship lovers with merely a superficial glimpse into the rich and visual world of ship portraying. The last great ship portrait collection book - containing large scale, colour plates which could be removed from the book for decoration purposes - had been published back in 1965, and only featured 12 ships. With the exponential growth taking place in digital imaging industries and the availability of original shipyard documents, builder’s models, and photo archives, ship portraying is now more accurate and spectacular than ever before.Thomas Balogh is a lover of ocean liners. According to his plans, a hundred and fifty large scale, coloured ship profiles will be created, covering the most famous liners of the 19th and 20th century. These profiles will appear in a representative volume, making a commemorative gesture to the golden ages of transoceanic liners.Before the dawn of aviation, ocean liners represented the sole mean of travelling between continents. In the beginnings, this type of travelling, like many other, was rather dangerous than comfortable. Over time though, as mankind’s technical and aesthetics abilities further refined, and the 5-6 days long journey between Europe and America on board of a great ship carrying thousands, was inevitably a memorable experience for passengers. The best ships were elegant and comfortable, equipped with splendid furniture and powerful machines that were designed to break records for fastest transoceanic trip. It’s no surprise these liners frequently elevated to the level of national symbols. The experience of today’s giant cruise ships is somewhat akin to this, though the magic of a timetabled, week-long transoceanic voyage on board had vanished forever in the sixties. Nowadays only objects - like well made ship profiles - remind us of these times.The applied colouring and shading techniques are pushing the limits of two dimensional illustration and plasticity. As a result of his previous work and research, the author will realise highly detailed ship profiles which are visually pleasing, yet - together with the short history of each ship collected in one comparative volume, in three languages - offer a rare experience for liner lovers too.We are kindly asking for your help to realise and publish a book that surpasses every previous effort made in ship portraying book traditions both in quality and quantity in. Be a part of this fantastic journey with us! What’s being made is not only a book. One one hand, individual sheets can be removed from the book for framing purposes. On the other, the design can be ordered (customers receive digital copies of ship profiles from which they select and order the desired ones printed on wrapping paper, binders, or any other home decoration (carpets, wallpaper, etc) items.Moreover, by the use of ship profiles, a “who is who” type memory game for children will be created on the long run. So the book that’s being developed is actually the first, introducing piece to a larger collection aimed at ocean liner fans.
