New project: Ocean Nomads

Dreaming about having a sailing boat, hit the high seas and never return? If you think it's too expensive, too difficult, or too much to learn, you're wrong! Read on and before you know it you'll leave the safe harbour...

 

 

Intro

My name is Suzanne van der Veeken. I pursue ocean adventures with the mission to save the ocean. Last year I aimed for a big sailing exploration. But how to do that with no boat, no budget nor sailing experience?

As Walt Disney says: “If it can be dreamt, it can be done.’ So I dreamt, and so I did. 

The Hitchsailing across the Atlantic Ocean e-book will help you, your adventurous friend, cousin, mum, or kid go on the adventure of a lifetime. 

As a supporter of this crowd funding campaign you’ll contribute to get this book out to dream chasers, adventure seekers and ocean savers. The book inspires for adventure, helps making dreams come true, increases awareness about ocean conservation, and hopefully creates some new ocean ambassadors. 

 

Photo: captain Rudy, who made it happen!

   

Why (hitch)sail across an ocean?

 

Sailing is such a fascinating means of transport and it’s so much more than that. It a way of living, a way of independence, a way of going to places where no one comes, a way of really going 100 % into nature. When does that still happen? So why cross an ocean then, you may wonder? An ocean passage is really a radical removal from it all, long enough to really disconnect from everything but nature. There is no wifi. No stress. No media. No system to comply with. No deadlines. No pressure. There is no way back! It’s back to basics. It’s hours of stargazing, it’s meeting dozens of dolphins and whales, it’s seeing the most pure sunsets and sunrises, it’s breathing the fresh ocean air. Day in day out. You become energized, oxygenated and fully alive. It’s loads of thinking about life and your purpose in it. When you crossed the big pond you'll feel accomplished and ready to take over the world! Last but not least, it’s the most sustainable way to travel. So why the Atlantic Ocean? To feel like Columbus! You don't have to imagine what I feels like to suddenly see land after days and days of ocean, you can experience it. When it turns winter in Europe the tradewinds pick up just in time to make your way sailing to the Caribbean. Every day it's gets a little warmer. Then arriving in the tropics with coconuts, rumpunch and steeldrum music at every beach corner is another dream becoming reality. When the hurricane season approaches boats make their way eastwards, to be just in time for European spring. Crossing the Atlantic Ocean is a expedition, though not the most challenging oceanpassage out there. It's a great starting point and will trigger you for more.  

“Because in the end, you won’t remember the time you spent working in the office or mowing your lawn. Climb that goddamn mountain.”― Jack Kerouac Or sail that wide ocean!

No boat? Nooo worries! That’s when this book comes in handy.

Who is this book for?

For the dreamers, the adventurous, and the curious.

  • For those who like to get inspired for adventure
  • For those who like to learn more about hitchsailing and how it works
  • For those who are thinking about crossing an ocean and like to get started
  • For those who like to go to the other side of the Atlantic pond in most sustainable way
  • For crew looking for boats, but also for captains looking for crew.
  • For those with no boat, no budget, no sailing experience but a drive for adventure
  • For those with a boat and willingness to make a meaningful mission out of their ocean voyage
  • For those who love the ocean and want to learn more about what’s happening
  • And for those who simply like to read what an adventure like this is like

 

 Boat 1: Where I learned how NOT to sail across an ocean

 

What will the book cover?

The book answers questions like: How and why to go on this adventure? What is it like? When and where to find a boat? When to leave a boat? How to prepare? Why you should or should not do this? When to be where? How to profile yourself? How to prepare? How to make it safe? How to tell mum that it is a safe and sensible thing to do? How can you make it a meaningful journey? How does it work on the other side? And much more!

The book is based on my experience plus the experience of +70 captains and hitchsailors. I’ve done a big survey amongst other hitchsailors and captains who crossed (or attempted) and asked them about their experience and lessons learned. 

The book includes tips, guidelines, my story, interviewees stories. In writing, graphics and photos.

The Impact

The hitchsailing book is part of a bigger mission: to save the ocean.

By creating this e-book I hope to encourage, inspire, and inform for adventure and ocean exploration. For one to experience the magic and the situation of the ocean, to experience the beauty of simple resourceful living, and then, act accordingly. 

It’s since this big sailing adventure that I have really realized how bad the situation of our ocean is, and how dependent we are on it. I feel more responsible and motivated than ever to bring life back into the ocean.

My ocean explorations have shown me the tsunami of challenges our oceans are facing. In the middle of the Atlantic I fished water samples that appeared to be clear but had 47 tiny pieces of plastic. I’ve been zigzag sailing to avoid the hundreds of trawling fishing boats. I’ve stared at parades of plastic floating. I built sandcastles of plastic sand. I’ve been dancing with manta-rays in a plastic soup. I’ve been freediving looking for fish and couldn’t find any, on places where they’re supposed to be in abundance. The ocean gets emptied, trashed, polluted and out of balance because of our busy and demanding lifes on land. I have experienced these sad situations. And by going out on a boat for a while I have also experienced how very little we actually need. But we do need the ocean to live.

I love the ocean so I protect that. But It’s not about me. It’s about everyone, everyone’s kids and every life on the planet. We are alive right now because of the oceans. Now the ocean needs to be kept alive by us.

People protect what they love. So I want people to fall in love with the ocean. To fall in love with the ocean and get most triggered to make a difference, I believe you have to experience the ocean. 

 

Photo: Taking watersamples to contribute and learn about plastic pollution. Results are shocking!

So who's this girl?

Me in 5 words: oceanpreneur, explorer, mermaid, environmentalist, incentivizer.

During my 10 years of adventuring around the world there has been one constant: the calling of the ocean. In, at or near the sea I’m the best version of myself. I freedive into the deep, hitchsail across oceans, and play around with my kite and board. Im an ambassadors for adventure and advocate for sustainability. All my endeavors are around making people happy, inspiring to make dreams happen, exploring the outdoors, creating awareness about global issues, and act accordingly to make a positive impact. The ocean gives me my play, my life.

 

I had to experience an ocean crossing and now I have, twice. The adventurous way. I found a boat to cross the Atlantic. I left a boat (just in time!). I found another boat. I made it to the Caribbean. And I made it back to Europe. What an adventure it has been! 350 + 850 2262 + 2100 + 1150 miles. High seas, low seas, good times, bad times. I learned loads about sailing, seamanship, people, how (and how not) to hitchsail, and most importantly the ocean. This adventure, its impact and the impact I hope it going to have, is not to be summarized in a sentence. I like to help others to experience this. That’s why I’m dedicated tons of time to compile my tips, my story and the stories of +70 interviewed captains and hitch sailors into a book.

I feel more responsible and motivated than ever to bring life back into the ocean. Because the ocean are dying. The time to do something is NOW! With this book, as well as with other oceanpreneurial projects I aim to encourage, inspire, and inform to broadens horizons and trigger for positive change. Cause we all need to team up to keep the our playground, our life, our ocean, alive! Since this year I'll go through life as the Oceanpreneur. You can learn more about what I do on my website www.theoceanpreneur.com. Find me on the social media as @oceanpreneur. On Instagram I do live video updates. Once the book is finished I'll go into video and share some hitch-sailing episodes on Youtube.

 

What has been done?

  • The experience: the search for a ride, being on the WRONG boat, crossing from East to West on a lovely little sailingboat, crossing from West to East on a bigger delivery boat. 3 totally different experiences with loads of ups, downs and lessons learned.
  • 75% of the first draft is finished
  • 40 hitch sailors and 30 captains have been interviewed to bring in more perspectives about the Atlantic Ocean hitchsailing situation
  • Interview results have been analysed
  • 80% of photo’s have been selected and edited
  • Video footage has been shot

What is left to be done?

  • Finish the final 25% of first draft
  • Have it proofread, edited, and finalize content
  • Have it formatted
  • Have content photos graphics compiled
  • Edit the video and if I manage incorporate that in the e-book
  • Design of the cover
  • Marketing
  • Launch it!
  • Save the ocean

When the crowd funding succeeds I expect to deliver:

First draft: May 15

Final draft: June 15

Final version: July 15

Launch: August 2016

Update: This was NOT realistic. ETA Spring 2017!

 

Photo: the course to paradise

Your Contribution

Your contribution helps me to (self) publish this e-book in a timely manner and give this project the care to make it good. While the costs of electronic publishing are low, the challenges of writing and publishing a qualitative, useful, fun e-book are many. With your support I will be able to speed up the process. I need to dedicate my time on optimizing the content and outsource tasks that are not my piece of cake. 

Contributions will be used for editing, proofreading, graphic design, formatting, website, launch and marketing, software like Scrivener, a share for a new typing machine so I can process the video footage, for the rewards which include cool ocean experiences and offsetting CO2 through coral adoption, and for the indiegogo transactions fees.

Whatever the amount raised, I will make it the best book it can be. I want it to be a unique, helpful and visual guide for future hitchsailors, those with an itch for adventure, a drive to make a difference, and those simply interested to read about the adventure. 

This campaign is about building support and buzz for my book and the ocean. The book is just the beginning. As the oceanpreneur, I continue to save the ocean, one splash at the time. First goal is to finish the e-book. Anything raised over the goal will allow for a (sustainably) printed version, contribution to a computer with which I can edit all the amazing footage I shot, and for more oceanpreneurial endeavours with the mission to save the ocean.

How can you contribute?

I understand that hitchsailing across an ocean is not for everyone. Whether it is for you or not, your contribution is very much welcome and one way or another I can show you the beauty of our ocean through some carefully explored rewards.

There are 3 ways you can support:

1. Contribute financially and receive the coolest rewards!

No matter the amount. Every action helps! For different numbers I created some cool rewards (Click ON the reward option for ordering):

1. The e-book of course! You can be the first to receive it or to give it away as a present.

2. The e-book as a give-away, which I send on behalf of you with a personal message from me.

3. An AIDA 1 * freedive course and certification, given by certified mermaid instructor Suz

4. A 1-hour skypecall to ask me anything about hitchsailing. You don't have to wait for the book to be finished to get on that boat! safe and prepaired.

5. Receive the Water-to-go refillable filtered water bottle + filter. You will never need to buy water again. You can take water from the dirtiest river and drink it safely through the filter. Perfect for on a boat. You can just drink water from the tank. With this you can be a great example to the people around you.

6. I will name a fish after you. When I’m in the funderwaterzone I will pick a beauty of a fish, name it after you and send you a picture + info why this fish is important so important for the ocean, for us.

7. Receive the 25l. Aquapac waterproof backpack that I haven't gone a day without in the last year. Whether you go (hitch)sailing, kayaking, kitesurfing or on another splashtastic adventure, your clothes will stay dry. I team up with these guys. You won't find a bag of this quality anywhere cheaper.

8. A ocean friendly diner to talk about the adventure, hitchsailing, and the ocean.  

9. Adopt a coral increasing life in the sea for food, protection, jobs, fun for both fish and humans. This will also help to offset this project. For this I work together with Coral Restoration Foundation Bonaire, where you can visit your coral growing up.

10. We're going hitchsailing together! We'll find boat for minimum 3 days/2nights somewhere in europe, this year. During this trip I will explain you all about hitchsailing, a life of adventure travel, life in the ocean and ocean conservation. We won't only be talking, we'll be doing good and have a hell of a good time too! A risky perk? Trust in me ;) I've been there before... *doesn't include transport and food expenses, or maybe it does! Depends on what we find...

Contributions are stated in US$ as only this currency allows for multiple payment options like paypal, creditcard, apple payment and banktransfer. Payments can be made with any currency or bank account. Processing costs will be deducted from the raised amount. No extra costs for you. If payment method doesn't matter for you, pick Paypal, which has the least amount of transaction costs.

2. Share the campaign with others

Make some splashes! Help me to get the word out. Share the excitement with a friend, colleague, cousin, or client.

Email this campaign to a friend, tweet it, share on facebook, instagram, or Linkedin. 

Indiegogo has great sharing buttons to make it easy. I also made a landing page to share this campaign in 3 clicks.

Or click here to tweet and share: No budget, no sailing experience but a dream to make a big sailingtrip! Support @oceanpreneur who’s writing how to do this! #hitchsailingbook #savetheocean

Use the hashtag #Hitchsailbook

3. Share your expertise

I welcome offers of help with this project. Are you a good proofreader, editor, book cover designer, virtual author assistant, web guy/girl, a knowledgeable (e) book publisher?

Or a fellow oceanpreneur? Let me hear from you through facebook, twitter, instagram or shoot me an email. Perhaps we can team up! Visit my website, www.TheOceanpreneur.com to see what oceanpreneurial adventures I’m up to.

 

Photo: 6 +18 days later. Arrived in paradise.

Risks and challenges

“I get up every morning determined to both change the world and have one hell of a good time. Sometimes this makes planning my day difficult. - E.B. White

I work on my book every day. But not the whole day. I also have to spend time with the ocean, freediving, hitchsailing, to keep myself energized to tackle the challenges, to get reminded of what I’m doing it all for, and to keep learning. Further I’m working on launching oceanpreneurial sailing expeditions to get more people involved in the ocean splashes! My goal is to have the book finished in summer 2016. It’s a doable challenge. With your support and my willpower and determination I don’t foresee any major problems.

Lots of love and a splashing thanks from the ocean! 

Suzanne

6. I will name a fish after you. When I’m in the funderwaterzone I will pick a beauty of a fish, name it after you and send you a picture + info why this fish is important so important for the ocean, for us.
7. Receive the 25l. Aquapac waterproof backpack that I haven't gone a day without in the last year. Whether you go (hitch)sailing, kayaking, kitesurfing or on another splashtastic adventure, your clothes will stay dry. I team up with these guys. You won't find a bag of this quality anywhere cheaper.
8. A ocean friendly diner to talk about the adventure, hitchsailing, and the ocean.  
9. Adopt a coral increasing life in the sea for food, protection, jobs, fun for both fish and humans. This will also help to offset this project. For this I work together with Coral Restoration Foundation Bonaire, where you can visit your coral growing up.
10. We're going hitchsailing together! We'll find boat for minimum 3 days/2nights somewhere in europe, this year. During this trip I will explain you all about hitchsailing, a life of adventure travel, life in the ocean and ocean conservation. We won't only be talking, we'll be doing good and have a hell of a good time too! A risky perk? Trust in me ;) I've been there before... *doesn't include transport and food expenses, or maybe it does! Depends on what we find...
Contributions are stated in US$ as only this currency allows for multiple payment options like paypal, creditcard, apple payment and banktransfer. Payments can be made with any currency or bank account. Processing costs will be deducted from the raised amount. No extra costs for you. If payment method doesn't matter for you, pick Paypal, which has the least amount of transaction costs.
2. Share the campaign with others
Make some splashes! Help me to get the word out. Share the excitement with a friend, colleague, cousin, or client.
Email this campaign to a friend, tweet it, share on facebook, instagram, or Linkedin. Indiegogo has great sharing buttons to make it easy. I also made a landing page to share this campaign in 3 clicks.
Or click here to tweet and share: No budget, no sailing experience but a dream to make a big sailingtrip! Support @oceanpreneur who’s writing how to do this! #hitchsailingbook #savetheocean
Use the hashtag #Hitchsailbook
3. Share your expertise
I welcome offers of help with this project. Are you a good proofreader, editor, book cover designer, virtual author assistant, web guy/girl, a knowledgeable (e) book publisher?
Or a fellow oceanpreneur? Let me hear from you through facebook, twitter, instagram or shoot me an email. Perhaps we can team up! Visit my website, www.TheOceanpreneur.com to see what oceanpreneurial adventures I’m up to.
 
Photo: 6 +18 days later. Arrived in paradise.Risks and challenges
“I get up every morning determined to both change the world and have one hell of a good time. Sometimes this makes planning my day difficult. - E.B. White
I work on my book every day. But not the whole day. I also have to spend time with the ocean, freediving, hitchsailing, to keep myself energized to tackle the challenges, to get reminded of what I’m doing it all for, and to keep learning. Further I’m working on launching oceanpreneurial sailing expeditions to get more people involved in the ocean splashes! My goal is to have the book finished in summer 2016. It’s a doable challenge. With your support and my willpower and determination I don’t foresee any major problems.
Lots of love and a splashing thanks from the ocean! 
Suzanne
 

Remember, "If it can be dreamt, it can be done." - Walt Disney

story:
The Short Version

I an independent author, sometime blogger, historian, and currently a soldier in the Israel Defense Force. I have also been a huge fan of science fiction, specifically space opera, all my life, and the Galaxy Ascendant is the product of my love of the genre, and a desire to uplift a genre that for a long time has been somewhat stagnant—and more recently, as an alternative to the inferior products put out by the major franchises that inspired me, or at least by those that aren’t just completely dead.

Through this campaign, I am seeking to raise the money to cover the costs of getting this book out and into the hands of readers like you. The book is already completed, and is currently going through the editorial process, while the cover art is also in progress, along with an updated galaxy map. Being able to raise these funds will grant me the ability to continue to put out quality work without the immense pressure that is the cost required to get it out (army salaries are nothing to write home about), and will allow me to move forward with the series and other projects at a much faster pace. In fact, the outlines for the next two books in the series are already complete, and I intend to start writing imminently.

This might also be a unique crowdfund, in that I am funding book 3 in the series. My primary reason for this was thus: I wanted to get out quality work completely on my own at first, in order to demonstrate without a shadow of a doubt that I can and will get the project done, and make it awesome.

What I Need & What You Get

I need to cover the costs of the editing, the cover art, a new galaxy map (as the area of the galaxy the story takes place in has significantly increased for this book), as well as the formatting. With your help, I will be able to get everything ready quickly, and the book (whether ebook or print) out to you as soon as possible.

I have a few stretch goals already in place, and a couple others in mind, and which I may present to backers as options down the line, if it looks like we’ll get there. I’d love to get audio versions of the series made, as well as hardcover, perhaps a comic adaptation, and who knows? If we go crazy high, I could even see about other, more extravagant things, in addition to potentially covering production costs of future books in the Galaxy Ascendant series. The stars are the limit!

And, as this is the third book in the series I am seeking to fund here, those of you new to the Galaxy Ascendant can jump in now and get nearly half the series all in one go, giving you much more to read as I work on books 4 and 5, the outlines of which are both already complete. And, as of right now, book 4 is well under way!

If there are any perks you would like so see that aren't already listed here, don't hesitate to run them by me, and I'll see what I can do!

The Impact

Help bring space opera back to its former prominence!

The Galaxy Ascendant series is one of the most ambitious fiction projects ever undertaken by a single writer. Throughout the three books so far, there are more than a dozen unique aliens species, nearly 150 named characters, and grand, interwoven plotlines that set the stage not only for the rest of this seven book series, but for many, many more stories to come. I am not just writing a book series here. I am creating a living, breathing galaxy whose presence will only continue to expand.

At the same time, the Galaxy Ascendant recaptures a sense of heroism that is lost in much of modern fiction. Virtuous heroes and heroines who strive to do the right thing, despite the challenges before them.

Play a role in bringing back fun, creativity, and heroism back to a genre that can and should personify all of those things!

 

Risks & Challenges

None! As I mentioned above, the book is already written, and the editing, cover art, and galaxy map are all in progress. The book will come out no matter the outcome of this campaign, but its success will greatly increase my ability to move the series along.

As you can also see above, I have already released the first two books in the series, both of which have been well received, and you can be sure that I will keep the level of quality the same. The cover art is once again being done by the incredible John Zeleznik, and the editing by the excellent Ben Zwycky. Additionally, a new, updated galaxy map is in progress, being done by Cornelia Yoder, who made the awesome map in my recently released fantasy novel, The Dragon Hand.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out about the Galaxy Ascendant! Let people know that there are fun alternatives to the universes that have gone in disappointing directions. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
In the Shadow of Prometheus is a science fantasy adventure novel set in the backdrop of the early 24th century. Enter a world of Vanguards and Insurgents in this expansive setting with gamified elements.

 

 

 

It is the year 2319. A new age has dawned and a governmental body known as "The Ethocratic Republic" has brought freedom and liberty to all across the globe.

 

 

Helping to maintain the peace in this utopic future are the Vanguard, elected officials with augmented strength, endurance and sharp natural intellect. 

 

 

Humanity has flourished and the Vanguard stand strong as a symbol of the unity and strength at the heart of civilisation.

 

 

But even paradise has its share of shadows. After decades of peace, conflict is brewing - old injuries are starting to seethe, and vendettas thought long forgotten have once again risen to the surface. 

Now, an insurgency lies in wait, determined to bring the Ethocracy and its Vanguard protectors to their knees. War is brewing, and the Ethocratic Republic must fight to justify its existence against the tide of malice on the horizon. 

 

 

In the Shadow of Prometheus follows Oni Anagonye and Vanguard team K:10 Theta as they attempt to unearth this conspiracy and close the threat of the Machiavellians before they cause irreperable damage to their society.

 

 

The novel is just the beginning. The world of Prometheus is far-reaching and steeped in lore. Discover for yourself with the release of Volume I.

 

 

The Backer and Founder Editions

In the Shadow of Prometheus comes in 2 Indiegogo exclusive versions, the Backer and Founder editions.

 

The Backer's edition of "In the Shadow of Prometheus features the paperback cover designed by 2 of Authocracy's fantastic illustrators, Ben Mills and Brandon Ellis.

 

 

A modest upgrade from the Backer's Edition of "In the Shadow of Prometheus," the Founder's edition features the Hardback cover adorned with the Vanguard symbol. Please note that this is a mock-up and the final cover design may be subject to change.

 

What's Inside?

Adorned with over 100+ full-colour illustrations created in a collaborative effort between artists Ben Mills and Brandon Ellis, both editions bring the world of Prometheus to life in your hands.

 

 

Extras

Your support for this project means the world to us, and that is why we offer a variety of Prometheus themed extras depending on your selected reward bundle.

 

Bookmarks

To accompany your edition of "In the Shadow of Prometheus," you will recieve one of four Prometheus themed bookmarks unique to this launch.

 

Rpg Cards

As part of our RPG-enabled bundles, you will recieve a deck of sixteen character cards from the Prometheus universe.

 

Posters

Should you pledge for one of the Enhanced RPG, Signature or All-In bundles, you will receive one of two Prometheus posters. You will be able to choose which poster you recieve.

 

 

You can help bring this project to life by pledging on one of the tiers below. 

 

£9 — Digital Bundle

 

Digital Bundle backers will receive a DRM-free PDF with contents identical to the print version of the backer's edition. They will also receive exclusive wallpapers, soundtrack files, animated content, and more!

Includes:

1x DRM-free PDF

2x Wallpapers

1x Soundtrack MP3

2x HD Trailer MOVS

1x Digital Artbook

3x Campaign Modules

 

£17 — Backer's Paperback Edition

 

This Indiegogo edition will only ever be available through this campaign.  Your copy of Prometheus Volume One will show that you were among the first adopters of Authocracy and its flagship title. This perk also includes all the offerings of our digital goodies bundle. A £26 value in all!

Includes:

1x Digital Bundle (See above)

1x Backer's Edition

 

£34 — Tabletop RPG Supplement Bundle

 

Our team has partnered with experts and influential personalities in the TTRPG scene to develop a flexible, lightweight roleplaying system as an added bonus.  We are particularly proud to have the support and endorsement of AllThingsDnD, a premier institution of tabletop roleplaying in the YouTube scene. 

In addition to all the rewards of the Backer's bundle, you will receive a bevy of one-page adventure scenarios developed by the author in concert with gaming experts, as well as a luxury, Prometheus-themed GM screen w/ accompanying ruleset, and 'operator cards' which will convey character, class, and equipment details in an attractive and efficient manner.

Includes:

1x Digital Bundle (See above)

1x Backer's Edition

1x GM Board

1x 16 card pack

5x Printed Modules

 

£39 — Founder's Hardback Edition Bundle

 

This is a top-end hardcover edition, the likes of which will never be put into print again. Made with silver inlay, dense sheets and exceptional print quality: this edition will include a forward, acknowledgments, and appendices for reference and further immersion into the world of Prometheus.

Includes:

1x Digital Bundle (See above)

1x Backer's Edition

1x Founder's Edition

 

£69 — Signature Bundle

 

This tier comes with both the Backers and Founders editions of the book, the digital bundle, and a premium-quality artbook for Prometheus Volume One, containing the curated art and commentary of Ben Mills.  As indicated by the title of this bundle, all three books will be signed.

Includes:

1x Digital Bundle (See above)

1x Backer's Edition (Signed)

1x Founder's Edition (Signed)

1x Artbook (Signed)

 

£89 — The All-in Bundle

 

The All-in Bundle is an enhancement of the Signature Bundle. In addition to what is offered in the previous reward tier, players will also receive all the TTRPG materials offered in the Tabletop bundle with three additional scenarios and upgraded materials for the GM screen and accompanying box. All related assets will specify these as limited-edition versions of the game set.  

You will also receive a hand-signed letter from the author thanking you for your extraordinary effort and support in helping to make this project come alive, and a note of acknowledgment in perpetuity on the website hub for Prometheus.

Includes:

1x Digital Bundle (See above)

1x Backer's Edition (Signed)

1x Founder's Edition (Signed)

1x Enhanced GM Board

1x 16 card pack

9x Printed Modules

1x Printed Poster (Choice of 2)

 

 

Prometheus is a sprawling world populated with intriguing characters and 3 distinct factions. To help bring you deeper into this world, allow us to break down this science fantasy setting.

 

 

 

 


 

 

Risks & Challenges

Bringing 'Prometheus' to Authocracy's lavish format was a labor of love, motivated by the studio's belief in two guiding principles: fans deserve to have a premium experience unmired by corporate blunders or interference, and artists and writers of exceptional talent deserve the opportunity to make an honest living from their work.

Our founders are experts in every step of the process from production to distribution, having worked in various administrative and leadership roles within the publishing industry for years. 

Authocracy.com spent its first 15 months of operation cultivating the infrastructure needed to ensure that our customers can reasonably expect nothing less than the exceptional product they deserve. While there are of course risks inherent in any production process, we have set up redundancies to secure a smooth roll-out for the publication of its first major release.

story:
I am Garrett Buhl Robinson and in 2012 I began setting up my bookstand in the parks of New York City to bring literature to life for the public.  Through the years, I have been promoting my publications, reciting my poetry and singing my songs to anyone who had a few minutes to listen.  

Now, I am establishing my own publishing company.  So, even when I am not at my bookstand, I am still the Poet in the Park.  

City of Poems

My debut with the company is a poetic pictorial celebrating humanity and glorious New York City.  The release date is set for March 30, 2021 - the 10th anniversary of the day I arrived in New York City.  

This is a large, hardcover book - each page is 11 x 8.5 inches.  The size of a regular piece of paper set horizontally.  

The book consists of 25 spectacular images of New York City accompanied with some of my new poems.  

Here are two samples, "Literary Figures" and "Profession":

  

"Literary Figures" and "Profession" (see below).  Check out the video for an audio recording of me reciting the poems along my commute to work on the Manhattan Bridge with a spectacular view of the Brooklyn Bridge and New York City.  

And here is the presentation of "Profession" in City of Poems.

I think you'll like it. 

With a $50 contribution, I will send you an autographed copy along with some more of my books.  Please check out the perks.  

City of Poems will be available for purchase on March 30, 2021 for $34.99.  However, the books I send for the funding campaign will be the first printed for the public and I will individually number and sign each book then ship it directly to you.  

 

Expenses

For the campaign, I have set a goal of $750.  This amount will help provide the means to cover some important expenses.   

$225 - Trade Mark registration

$150 - general office supplies (printer ink, paper, etc.)

$375- inventory for my bookstand

total - $750 

What This Means

I began writing poetry as a teenager and through the years, I have struggled to find a way to reach the public with my literature.  For years I tried the conventional means of querying publishers, submitting to literary journals and schmoozing with anyone who might appreciate the melodious music of lyrical poetry.  I kept working.  I kept producing.  However, I couldn't reach anyone.  

Finally, I decided I would find my audience directly.  If anything was going to happen, I had to make it happen.  So, I set my bookstand up in the parks and along the streets of Manhattan and when people walked by, I just asked a simple question - "Would you like to hear a poem?"  No one is obligated to stop.  New York City is the most dynamic place on the planet and people are busy here!  However, on some occasions, someone would stop and say, "Yes."  And then I poured my heart out for them.  It is a meager means.  It is tough.  It is grueling.  However, it is also a breakthrough for me.  I have finally found a way to communicate with the public through my poetry!

Your interest and your support in the launch of Poet in the Park will be an invaluable help.  Plus,  you can get some wonderful books in return.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell others!  Request my books at your local libraries!  I have been receiving some of the most amazing reactions from people.  Please, let your friends, family and coworkers know about my campaign and my books.  Together, we can bring more music, beauty and poetry into the world and that seems like a really good idea to me!
story_txt: I am Garrett Buhl Robinson and in 2012 I began setting up my bookstand in the parks of New York City to bring literature to life for the public.  Through the years, I have been promoting my publications, reciting my poetry and singing my songs to anyone who had a few minutes to listen.  Now, I am establishing my own publishing company.  So, even when I am not at my bookstand, I am still the Poet in the Park.  City of PoemsMy debut with the company is a poetic pictorial celebrating humanity and glorious New York City.  The release date is set for March 30, 2021 - the 10th anniversary of the day I arrived in New York City.  This is a large, hardcover book - each page is 11 x 8.5 inches.  The size of a regular piece of paper set horizontally.  The book consists of 25 spectacular images of New York City accompanied with some of my new poems.  Here are two samples, "Literary Figures" and "Profession":  "Literary Figures" and "Profession" (see below).  Check out the video for an audio recording of me reciting the poems along my commute to work on the Manhattan Bridge with a spectacular view of the Brooklyn Bridge and New York City.  And here is the presentation of "Profession" in City of Poems.I think you'll like it. With a $50 contribution, I will send you an autographed copy along with some more of my books.  Please check out the perks.  City of Poems will be available for purchase on March 30, 2021 for $34.99.  However, the books I send for the funding campaign will be the first printed for the public and I will individually number and sign each book then ship it directly to you.   ExpensesFor the campaign, I have set a goal of $750.  This amount will help provide the means to cover some important expenses.   $225 - Trade Mark registration$150 - general office supplies (printer ink, paper, etc.)$375- inventory for my bookstandtotal - $750 What This MeansI began writing poetry as a teenager and through the years, I have struggled to find a way to reach the public with my literature.  For years I tried the conventional means of querying publishers, submitting to literary journals and schmoozing with anyone who might appreciate the melodious music of lyrical poetry.  I kept working.  I kept producing.  However, I couldn't reach anyone.  Finally, I decided I would find my audience directly.  If anything was going to happen, I had to make it happen.  So, I set my bookstand up in the parks and along the streets of Manhattan and when people walked by, I just asked a simple question - "Would you like to hear a poem?"  No one is obligated to stop.  New York City is the most dynamic place on the planet and people are busy here!  However, on some occasions, someone would stop and say, "Yes."  And then I poured my heart out for them.  It is a meager means.  It is tough.  It is grueling.  However, it is also a breakthrough for me.  I have finally found a way to communicate with the public through my poetry!Your interest and your support in the launch of Poet in the Park will be an invaluable help.  Plus,  you can get some wonderful books in return.   Other Ways You Can HelpPlease tell others!  Request my books at your local libraries!  I have been receiving some of the most amazing reactions from people.  Please, let your friends, family and coworkers know about my campaign and my books.  Together, we can bring more music, beauty and poetry into the world and that seems like a really good idea to me!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nina Raman and I am the author of Everything You Wanted. I wrote this book because I wanted to share a story about growing up with a battle of perfection, but with a dark twist.

My hope is that in reading this book, you will discover that your desires are not wrong. They might turn out to be everything you wanted, or they might turn your life completely upside down. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to discover yourself and learn how your decisions have a massive effect on your life. I want this book to be a way for you to escape a world of your own and live through a group of teens who enter a whole new world of fear, mystery, and the unknown. 

Wren Clements has spent her whole life trying to be perfect. As her high school career is about to come to an end, she realizes that what she wants more than her amazing grades, her numerous extracurriculars, and even more than her spot at UPenn, is to live like a normal teenager for one crazy, lawless night. She embarks on an evening filled with things she would never do... including a murder? Could this star student be the perfect suspect, or could this be the perfect crime?

You will love this book if you love relatable and diverse characters, juicy love stories, and a perfectly gruesome crime. Everything You Wanted speaks to teenagers and adults who want to grapple with perfection and desire vs. regret in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Everything You Wanted inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Do you have any regrets in life?
  • Are you willing to risk everything to fulfill a desire?
  • Are you happy with yourself, or want something someone else has?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing what truly matters to you, the battle of perfection, and personal growth will change us all for the better. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Nina Raman is a junior Management Information Systems major at Temple University in Philadelphia, PA. Although her major is technical and she spends most of her time running clubs and meeting new people, she always makes time for her true love: writing. 


Her dream since she was in 3rd grade was to always be an author. She’s been obsessed with storytelling for as long as she can remember, so it’s no question why she decided to write a book. Nina’s goal has always been to help people feel something like a connection, even if they don’t have one in real life. Characters are our friends, family, teachers, enemies, and lovers. She hopes that you will feel connected to a character or two, learn from their mistakes, and even make a few of your own. She wants you to not just read her story, but live in it.

When Nina doesn’t have her nose in a book or is vigorously typing out the lines of her novel on her laptop, she loves meeting new people, exploring new places, trying new food, and hanging out with friends. And if she’s ever late (which she almost always is,) she most likely stopped to pet a dog. 

For more information, you can connect with Nina Raman at ninaraman00@gmail.com and at Instagram: @ninaramanwrites TikTok: @nina_raman Twitter: @nina_noodles1 LinkedIn: Nina Raman .

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and TikTok with your friends, family, and network. Please use #EverythingYouWanted and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nina Raman

story:
You can still order - we don't have to quit at 100%

 

If you asked for a print version, this is for YOU!

 

What Has Happened Already:

  • 14 readers test-read the collection in December 2015
  • Extensive revisions improved and refined the content
  • 200 of you enjoyed the collection in its online version in December 2016
  • A printer is prepared to produce elegant hardcover editions

 

Who Loved This in 2016:

  • the educated reader who skipped Sunday School but wants Bible literacy
  • the poetry reader curious about what faith offers
  • the disillusioned reader who saw the Bible as condemnation rather than invitation
  • the advent reader who wanted more substance than sentiment in her devotions
  • the believing reader who felt flat and craved fresh anticipation and joy in a familiar season
  • the book club who wanted a way to make the season matter

 

Why Bother with Print?

People Who Loved This are my motivation.  I want to share a version that doesn't disappear with a low battery or depend on any device, a version that sits in your hands with comforting texture and weight, a version that can become ritual and tradition in a way digital text just can't.  I want to offer something that lasts for readers who took a risk.

 

What Happens Next, Thanks to You:

My starting goal is to release 100 copies in the first run.  Each hardcover will cost $12 to print, $5 to sell, and $8 to handle and ship.  That makes my initial goal $2500.

All the backers in the first run of print editions will receive a free digital download of the audio book with recordings of the poet (me) reading each poem.

 

What's In It for Me?

I'm passionate about literature and literacy.  Well-crafted language is wildly powerful and unspeakably precious as a precise, compact expression of heart and mind.  If I can invite readers toward poetry in a way that enhances their appreciation of artistry as well as their critical thinking, I've done something worthwhile with my time.  Ted Kooser writes, "Poetry is a lot more important than poets," and I believe him.  I'm not interested in fame or recognition, but in giving people ways to engage and understand their own experiences with greater clarity.  I believe there's a quality of life at stake, the examined life that is so very worth living, and I don't want to leave without doing my part to enhance it.

 

Why This is Worth the Risk:

If we don't lift more weight, we never grow stronger.  If we don't converse with new ideas, we miss out on refining our own.  This is worth the risk of reading outside what's familiar or easy because it's a stretch.  Give it a try, not to see my mind at work, but to explore new corners of your own.

story:
Short Summary

Face Flat explores the concept of what it means to follow your own path and what failure can teach you. It's a series of short stories with lessons learned in politics and a restaurant - two very unique and different industries that can teach you a lot about yourself and others.  

My name is Vanessa Millones and I am the author of Face Flat. I wrote this book because I wanted to share my unique journey of working for the Obama White House and then as a server at a restaurant. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover through failure you can find that lessons exist in all corners. And through these lessons, you will realize that you never fell off the "path" you planned - you were on it all along. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn what it was like working at the Obama White House, and, at the same time, the insights from working in the restaurant industry. Lessons are everywhere, especially after falling face flat - you just have to look a little harder.

You will love this book if you are a young ambitious individual who loves structure and cringes at the idea of uncertainty.

Face Flat speaks to young ambitious people or those who want to pivot and who want to look at failure differently while discovering their own journey.

Ultimately, I hope that it inspires reflection and meaningful dialogue, pressing into questions like:

Is your path supposed to look a certain way and if so, what happens if you go off course? Or, do we really need to have it all perfectly planned out in order to fit the stereotypical idea of what it means to lead a successful life? And if we don’t follow this plan, does that mean we steered away from our journey?

I'm excited to explore these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing politics, the validity and importance of working in the restaurant industry, and learning what it means to follow your own plan.
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter 2020
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

About the Author

Vanessa Millones is an MBA student at Georgetown’s McDonough School of Business and former Director and Advisor of the Leadership Development Team in the Office of Presidential Personnel at the Obama White House. She is also a somewhat decent waitress.

I was compelled to write this book because I want to remind people in unsteady and uncertain situations that it will pass and even better, you might also grow a little. Uncertainty is tough, especially for really structured and ambitious people; it is hard for anyone - we are not wired to be comfortable with unpredictability. When you are presented with uncertainty or imbalance whether it’s because of failure or external forces, instead of feeling confused or a sense of loss, I say, embrace it: the good, the bad, the ugly, the humor, the anger etc. Because that very detour will bring you where you are meant to be all along.

I too am a very structured individual who had big plans for myself when I left my job of working for President Obama in 2017, to whom I had essentially dedicated most of my 20s. When my plans unexpectedly changed, I was lost and felt anger and shame. I have always been keenly aware of the steps I take in navigating my journey, but more so, I am eager to share those tools and lessons to help the younger generation navigate their own path.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FaceFlat and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!
Vanessa Millones

story:
Story of My Book

Reclaiming Control is a non-fiction, personal development book about learning how to take control of the things we can, and how to let go of what we can't. Instead of getting distracted by the noise around us, Reclaiming Control encourages you to look inward to live with intention and meaning.

My name is Amy McMillen, and I am the author of Reclaiming Control. I decided to write this book because last year, I finally took ownership of my own life. For a long time, I had this unnerving voice inside my head that I wasn't living life on my terms. I felt pulled in all sorts of directions by everything around me — the prescribed path of "success", the desire to do something impactful, my parents, my friends, my email inbox, my health, the hustle and bustle of New York City...

I didn't know it at the time, but I was experiencing burnout; not simply by my job, but by life. Studies have shown that burnout isn't necessarily being busy or working too hard, but rather the lack of control that individuals feel over their situations.

In this book, I'll take you on a journey of how I came to realize that the power to reclaim control was within me all along. I also introduce you to others who are on their own journeys and helping others as well, including entrepreneurs, psychologists, and coaches. You'll learn how people are redefining and creating their own meaning of success day by day, and how to lay the foundation of moments filled with mindful love, compassion, and kindness towards yourself and others.

In this book, you'll learn about burnout, mindfulness, and emotional intelligence through three parts:
  • How we lost control and how burnout, loneliness, depression, and anxiety became epidemics
  • How we can learn skills of looking inward to discern what to control and what to let go
  • How it isn't just self-help— it's about having the capacity to care for others, work, and the environment as well
If you've been following a certain narrative of your life without truly questioning it, or telling yourself that people like you don't get to dream or be creative, then this book is for you. If you've been working towards the American dream, only to find out that perhaps that wasn't your own dream at all, then this book is for you. If you've ever felt stuck, lost, lonely, or confused in who you are or what you're doing, then this book is also for you. If you've ever told yourself that "one day" you'll get it together, then this book is for you.
 

The Book - Reclaiming Control


The book is written in three parts:

Part 1: How We Lost Control. The first section focuses on the stories you've been told growing up, the prescribed path of traditional success, and the role of technology and education in the mental health crisis. You'll also learn why now is a pivotal time for these issues, especially for those who come from low-income, immigrant, and/or multicultural families.

Part 2: Skills to Reclaim. These chapters include foundations of mindfulness and emotional intelligence to observe, accept, and manage thoughts and feelings. You'll also learn what design thinking and the scientific method can teach about designing life experiments to reframe failure. Part two offers tangible examples for you to discern what to reclaim and what to let go, moment by moment.

Part 3: Beyond Yourself. The last section focuses on how reclaiming control over your own life helps your friendships, families, communities, organizations, and the Earth be more sustainable as well. You'll learn how innovation can stem from emotions and adversity, and only when you recalibrate your thoughts, feelings, and actions to align with your values can you provide the most impact.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. Any funds above the baseline goal of $4000 will be going towards a COVID19 related cause.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note
  • A hand-painted bookmark
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Amy McMillen started her career in New York City as a product manager working in financial technology until she decided that the most important product to her is personal and collective well-being. So she packed up her Times Square apartment and redesigned her life to value freedom, learning, and creativity. Since then, she's traveled across the world, exploring and writing about identity, well being, and sustainability.

Amy attended the University of Virginia where she studied Systems & Environmental Engineering. There, she co-founded the Human Library, Charlottesville, facilitated Designing Your Life seminars, and conducted research in mental health technology. She likes to drink tea, paint, and be in nature.

For more information you can connect with Amy at amymcmai.com and @amymcmai on Instagram and Twitter.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute financially, there are other ways to help:
  • You can share my Pre-sale Campaign on social media with your friends, family and network. Please use #ReclaimingControl and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can directly share my my campaign to friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it.

Thank you again for your support!

Much love and light,
Amy

story:
The Story of My Book

My name is Colette Tracy and I am the author of the book Both Sides Now: Reflections for
Women at Midlife. I wrote this book because I have not seen many positive books on aging, and particularly for and about women.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will recognize yourself in these pages and take inspiration from the community of women that share the unique experience of this time in life. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for living life at this time. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool, and also as a close friend sharing the same struggles, tears, triumphs and joys that is life.

In this book you will recognize that regardless of life's challenges; our faith, strength, resilience, and self care can bring us back to a healthy place in life.

You'll hear stories about women who journeyed through devastating depression to come out on the other side to live a life of love, peace, and fulfillment. You'll hear stories about women who lived through abusive relationships and extreme physical illness that healed through faith, self love, and self care. You'll hear stories about women that used their difficult times in life to make them strong and to ultimately become a beacon of light and guidance for thousands of other women.

You will love this book if:

  • You are looking for connection and inspiration to live your best life at this time and all your times to come.
  • You are looking for a guide to give you inspiration and encouragement to move forward and live your life on your terms.
  • You are interested in the way women are cultured to care and nurture others and how these beautiful qualities we possess can help us to better care for and love ourselves as well.

Both Sides Now is a nonfiction book that speaks to middle aged women and all people who want to look at life from a more empowered perspective.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Colette Tracy is a Professor at National Louis University in Chicago and the Founder of Education for Growth, a nonprofit in Chicago, IL. Colette highly prizes and values education, and believes it is the greatest equalizer and connector amongst people.

Colette wrote this book because she hopes to empower women and all people to find the best in them and in life. Life is difficult, there is no getting away from that, and as we age we will eventually come upon loss and sorrow. However, the message that Colette wants to spread is that we can embrace life and still find peace, even in times of sorrow.

Colette very much loves to cook and entertain. She and her husband Mike both have large families that live in the area, and between the families and friends, there is always a party going on! Colette is very proud of her now grown children and prides herself on being a support for them. Colette's friends tell her that she is very witty and credit her with sayings that they call "Coletteism's."

For more information you can reach Colette at colette.tracy@att.net
https://www.linkedin.com/in/colette-tracy-60675815/

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BothSidesNow and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoyit via text or direct message on social media.


Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!
Thanks again,
Colette Tracy

story:
Marriage is meant to be the adventure of a lifetime! 

Unfortunately, many couples struggle to truly enjoy one another after they get married.  

We want to change that.

My husband Erv and I have been happily married for 19 years.  While it hasn't been perfect, there's a lot we've learned about making your marriage extraordinary.

We've discovered three key elements of an adventurous marriage: effective money management, authentic communication and a dynamic sex life.

When you give attention to these three areas, you open the doors of opportunity to an adventurous life together.

In our upcoming book, "Marriage Adventures," we share these principles in the context of our own love story.  

Between the two of us, our parents have been married six times.  When we were married in 1993, we were determined to start a new generation.

From our twenty years of experience working with young couples, we’ve learned that this is the hope of all young couples.  They want their first marriage to be their only marriage, but they aren’t sure how to make it happen.  They need role models and guidance to make their new marriage last a lifetime.

This book will provide a blueprint for young adults allowing them to enjoy an adventure-filled marriage. 

Will you help us make that happen through the publication of Marriage Adventures? 

 

Risks and Challenges

There are two big challenges with this project. The first is getting the book written. Right now, the book is 75% complete! This is very exciting. Once the writing is finished, there is the arduous process of editing, rewriting, formatting, printing, etc.

Fortunately, this is our second book, so we know we have what it takes to finish strong. We know it requires a lot of patience and persistence. Your support will keep us driving forward through that process!

The second big challenge is that writing doesn't pay well. I currently work about 20 hours a week between writing my blog and the book. Most of that work is done for free with the hopes that the book will be successful and earn enough money to pay me back for all that time. It's a big risk, but I've taken it willingly because I so believe in the message of Marriage Adventures!

Also, there are several real costs involved in the production of a book. We need to pay for cover design, interior design, layout, editing, formatting, printing, and shipping. Each of these costs adds up fast, which is why we decided to launch this campaign.

We appreciate your partnership with us!

story:
Hello! My name is Carl Ottersen.  I am a travel writer and photographer, having written a guide book for Athens last year, published many travel articles from around the world and contribute articles for the online magazine Reveal Italy.  I am also a director No Trees Publishing Ltd of England, an eBook publishing start-up.

 

About the Project

This book, the Great Guide to Liguria, will be published as a digital book (an ebook). Its purpose is to present the beauty of this region in Italy in a new, refreshing style, using the flexibility and functions of eBook technology today to bring the book to life.

 Liguria and the Italian Riviera is the region of Italy that curves around from Tuscany and running into France. It has a spectacular coastline, with places like Portofino and the Cinque Terre famous the world over. The Riviera is also very well known for its broad golden sand beaches and clear water, ideal for family vacations. Places like Sanremo and Alassio were the places to go in the 1950s and 1960s. There are also some fascinating tracks inland, up to the peaks and passes over the mountains into Piedmont and Lombardy.  Dotted like jewels in this beautiful tapestry are a myriad of small towns and villages, their houses painted in classic Mediterranean colors, set among silvery olive groves. This eBook takes you to see the best of them.

The Great Guide to Liguria has five sections: what to see, what to do, where to stay, what to buy and, as a special extra, recipes from the region.  I am profiling a limited selection of each, so that the reader is entertained by the book itself and enticed to visit the region.

 

The Campaign

As you can imagine, I have to visit each place personally.  Partly because I need to take good photographs and video, partly because I have to decide what should be in, and what should be out.  There are hundreds of places; I have already made a shortlist and have visited some locations. The structure of the book is in place and I’m writing content every day. 

However there are still many places to visit.  Since I’m in Liguria, this is quite easy, but I need to cover travel expenses, the occasional overnight stay, some equipment costs and a proportion of my time.

Funding will let me focus 100% on the book, so I can publish and launch it for the summer season.

 

What I need

I have costed my funding requirement at £4,000.  This breaks down as follows:

Fuel and Highway tolls - 550

Overnight stays - 250

Supplies - 300

Software - 250

Time - 2,370

IndieGogo Fees - 280

 

What I offer

I want everyone who funds me to get back more than they contribute.  As you can see in the Perks section, there are five contribution bands: £5, £15, £25, £50 and £100.

For the £5 contribution I will send you a full size digital poster of Liguria (you can select from a gallery of twelve) that is worth £10.  Yes, you have to print it, but I’m doing it this way to get it to you straight away.

For the £15 contribution, I will send you a copy of the book when complete, which will be sold at £4.99.  Inside the book is a voucher worth €20 (approximately £18) which can be redeemed when you stay in a hotel listed in the book.  So for a £15 contribution, you earn £23.

For the £25 contribution, on top of what a £15 contribution gets you, I will send you a full size digital poster of Liguria (you can select from a gallery of twelve) that is worth £10.  Yes, you have to print it, but I’m doing it this way to save shipping costs.  So for a £25 contribution, you earn £33.

For the £50 contribution, on top of what a £25 contribution gets you, I will send you a local product (you can select from a list of six) that is worth £25, including shipping costs if in Europe.  So for a £50 contribution, you earn £58.

For the £100 contribution, on top of what a £50 contribution gets you, you will have a free night’s stay in a double room (subject to availability) at any of the participating hotels, worth no less than £75.  So for a £100 contribution, you earn £133.

For everyone who contributes, I will keep them updated weekly on progress, with clips, fotos and information posted in IndieGoGo, on YouTube and on the Facebook page.

 

What happens if I don't reach my Goal?

The priority is first to cover off the fuel costs, then the overnight stays. After that its the equipment (what I have is workable, I would be more productive with better) and finally, of course, is the contribution to my time and effort. 

 

Why is it good to do this?

I hope that from your point of view, as a contributor you can see that in quantifiable terms I am giving back more than I receive.

For the reader of the book, I’m sure that the way I present some really lovely places in Liguria will inspire them to visit, explore and enjoy, confident that what would be a good vacation is made something memorable.

For the region of Liguria, and specifically the hoteliers and local producers, I hope this helps them leverage the beauty of the region to revitalize tourism; it’s deserved but hasn’t been presented to the world as it could be.

Just so its clear, my interest is in making and publishing the book: I’m not a tour operator and my business is not in promoting hotels.  They are in because they are good (and I know, in a previous career I was a director of a hotel group), and because they will give a discount to the reader who stays there, not a booking fee to me.

 

Does the Concept work?

Yes, definitely.  Together with my friends in Greece, late last year we published “Reveal Athens”, which hit front page listings as the first true eBook to promote Athens and has definitely encouraged people to visit the city.  I did the main photography, book layout, contributed to and edited the location articles. You can find it on the iTunes bookstore - just type in "Reveal Athens".

 

Should this Project work?

Passion for writing about interesting places aside, yes, it should.  The region is well known of course, and can always be presented better with today’s technology, something which hasn’t been done yet.  I have the experience not only of travel writing in general, but also seeing the successful launch of the eBook on Athens.

The digital book will be published by No Trees Publishing Ltd of England (I am a director of this company) on Apple’s iTunes bookstore as an iBook, directly in ePub3 format and in ePub/Mobi format on Amazon (this, unfortunately, without the interactivity of the other two, but still valid).  That triples the market presence compared to Reveal Athens, which is only available in iBook format.

On top of that, I am introducing the idea of a redeemable voucher worth €20 (£18) for each an every book sold which is worth more than the book price itself.  This wasn’t in the Reveal Athens book, so it’s an innovation.  It certainly should be a powerful hook which I hope will be a very effective marketing tool for the promotion and selling of the book itself.  

To give you an idea of how confident I am, once this project is done I will start another for the county of Kent in England (known as the “Garden of England”) and later this year for the islands of Java and Flores (that’s two books) in Indonesia.

 

If you can't contribute but would like to help

Simple! I need ‘buzz’! Tell everyone you know that the Great Guide for Liguria is going to be published soon.  How?

Firstly, use the IndieGoGo share tools, as that will tell them not only about the book, but also the project - maybe they would like to contribute.

Secondly, go to the Great Guide to Liguria page on Facebook, like it and share it with your friends and the public at large.  Then, if you want, go to the Reveal Italy page also: its full of interesting places in all of Italy. Tweet about it too.

Thirdly, go to the Great Guide to Liguria page on the No Trees Publishing website and like it. 

And finally, buy it when its published! (remember you still get the benefit of the Voucher). the best place to find all the links to the different formats available is on the No Trees Publishing website.

 

Thanks for your interest - see you soon in Liguria!

 Liguria and the Italian Riviera is the region of Italy that curves around from Tuscany and running into France. It has a spectacular coastline, with places like Portofino and the Cinque Terre famous the world over.
