story:
A big thank you to all our backers!!!

Four weeks ago the Happy Melly Express' crowdfunding campaign was simply a dream. An assumption that we wanted to verify: Can we publish a book by financing it with a crowdfunding campaign?

Today we know that this dream is shared by 45 people around the world! Thank you all for your support.

The book Lean Change Management by Jason Little will be launched by Happy Melly Express soon. But before the launch, the campaign lives on.

Watch the thank you video from Jason below and read the next steps in the update tab.

Thank you all!

The Happy Melly Express team.

Co-publishing ideas that make Melly happy!

As a creative worker, through our publishing projects, you will get inspiration and ideas so that you can improve your work and be happy.

As an author, we help you through the maze of self-publishing to create high quality content and grow your audience. So that your ideas have an impact!

As a creative worker you face problems at work that others have already solved. Happy Melly Express finds and publishes those solutions for you. So you can learn, get inspired, transform your work and be happy.

As an author you want to give your ideas to the world in a way that has impact - not just revenues. Happy Melly Express helps you create innovative, high-quality content that delivers your solutions in a format that has impact. So that your readers can improve their work and their lives. Just like you did.

Here's why you should support our project

Happy Melly Express is a different kind of publishing business. One that helps you, the author find and reach your audience faster than can be done through traditional publishing. Unlike self-publishing, Happy Melly Express is a publishing business that helps you deliver high quality content. We help you create books and multimedia content that is tailored for your audience. Content that educates and supports your audience with tutorials, interviews and additional material.

Happy Melly Express helps you, the reader, find high quality content that describes solutions to the problems you face at work. Not just books, but also multimedia content that helps you better explain these new ideas to your colleagues and bosses.

This campaign funds the first publishing project, which in turn will - when successful - fund future publishing projects. For every successful publishing project Happy Melly Express wants to fund two other publishing projects.

The first project helps you create the change you seek at work. Read on for more.

The First Project: Lean Change Management - A Feedback-Driven Approach to Change

Organizational changes are designed and planned with the best of intentions. Yet, according to various studies, these change initiatives fail 70% of the time. Often, planning isn't the problem. No matter how thorough you are, it is impossible to predict how the people affected by the change will ultimately react.

Lean Change Management is a book designed to help you understand how to approach and execute changes within your organization based on feedback-driven methods. It adapts to people's reactions to the changes, rather than trying to predict them all. Lean Change combines ideas from Lean Startup, neuroscience and the Agile and Lean worlds. It walks you through the process of defining, implementing and discovering the changes you need to help your organization.

Lean Change is the first book in the Happy Melly Express publishing project. When funded, it will include: the book, Video tutorials, additional templates, guides to walk you through your first Lean Change. If you select the Sponsor or Godfather backer level, you will also have the opportunity to participate in a Hangout with Jason Little the author of the book.

And there's more! If you back this campaign NOW (at Early Access-level or higher), you'll receive an early version of the book immediately!

Praise for Lean Change, first edition:

“I think this is a key contribution to the Lean/Agile/CM world - one that is perhaps long overdue.” - Jamie Longmuir, Agile Coach

"The model of feedback-driven change is very exciting to me.  I believe Lean Change can be applied to a broad range of change situations to produce system-owned results.  Jason proposes a broad range of system data to generate and evaluate small actions and measurable results, executed with a quick turn-around." - Barbara Heller, Organizational Effectiveness Consultant

Watch this intro video to learn more about Lean Change

Jason explains why he wrote Lean Change and why he chose Happy Melly

The Impact

We all have to work in order to make a living. The difference between happy and unhappy workers is the way we work. The way we interact with our colleagues, with our bosses or with our team. I dream of a world where you can reach out and grab smart methods to work happy. Discover ways of organizing your work so that you can create  a happy environment where you and your peers can do work you are proud of. I’ve seen a future where we can think, ‘today is a good day to work!’ A fantasy? I don’t think so.

By contributing to this campaign you are helping us to get the first projects published as well as setting us on a journey to find and publish more work that will make your life as a creative worker better.

We are starting with books (digital and print), as we believe that is still a very good way to get knowledge across. We will also be looking into other types of publishing projects such as: blogs, podcasts, video casts, webinars, etc.

If you have a great idea for a book, blog, podcast or other method for bringing great ideas to creative workers - get in touch! Maybe we can support you too!

What We Need & What You Get

Of course, we need money to get started. Our aim is to publish good ideas packed in good products (starting with books), so we need professionals for that. We calculated we need USD $11.000 and this is how we are going to use it:

  • Around $2500 USD for structural and copy editing the first projects
  • Around $800 USD for illustrations and website development
  • Around $2000 USD for book layout and cover design
  • Around $1000 USD for proofreading and finalizing the first projects
  • Around $1000 USD for work related to managing the project as well as starting a beta-readers campaign, so that we publish high-quality and community reviewed content.
  • Around $1100 USD to pay for, and ship the rewards that we are offering in this campaign
  • Around $1600 USD for fees and costs to set up this campaign (payment fees, design, writing, etc.)

If we surpass our funding goal, the rewards for contributors will be bigger. Stay tuned for details.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by purchasing some of the rewards above and by spreading the word about Happy Melly and HMExpress. Let your friends know about us and this campaign by posting on your favorite social network and emailing your friends.

The Team

Lisette Sutherland, Community Creator

Creating organizational change requires brave ideas. Happy Melly Express is a brilliant way to test, catalyze, and distribute those ideas to knowledge workers all over the world. We stand ready to publish the best knowledge and deliver it to your doorstep, wrapped with care, quality, and a healthy dose of fun.

Vasco Duarte, Story teller

After having worked to organize more than 5 conferences it became clear to me that we need a way to publish the great work that is being produced by the community of creative workers. Contributing to Happy Melly Express is my way to try and help those great ideas come out and help the community of creative workers that I belong to.

Erik Gille, Word wizard

There are many mind-blowing ideas out there. Ideas that have the potential to change the world, to make a difference. All those ideas deserve to be heard. To be told and to be read. We are fortunate to live in an age where you can tell everyone about your way to make life better. The hard part is putting these ideas to the paper (or screen). I can help you find a clear voice that helps to spread the word, not to cloud the meaning. Together we can make sure your message comes through!

Maarten Volders, Mad Scientist

Most models are wrong, some are useful. Sadly, most models will never reach you. Therefore those that do reach you often become the single solution. Taking you further from - instead of closer to - the truth. Happy Melly Express will provide you with options. More ideas and better insights, an endless source of inspiration. Today, tomorrow, and the next day, not just every 5 years. Content that is well-edited, beautifully illustrated, ready to rock your world.

Sergey Kotlov, Chief Geek

Being part of a translating team of a self-published book I realized how much effort was needed to publish an amazing book: proofreading, design, translating, marketing and so on. Creators need to waste their precious time on organizational stuff and it’s harder for them to concentrate on content. I see Happy Melly Express as a solution which helps authors create books their readers will love.

Jurgen Appelo, Chief Ecosystem Officer

Self-publishing is wonderful. Unfortunately, many self-published books severely lack in quality. Inexperienced authors have a tendency to skip on reviewing, editing, design, and proper marketing. The result is: books that could have been great, but aren't. With Happy Melly we aim to solve that problem. By providing services for authors, and asking readers to pay for quality, we make sure that self-published books look and feel like they are released by a quality publisher.

Johan Oskarsson, Chief Money Governor

We need more books, books from people who live in the trenches. It should not be that hard to get your ideas out, your lesson learned in a good books. I love books, and I want to read more from the real world. It is hard to write a book, and you need help to do it good. Happy Melly Express can help you make it less complicated.  


You are almost done! If you like what we are doing, support us by purchasing one of the unique rewards on the right.

 have been great, but aren't. With Happy Melly we aim to solve that 
problem. By providing services for authors, and asking readers to pay 
for quality, we make sure that self-published books look and feel like 
they are released by a quality publisher.
Johan Oskarsson, Chief Money Governor

We need more books, books from people who live in the trenches. It should not be that hard to get your ideas out, your lesson learned in a good books. I love books, and I want to read more from the real world. It is hard to write a book, and you need help to do it good. Happy Melly Express can help you make it less complicated.  

You are almost done! If you like what we are doing, support us by purchasing one of the unique rewards on the right.

story:
**7/19 Good News Alert**

One week in, already two-thirds there--thanks to everyone for the support!

The good folks at the Schusterman Philanthropic Network have agreed to provide dollar-to-dollar matching funds for up to $5,000 of select campaigns. I'm applying, of course, and will find out in late August if I'm selected. Stay tuned!

DITL Who? DITL What? 

Everyone has a story. 

You. Me. The guy standing behind you. (Made you look.)

Some stories (e.g., North West) are told more than others (e.g., the toll collector, the hospice nurse, the guy who manually writes the cue cards each week for Saturday Night Live).

That’s why I’m proposing to shadow people in the shadows. What’s it like to spend a day in the life (DITL) of another person?

Atticus Finch said, “You never really understand a person until you consider things from his [or her] point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it.”

So join me for a stroll. I’ve lived and worked in some of the richest and poorest parts of the country. I’m comfortable with all kinds of people and all types of places. And I’m curious. Real curious. Almost as curious as the guy standing behind you.

Give DITL Wings

DITL is an idea—profile the people in our midst—founded on a belief—everyone has a story worth telling. DITL is not (yet) a website, a content delivery system, or a brand with a logo. Your contribution will help me build out web infrastructure that will share the stories, photo essays, and videos. Once the distribution platform is up and running, and if funding allows, I will focus on expanding our story selection.

Especially when big news strikes, DITL should be there. With your support (and that of ride sharers and couch surfers), DITL will tell you the story of the Far Rockaway resident during Hurricane Sandy; of the upstate New York teacher who has worn the same outfit to work each day for two years in solidarity with a student who was bullied; of the Moore, Oklahoma mother in the days after the tornado struck; of the Somalian refugee making a life in Salt Lake City; of the stripper making doctor-money in North Dakota.

Who should we DITL? Contribute today and have a say in which people get profiled.

Because Strangers Are Not Strange

This type of content will provide a fresh take on a well-worn idea in American news and entertainment—reality TV. Americans watch an average of 34 hours of TV a week, or nearly five hours a day. Oftentimes, our TVs are tuned to reality TV shows—four of the top 10 shows in the 2012-13 season were of the genre.

DITL will similarly shine a light on everyday folks, both those you see (for example, the emergency room nurse) and those you don’t (for example, the people who fix the sewer system). The percentage of Americans who say that they trust others has fallen from more than half in the early 1960s to fewer than a third today. By providing a peek into the life of people previously regarded as strangers, DITL will help increase understanding and awareness—and we could use a little more of each.

What if these people had engaging content to read and look at, a short profile in words, photos, or video of an everyday American like them, an all-access pass into a day in the life?

Say, reality journalism.

You + Me = DITL

I’m a former teacher and college prep program director, still working in education. But I’ve turned my full-time gig part-time, and with my newfound time and long-held passion for writing and curiosity for people, I’m giving DITL a go.

If you're a fan, please take a minute to share this campaign: post it on Facebook, tweet it on Twitter, email it to your family and friends. The Schusterman Family Foundation is already supporting this campaign, and Indiegogo has been a big help, too.

And, lastly but most importantly, thank you for supporting my leap of faith. I deeply appreciate it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jenna Beaulieu and I am a writer living in northern Maine. I love the land I live in, however, one of the areas where I experience a sense of 'lack' is in the writing community.

I soak up conversations and interactions with writers whenever I chance upon them in the area. And I've done so since I was 13 years old!

At age 13, I met Wesley McNair, a poet who sold me my first signed poetry book (which I still own and cherish) and who is now serving a five-year term as Maine's Poet Laureate.

Ten years after meeting McNair for the first time, I attended another one of his readings and asked him to sign his book again. He seemed to be completely tickled by my continuous appreciation of his work.

Last year, I attended a third Wesley McNair event. After the reading, he and I had a conversation about how life is the subject of poetry and how my experiences in rural Maine, among my people, are an enhancement to my work.

He asked me to send him some poems. I drove home in a mixed state of pride and doubt - my car's tires must have traveled along the asphalt, but it sure didn't feel that way.

After reading my poems, McNair offered kind words and some compliments. It was a perfectly-timed indication that I should keep working and keep practicing.

He suggested that I attend a writer's retreat - that my work was at a level where others could offer constructive criticism. (I translated that as "you might actually understand other writers when they tell you how to improve something in your work").

I follow orders. When the Maine Poet Laureate advises me to attend a retreat, I'll do everything I can to heed that advice.

The Black Fly Writing Retreat in May 2013 offers workshops, readings, and a beautiful landscape in which to facilitate good old-fashioned work. 

At $550, it's an opportunity to rub elbows with other folks that can't quite get through a day without writing down words.

It's a manageable next step in my writing career - a step I anticipate at a level that rivals waiting for Christmas morning when I was a child.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I need $550 by March 29 to register for the retreat. That amount is the cost for registration, which covers lodging, food, and workshop costs. Additional funding is required to actually get me down to the retreat, but it's only a couple hundred miles away, and I'm going to pay for that leg of the journey myself (I can handle that financial investment without letting my oil tank drain dry or missing a car payment).

Any donations are appreciated and the perks I offer are related to my writing career - both where it's been and where it's going. From a signed original poem to acknowledgement as a Career Sponsor, each level of donation offers the donor a perk that acts like a ticket into my perspective of beauty, loss and lessons learned.

The Impact

Although I make my living by writing articles for a local newspaper and I also write for two blogs, poetry is my original form of expression.

Attending the Black Fly Writing Retreat is my way of continuing down this path. However, the great thing about improving writing skills is that they apply across the board.

Perhaps my attendance at the fiction workshop will increase the likelihood that I actually rewrite that novel I wrote a few years ago. Who knows! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, I understand. Winters are rough on the wallet.

If you'd like to contribute in another way, I encourage you to share the word about my campaign and let others know about this little dream.

Many thanks and take care!

story:
Short Summary

The Bethany School of Missions is a local enterprise that travels to Swaziland 4 times a year to help train a generation of local pastors and leaders for mission in that nation and abroad. The training is practical as well as dealing with the complexities of Scripture. The training is done as intensive modules with the teachers travelling to the students.     

What We Need & What You Get

We need around $600 for this trip and the modules we will be teaching. This includes:

  • Transport - both air and road
  • Fuel
  • Accomodation
  • Training materials
  • Food

The average cost per credit hour of training in the US is at least $300. For the equivelent of 2 US credit hours in fees for one student, we will be training more than 20 with 3x as many credit hours!!  

The Impact

There is currently no full time Theological Institute in Swaziland. This means that students who want to study for ministry either are 'self taught' or have to travel to South Africa to study which is often cost prohibitive. The Bethany school of missions and its leaders - Pst Jacob Moses, Pst Selvan Govender and others - are standing in the gap and providing this training in a low cost manner without compromising on the standard of education. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you are unable to help finicailly at this time, but here are some other ways to help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • share this project on Facebook, Twitter, Google + or any other social networks you are engaged with!
  • Pray like crazy for us on the week of the 5-9th August

story:
What Is This About

Hi! I'm Lena, a Holistic Therapist who specialises in using Emotional Freedom Techniques (EFT) to help others to clear their energetic blockages that prevent them from being more happy, successful and abundant.

It is my mission to empower others to heal themselves, and this book is part of that mission. This book contains 18 EFT processes dealing with different kinds of issues, and they are specially designed based on my 6 years of training in many different therapeutic modalities as well as counselling experience. This book is my way of making sure that people who have no therapeutic background are equipped to heal their physical and emotional issues all by themselves, without having to rely on anyone else (unless they choose to).

If you make a donation, you will be contributing to the printing of 100 books, which means that because of you, at least 100 people will be able to heal themselves with the support of this book. If you believe, as I do, that world peace begins with inner peace, then it's fair to say that you are indeed contributing to world peace through this project.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $500 to print 100 copies of this book - $250 goes towards actual printing, $180 goes towards designing of the book cover, and the rest is for miscellaneous costs such as shipping costs for those of you whose donations means I will be mailing the book to you.

These are the perks I will be offering.

  • Subscription to my weekly newsletters where you will receive valuable insights and my sharings on the healing journey
  • Digital versions and/or hard copies of my first book "Emotional Freedom at your Fingertips: Getting from pissed to peace with Emotional Freedom Techniques" - a book filled with inspiring anecdotes about my journey with using EFT on myself and with my clients, as well as tips on making basic EFT more effective for you. This is the perfect EFT book for newbies to EFT.
  • Digital versions and/or hard copies of my upcoming second book "Becoming Your Own Therapist with Emotional Freedom Techniques" - a book filled with detailed processes for different issues that will guide you to do healing for yourself. This would be very useful for those of you who know EFT but have trouble using it for your own issues.
  • A 45-minute personal EFT session with me via face-to-face or Skype. You may read about other people's experiences with their EFT sessions with me here: http://www.lenashealinghaven.com/testimonials.htm#testimonials
  • A place for my highly powerful and intensive EFT Abundance Program, which consists of 10-hour sessions held in a group setting, and aims to help all participants to clear their energetic blocks to abundance, be it in the areas of finances, health, relationships, professional success, etc. The next round will be in November and I am only accepting 14 pax in total. This is only for those living in Singapore. More details about the EFT Abundance Program can be found here: http://archive.aweber.com/lenashealinghvn/FZNMo

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can tell other people about this project and/or give them the link to this page and ask them to take a look. I also need about 5 people to review my book for me, so if you know EFT and are interested in doing self-healing and you would like to try out the processes in my book, please email me at lena@lenashealinghaven.com for a free digital copy.

 

Thank you for your generous support!

story:
Let's keep this simple~! 
For $10(+shipping if you need it) you get a copy of my book and for $20(+shipping) you get a personalized message in the front of it, personalized doesn't mean nice or long or short, it just means I will personally put something catered for you in the book.  For some of you I could write a poem, for others I could just add whatever I want!

I haven't published a book of poetry in about 6 years and I figured now was a good time to do it. If you enjoy poetry, or if you wanna just help me make a dream come true, please support my campaign.  Once I have all the donations in I'll get the books published and start getting them shipped out to people right away. If you wait till after the campaign then the book will be $15(+shipping), so act now for the best price! Once I get $1000 I can publish the books at a high enough volume to get a good rate and have some extras left over to sell for later and of course for posterity sake.

Even if you can't donate anything today I would really appreciate if you helped spread the word! Thank you guys so much for helping me make my dream a reality!

Here is a link to the whole pdf of the book so you know exactly what you're getting outside of cover art and personalization. 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bEUY5O-cB2NKq6wrvxRUAtIWpw0xn-Er7ytXr5jgl3E/edit?usp=docslist_api

Now for some samples of my poetry to help you get a taste for things if you don't wanna get into the book itself.

(1092.) Warmth Here
=---------------------------------------------------=
warmth here

infinite

and indiscriminate warmth for free

get it while it’s hot

get it while it’s available

abuse it

and move on

But know,

warmth here

for free.

may I have this dance?

(1192.) Time Weathered 2/3/12
=---------------------------------------------------=
my love for you is not a beautiful gem

it is not a glorious stone forged by chance

and pressure

my love for you is not a star dying

it is not a burst of light

and energy

my love for you is like sand

simple

innumerable

and time weathered



(1209.) Recursive Snake 9/19/12
=---------------------------------------------------=
i am just the continuing flow of some river


that bled from some ocean


my existence is to facilitate the existence

of another better

half-me

the journey along the way

merely builds character

from which experience may be garnered

so that my offspring have

a stronger foundation

to grow from

a cycle

that trickles forward

a stream lost in a larger

current

time unfolds itself in all directions

but time is nothing

change is all that is

repetition

repetition

till deviation

repetition

i being the culmination 

of countless life

am but a gate

from which more

will flow

i

and

you

and

all

are the universe

experiencing

itself

story:
Marvin Dozier is an amazing man. We are not just saying that because he's our father...

He's turning 70 years old, August 27th and he just recently wrote his first novel "Lovers and Other Strangers," A Poetic View of the Male/Female Relationship. For his birthday (as a surprise,) it would be amazing if we could help him jump-start his Self-Publishing company by raising the seed money he needs and money for a new laptop (since his has been breaking down for months.)

What We Need & What You Get

Together, in combiniation with the money he has raised (around $2,200 (from book sales and savings;) we need about $900 - $1,200 more. 

This money will go to:

  • A New Tablet Computer ($900) 
  • Ad Space ($1,100) required to confirm his LLC
  • Printing for Flyers and Promotional Materials for the first 3 months ($600)
  • First 6 months of his Website Domain (sparklinggempublish.com) ($100)
  • Reprinting for Promotional Use and Distribution of His First Book ($300)
  • Printing for His Second Book ($400) -- *because he plans to print more copies!*
 
 

The Impact

Our father sold over 100 copies of his book within the first week and a half. He did grassroots campaigning, called on old friends, and just genuinely met some really amazing people! Self published, and driven he has always had the ability to connect with others and I'm asking that you connect with his vision.

For writers, it is so difficult and brave to put your soul on paper. Putting your faith in him and helping him start a Self Publishing comapny for other couragous souls will allow other writers to not feel so alone in the written world.

It can be hard out there, trying to publish, and sell your work. Sparkling Gem, his dream publishing company, will have the same tender, funny, sweet and guiding hand that he has, to help new authors get out there sooner and easier then he did. 

Our dad just honestly wants everyone to live their dream. Help us make sure he gets a chance to live his. He turns 70 in August, let's make sure that this is the year he has always been waiting for.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the share tools to promote and help my dad.
  • Let me know of any resources that you may have so that we can pass it along to him.

Thank You!

-Sade, Tracee and Terrance Dozier

Marvin Dozier is an amazing man. We are not just saying that because he's our father...
He's turning 70 years old, August 27th and he just recently wrote his first novel "Lovers and Other Strangers," A Poetic View of the Male/Female Relationship. For his birthday (as a surprise,) it would be amazing if we could help him jump-start his Self-Publishing company by raising the seed money he needs and money for a new laptop (since his has been breaking down for months.)


What We Need & What You Get
Together, in combiniation with the money he has raised (around $2,200 (from book sales and savings;) we need about $900 - $1,200 more. 
This money will go to:

A New Tablet Computer ($900) 
Ad Space ($1,100) required to confirm his LLC
Printing for Flyers and Promotional Materials for the first 3 months ($600)
First 6 months of his Website Domain (sparklinggempublish.com) ($100)
Reprinting for Promotional Use and Distribution of His First Book ($300)
Printing for His Second Book ($400) -- *because he plans to print more copies!*

 
 


The Impact
Our father sold over 100 copies of his book within the first week and a half. He did grassroots campaigning, called on old friends, and just genuinely met some really amazing people! story:
¿Qué?

Historias con alma es para los amantes de los pequeños placeres, en este caso, presentados como un exquisito conjunto de relatos llenos de sentimiento.

Estáis ante un paseo por cada uno de esos sentimientos que nos remueven y nos hacen sentir vivos. Un conjunto de situaciones de a pie que en ocasiones se nos presentan descabelladas, de relatos que nacieron en la soledad y de fragmentos de sutileza que a veces dejamos pasar.

Es una obra que nació para que la leyesen y ahora ve la luz para que la sientan. Es una recopilación de palabras pequeñas que, encabezadas por grandes citas, se regalan al lector con la única intención de hacerse un hueco en su corazón.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta María Beltrán.

Nací el 19 de Febrero de 1999 en Málaga. Vine al mundo rodeada de mar y letras. Desde pequeña las palabras formaron parte de mi vida a través de la poesía y los cuentos que me contaban mis padres antes de irme a dormir. Empecé a escribir a los ocho años, cuando mis profesores me enseñaron a crear y decidí que nunca me quedaría sola. Desde entonces he navegado por toda clase de poemas, relatos y obras teatrales que me han hecho sentir viva, he crecido entre libros gracias a mi abuelo y siempre he tenido una historia en la punta de los dedos dispuesta a salir. Con trece años recibí mi primer premio de poesía en el concurso Monseñor Francisco Parrilla de la Fundación Diocesana de Enseñanza.

En el 2016 recibí clases de escritura en el Taller Paréntesis y presenté algunas de mis creaciones a numerosos concursos literarios recibiendo premios en las diferentes modalidades literarias, primero en mi país y más tarde más allá del mar.

A día de hoy estudio Literaturas Comparadas en la Universidad de Granada y continúo escribiendo para prestar mi voz al mundo

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Historias con alma que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y María Beltrán vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
* INTERNATIONAL CONTRIBUTORS * - Shipping options are not available for international orders. Contact me through Indiegogo to work something out.

SUMMARY

When it comes to entertainment -- books, movies, television, plays, and even video games -- ordinary people plunging into extraordinary circumstances is not a new concept.

It is commonly said that everything has already been done in the world of storytelling, whether you're an author, a screenwriter, or a playwright. There is nothing new to be found.

I wholeheartedly disagree! There is an abundance of unique and wonderful tales out there just waiting to be told... and I believe my own to be one of them!

I want to tell the story that I wish someone would tell to me.  It was this thought nearly four years ago that first set fire to my imagination.

An Eislian's Tale: Penny the Brave was born!

PLOT

Penny the Brave is the first novel of the An Eislian's Tale series, kicking off the journey of an ordinary man who knows nothing about adventure.

Penny Daulton is the sword-fearing bookkeeper for the Windfarer's Inn of Northroe. Spilling ale at the tavern with his lifelong friends, Royce and Alomar, is the most excitement the man sees in his mundane life.

One fateful night, disastrous coincidence gets the trio of friends indirectly responsible for arson and murder, forcing them to flee Northroe and leave their lives behind.

Penny, Royce and Alomar aren't on the run for but a few hours when they get themselves accidentally inducted into a bandit clan deep in the Kovald Forest.

Reluctantly playing the parts of renegades, Penny and his friends try to earn their place in the band of outlaws while keeping their heads attached to their bodies. But, in the company of such men (and one woman), Penny can't avoid the harsh realities of a brigand's life forever.

Death is serious business, after all.

These are but the first steps of an epic saga plunging ordinary men and women into extraordinary circumstances. They don't know it yet, but their actions will have a ripple effect across the nation of Eisley, to be felt by all for decades to come!

This is a story of friendship, elusive love, fear, courage, peril... and how perhaps we are all stronger than we give ourselves credit for.

PREVIEW

Click here for a sneak peek at the first pages of the book!

WHY AM I HERE?

The book is complete! Miguelicuddy, the talented editor, is nearly done with the manuscript. I've partnered with the folks at A Book's Mind, a fantastic self-publishing company I wholeheartedly trust, and things are moving forward!

Self-publishing costs authors money, and I'm no exception. I'm humbly asking for help in fulfilling the cost of the publishing process, printing paperback copies of the book, and other reasons/resources (all described below): $2,000.

All contributors will receive rewards for their generosity!

All contributions are for:

  1. The publishing, printing and binding process
  2. Securing copyrights & an official ISBN # for the book
  3. E-Book & In-Print formatting & preparation
  4. Interior & Exterior design
  5. Helping to pay the 4 talented artists who have generously partnered with me to make this book something special: Josh Brizuela, Arie Mulich, Eljay Peña and Denny Schneidemesser (info on them below!)
  6. Shipping & distribution costs (included in each tier's $ amount)
  7. Printing 2 different posters (matte poster & mounted canvas prints)
  8. Paying for production of the limited handcrafted wooden ale mugs/steins
  9. Printing extra paperback copies for the Book Launch Event here in Phoenix, AZ, in March!
  10. Large banners and extra merchandise (posters, etc) for the book launch in March
  11. Business cards that I wish I had on me in the past while talking about my book to passing strangers
  12. Penny the Brave-themed bookmarks (for book festivals & handouts)
  13. Covering costs of printing for future orders

Be sure to check out the rewards below for contributors! Pre-order the book and be rewarded for doing so (or contribute more if you'd like!), and the money will go towards putting Penny the Brave on the map in March!

OTHER ARTISTS

I am thrilled to announce that four other artists have graced the novel with their talent!

Josh Brizuela is the talented founder of bask.space. He illustrated the book cover and the amazing "One Life to Live" poster! See more of his work on Facebook & Instagram!

Arie Mulich illustrated the wonderful Map of Eisley, the nation in which the story is set. The land will finally be seen by eyes other than my own, thanks to him! Find more of his work on Instagram!

Denny Schneidemesser is a cinematic composer for both films and games. He is writing a piece inspired by the book, which will be available as a download for contributors! Find his spectacular work at his web site, Facebook, or Youtube channel!

Eljay Peña is the former Marketing & Art Director at Valken Sports, who did font detailing on the book cover. Check out his work on Instagram!

Check out a demo reel of Denny Schneidemesser's music! He is writing an original piece based on the book, which will be rewarded to every contributor!


CONTRIBUTOR PERKS

Never would I let you walk away empty-handed! All contributors will be recognized publicly on my official web site, listed alphabetically (unless they decline acknowledgment)!

--------------------------------

* FREE SHIPPING to the 48 continental states of the U.S.!

* ALASKA & HAWAII CONTRIBUTORS * - Please inquire about extra shipping costs.

* INTERNATIONAL SHIPMENTS * - If you live outside the U.S., you can pick up the $10 Digital Bundle (thank you!) since there are no physical items in this tier. If interested in higher tiers, I would humbly ask you to pay the shipping cost, since international shipping is too expensive for me to cover. Please inquire about the extra shipping costs to your location, and we'll see what we can work out.

--------------------------------

NOTE: For additional campaign FAQ, click here.

$10 - DIGITAL BUNDLE - Receive a digital copy (E-Book) of Penny the Brave + Digital Art Pack (Map of Eisley + "One Life to Live" Wallpapers for desktops/mobile devices) + a download of a currently untitled original composition by Denny Schneidemesser, inspired by the book!

$28 - STORYTELLER - All above rewards + Receive a signed paperback copy of Penny the Brave!

$50 - CARTOGRAPHER - All above rewards + a (physical) poster of the Map of Eisley (18" x 24"), illustrated by Arie Mulich!

$80 - ADVENTURER- All above rewards + a (physical) full color "One Life to Live" poster (18" x 24"), illustrated by Josh Brizuela (font detailing by Eljay Pena)!

$125 - THE WAYFARER - All above rewards - the Map of Eisley & "One Life to Live" poster you receive will be numbered limited editions, signed by the illustrators and the author!

$200 - MASTER BARD - All above rewards (including limited edition map & poster) + collaborate with me directly on a short story featuring you as the main character (or a character named by you), to be released online to the public! See bottom of this page for details.

$300 - THE RENEGADE (only 5 available!) - All above rewards (including limited edition map & poster) + an authentic medieval-style ale mug/stein, handcrafted with real wood, featuring the Quill, Axe & Sword emblem engraved on the bottom (fully functional and safe for hot or cold liquids)! Credited in the Acknowledgments (back of the book - both digital & paperback formats)! 

$500 - KING'S ELITE (only 3 available!) - All above rewards (including limited edition map & poster) + Lifetime Super-Fan Bundle! Featured in Special Thanks at front of book (both digital & paperback formats). Both posters (Map of Eisley & "One Life to Live") will be 18" x 24" Mounted Canvas prints! Receive one signed copy of every book I ever publish in this life, mailed to you. Receive 5 pages of the original rough draft (not photocopies - the original pages), complete with notes and suggestions by the editor!


THE IMPACT

The book is finished. An Eislian's Tale: Penny the Brave promises to be a memorable and adventurous kickoff to an action adventure saga not like any other!

I have carried around many tales in my heart and mind since 2007, all taking place in the land of Eisley. With your help, the first installment of Penny's epic can finally be put into print for the world to see!

It tends to be an uphill battle for artists of all walks of life, and writers are no exception. Penny the Brave has the potential to make a big splash in an incredibly crowded sea, and would signify a great victory for aspiring authors everywhere.

After all, who doesn't like a good story?

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Can't spare any of your hard-earned money, but still want to help?

Spread the word any way you can! Tweet about it. Post a link to this page on Facebook. Post about the book online. Link my web site to friends of yours who enjoy reading. Tell someone in person. I can't fully express how grateful I will be to you!

Your help in spreading the word about this book and campaign will make a far bigger splash than I ever could on my own!

A writer is nobody without people to read his/her work, and with your help, Penny the Brave can be a solid addition to the adventure genre for readers everywhere!

RISKS & CHALLENGES

The book is finished. The editor's work is nearly complete on it, and soon it will be ready to publish! Matter of fact, I'm 80% done with writing book two of the series... but that's another story. Literally.

I'm not asking for funding to take time off of my full time job to complete the story.

I'm asking for help in covering the publishing & resources costs, and in paying the fantastic artists who are pooling their talents into this book for avid readers everywhere!

I'm humbly asking for your support in funding a finished product... not one in progress!

In the event that this project is somehow not fully funded, I still promise everyone truly interested in reading this book that it will be published in March 2016... one way or another!

Thank you so much for taking your time to stop by. I wish you the best, wherever you are.


SHORT STORY COLLAB ($200 - "Master Bard" Perk and Above) - RULES

Please note the following.
  1. All ideas/concepts (titles, names, stories/content, settings, etc) are subject to approval. I will not write content featuring excessively vulgar or offensive themes, since stories will be released online to the public.
  2. Only works of fiction will be written. Feel free to request something directed toward specific age groups (children, teens, adults, etc).
  3. You will communicate directly with me (not a representative) via email. You can be as specific or vague as you'd like, about any or all elements of the story.
  4. You may select the character name, a genre, setting or theme, and more.
  5. You may feature yourself as the main character.
  6. Stories will be published online on my web site, http://www.paulhollandauthor.com. You may choose to remain anonymous  to the public.
  7. You will be credited as the co-author of the story, unless you decide to remain anonymous.
  8. If I have already begun writing the story, I will only consider minor changes if requested.
  9. I cannot guarantee a date of completion. Please allow sufficient time for me to write the story.
  10. I will write the stories in the order that contributions are made (first-come, first-serve!) to be as fair as possible to contributors.
  11. I'm sure you'll be happy with the finished story! If for some reason you are not satisfied with the story after completion, I will gladly refund you $100 (you will still receive the $100 - "THE WAYFARER" Perk).

Spread the word any way you can! Tweet about it. Post a link to this page on Facebook. Post about the book online. Link my web site to friends of yours who enjoy reading. Tell someone in person. I can't fully express how grateful I will be to you!
Your help in spreading the word about this book and campaign will make a far bigger splash than I ever could on my own!
A writer is nobody without people to read his/her work, and with your help, Penny the Brave can be a solid addition to the adventure genre for readers everywhere!

RISKS & CHALLENGESThe book is finished. The editor's work is nearly complete on it, and soon it will be ready to publish! Matter of fact, I'm 80% done with writing book two of the series... but that's another story. Literally.
I'm not asking for funding to take time off of my full time job to complete the story.
I'm asking for help in covering the publishing & resources costs, and in paying the fantastic artists who are pooling their talents into this book for avid readers everywhere!
I'm humbly asking for your support in funding a finished product... not one in progress!
In the event that this project is somehow not fully funded, I still promise everyone truly interested in reading this book that it will be published in March 2016... one way or another!
Thank you so much for taking your time to stop by. I wish you the best, wherever you are.




SHORT STORY COLLAB ($200 - "Master Bard" Perk and Above) - RULESPlease note the following.
All ideas/concepts (titles, names, stories/content, settings, etc) are subject to approval. I will not write content featuring excessively vulgar or offensive themes, since stories will be released online to the public.
Only works of fiction will be written. Feel free to request something directed toward specific age groups (children, teens, adults, etc).
You will communicate directly with me (not a representative) via email. You can be as specific or vague as you'd like, about any or all elements of the story.
You may select the character name, a genre, setting or theme, and more.
You may feature yourself as the main character.
Stories will be published online on my web site, http://www.paulhollandauthor.com. You may choose to remain anonymous  to the public.
You will be credited as the co-author of the story, unless you decide to remain anonymous.
If I have already begun writing the story, I will only consider minor changes if requested.
I cannot guarantee a date of completion. Please allow sufficient time for me to write the story.
I will write the stories in the order that contributions are made (first-come, first-serve!) to be as fair as possible to contributors.
I'm sure you'll be happy with the finished story! If for some reason you are not satisfied with the story after completion, I will gladly refund you $100 (you will still receive the $100 - "THE WAYFARER" Perk).

GIVE FEMINISM:
A GIFT FOR EVERLASTING PEACE

                            

     Albeit across the globe women carry out the most caring, essential, planetary work, such as organic farming, domestic chores, child development, elderly home care, cultural and community education, a new study from the McKinsey group reports this work is still 75% of unpaid labor, hence the world over women continue to make up 70% of our population working to overcome poverty. From Isis to the Coal Industry every draconian force seems to agree woman’s lives can be sacrificed to the toxicity of systemic universal warfare and its interpersonal reflection, hetero-normative patriarchal oppression. As survivors of the limited life opportunities of heteropatriarchal violence woman’s experiences all too often are ostensibly repressed through intimidation, becoming inconvenient for mass popular outrage and consequently for proper investigative and critical feminist governmental policy evolution. However, as we are nature defending herself, it is not coincidental then that globally, women, gender non-conforming peoples, in harmony with men who love justice are on every front line of the sacrifice zones due to heteronormative climate apartheid, determined now, more than ever, to existentially turn the world right side up.
   
      Imagine today what our world will be like when our feminist dream, the vision of united transnational feminist labor as composed by Dr bell hooks in our movement classic ,“Feminism is for Everybody”, of “replacing the culture of domination with a world of participatory economics grounded in communalism and social democracy, a world without discrimination based on race or gender, a world where recognition of mutuality and interdependency can be the dominant ethos, a global ecological vision of how the planet can survive and how everyone on it can have access to peace and well-being" holistically culminates into sheer realization.
 
     'Tis the season for this giving, make a visionary feminist donation to the Transnational Feminist Union and give from the heart a gift whose cross-pollinating impacts will live on for all generations, a gift for everlasting peace..

                   

Tlazocamatli, Love, Solidarity and Joyful Returns To All!..

story:
Hobart Festival of Women Writers 2017 needs your help.

 We have had grassroots support since the first Festival of Women Writers in September 2013. Women and men from upstate, downstate and around the country have contributed to our fundraising campaign, showing their support of programming and platforming diverse creative literary voices. With your support, we've been able to produce an exciting three-day Festival celebration of the published work of women writers. We apply all of the money raised through crowdfunding to support the honoraria and transportation costs for our Participating Writers. We welcome all contributions, modest ones, and large ones. We welcome all lovers of language to show their commitment to strengthening and maintaining the literary arts in New York State. Please visit The Hobart Festival of Women Writers 2017 on the weekend of September 8, 9&10th nestled in the western Catskills town of Hobart, home of six independent book stores. Please support our Indiegogo Fundraising Campaign. All contributions are greatly appreciated.

story:
The Story of Sobrante Park is the Story of the Death of Oakland

In 1946, developers built Oakland's first "planned community." It may have been America's first planned community as well. 

It was a "whites only" development for soldiers returning home from the Second World War. By the 1980's, Sobrante Park had become synonymous with drug dealing, shootings, urban decay, and ultimately, death.

Now there is another war. And it is happening right here where we live. This is our story.

What had originally been orchards and farms, then a housing development, then a literal war zone, has come to represent the death of the American Dream. We are are still considered the most notorious neighborhood in Oakland. And for good reason.

Due to our design, there is "only one way in and one way out." In the past, far too many people have left the neighborhood feet first, in a body bag. Some still do. I knew some of them. 

Yet we are real people here. Along with my neighbors, I want to tell our stories. 

You will learn about the man who has an entire body of scars, from AK47 fire. You will learn about how people used to hunt squirrels in the creek that runs along the back of the neighborhood. You will learn about the first shootout that the Panthers had with OPD, and which has never before been mentioned in media. You will learn about a former street criminal, who now runs one of the largest churches in California, and who literally has saved thousands of lives. One of them mine, by the way.

The good, the bad, and the ugly. Please help us all tell these life-changing stories. 

What We Need

Books do not just write themselves. We will need to interview dozens of people, some of whom really do not like to talk about things. Some of whom are in prison. And some of whom are just kind of laying low for a bit. 

This will require much time and effort. This will also require much diplomacy and sensitivity. It may require some travel. It may require some donations to certain individuals or groups. It will definitely require a copy editor. I grew up in a trailer park, and I make mistakes in grammar. 

The money that you donate to this book will thus help me pay for living and other expenses while I continue to research and write our true history. I already know some things, but I need to learn a lot more. This means seeking out the old timers, and interviewing them. Then writing down what they tell me. I am not working right now, and this money will help me pay for food, power, internet, and basic living expenses. 

$12,000 won't pay for a year of living expenses. But it's a start. We all have to start somewhere. I will also be praying for a financial blessing from my church, and from some community organizations that I do volunteer work for. Many people have an interest in helping us tell our true, unvarnished story. 

For your money, you will fund a book that may change some dialog. If nothing else, there will be no other book like it. The stories here are like things you might see in a movie, except every word is true. I know this because I have been part of some of those stories. 

And I lived.

Others did not, and this will be their story too. They deserve that, at least. 

    What Will Change

    The story of Sobrante Park is literally the story of America. Policymakers have used Sobrante Park as a "political football" for over one-half century now. We want to change that. 

    We want some truth now.

    Oakland Mayoral candidates love to use Sobrante as a "photo opportunity," then we never see them again. City and County agencies write endless "reports" about Sobrante, and hold hundreds of "community meetings," and run literally dozens of "social programs" here.

    It is all "Kabuki Theater." It is sound and fury, signifying nothing.

    The cold hard reality is that nothing changes. It is getting worse here. We see it with our own eyes. While politicians get rich, we continue to suffer. 
    People still die here. Three in the last few months. The death marches on.

    Pop, pop. Then a human life ends. . . Someone with a mother, and a father, ends up as a pile of warm meat, bleeding out in the street. People use garden hoses to wash up the blood. If that sounds extreme, well - it's also true.

    Those who do not die often end up living lives of daily, recurring, hell. 

    I knew some of them. I was 100 feet away when the last person was shot, and I know nothing more than what is already in media. We don't generally talk to media. Or to the police. There are reasons.

    But we might talk to me. 

    It is our hope that by telling our true story of our past, and how we got to our present, then perhaps those people who make policies will realize that our lives here absolutely matter, and that our collective voices matter. We may be able to collectively achieve a better future for our children and families here.

    We pray for this. We really do. Our lives literally depend on it.

    So much of what people think they know about Sobrante is from nothing more than law enforcement press releases, political campaign videos, and fluffy missives from local non-profits who do little more than endlessly "churn" the issues for "fun and profit." Others mean well, but really have no idea what they are doing. They strut around talking about saving us here. They only save themselves. 

    We have a saying here, and it is called "keeping it real." 

    We will keep it real. 

    Our lives and future depend on it.

    You will learn things that only people who live here know. You will learn oral traditions that date back to the early 1950's, for example. Stories of death. Stories of pain. But also stories of hope, and stories of redemption. 

    True miracles.

    One of them mine, by the way. . . 

    And perhaps after learning these things, your mind might change just a tiny bit.

    That is our prayer at least. And all we can do right now is pray. 

      The Risks
      Sobrante Park is not a joke. 

      Too $hort, who actually knows people I know, put it best:

      "But I'm crazy you don't wanna be like me
      I come from East Oakland where the yougstas get Hyphy"

      https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CBJtzEKetBM

      And I have lived here long enough such that people respect me for my local community and church work. People trust me because I do not gossip, and I keep out of folks' business.

      People generally know who I am, even if just by sight. Only someone who lives here can even write about Sobrante. It's called "representing." People who are not from here simply can't represent us.

      How can they? What would they know? Who would talk to them?

      I would not!

      To claim to know something you do not know, is lying. And to claim to be from somewhere you are not from, is also lying. I have lived in Deep East for more than a decade, and I have lived in Sobrante for over five years.

      By choice. 

      The "outsiders" generally know nothing except rumors and lies. From our own lives, we will tell you truth. You may not like it, but it is what it is. It is truth you can touch. Our prayer is that it is truth that will touch you.

      Truth matters. Lives depend on truth here. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you do not have money to help on this project, please pray for us. 

        If you go to church, put another dollar in the collection plate in memory of those who have died here. Their lives matter. And pray for those who are still alive.

        All our lives matter. The death, must end. The pain, must end.

        That is why we are writing this book. Please help us.

        Disclaimers

        I live here, and I will continue to live here. 

        Because I have been engaged on civil rights issues for a bit, I am kind of "known" to our City Hall and local government. I do not want this book to be about me. I also am not writing an "expose" or a "kiss-and-tell." I am writing stories that people here will tell me for inclusion in the book. I am writing our history that WE have wanted to have written for a long time.

        I am the messenger. I am not the message. 

        I am therefore writing this book under a pen name. If you want to know who I am, shoot me a message, we can talk on phone, and I will send you some links. I live right here, and I am writing this book, along with the community, because I want "right here" to get better. 

        The payee on money you donate to me, is "OCRA" for your records. Media inquiries should be directed to TNT@oaklander.org, you may also text me at (504) 475-4552 to set up a phone call. 

        Much respect to all,

        Thomas NewTon (TNT)

story:
Greetings and welcome to Dragon Bait Miniatures second Indiegogo campaign. This campaign expands  upon the success of my first Indiegogo project  and adds a further sixteen exciting new sculpts to my range of 28mm Fantasy Adventurers!  

The goal of Dragon Bait has not changed, which is to bring well designed, high quality character and non player characters to the table top. To help me in this quest I have had the good fortune to work with some incredible talent such as Dr Mike Burns, a good friend and concept artist who's imagination helps breath life into any miniature. I also have three top notch sculptors, Dave Soderquist, Tim Prow and the Goblin Master himself Kev Adams. Instead of blabbing on about these guys let me just show you the incredible work they're bringing to the project.  


       Dave is a master of the 28mm female form. His attention to detail combined with such delicate facial expressions makes him one the the première sculpting talents this side of the Atlantic. 


 Models by Dave Soderquist 

 

     

 Tim Prow is a gifted sculptor and he has the ability to bring an old Citadel feel to what ever he touches. His incredible work for Reaper and other big companies just speak for itself. Tims ability to translate pure crazy to greens makes him invaluable to Dragon Bait miniaturs. 

Models by Tim Prow

 

As a returning customer to Dragon Bait you are entitled to a free miniature in the form of this great Halfling Scout by Tim Prow.  I love this mini and for free I am sure you will love it more. He is still available to new customers for $6 as an add on.

                     


     

      Kev Adams worked extensively on Dragon Baits first campaign and made sure he left us with a bang. The two headed hell hound is just brilliant and a must for any Kev Adams fan. 

Stretch Goals by Kev Adams (mostly):


Stretch Goal Notes:

$2000 Stretch Goal: A pair of Hell Hounds by Kev Adams is available as an add on for 10$ a pair.

 $3000 Stretch Goal: Gnome Chevalier by Kev Adams is available for 10$ if the goals are met.

 $4000 Stretch Goal: Two Headed Hell Hound by Kev Adams is available if goals are met for 10$.

$ 5000 Stretch Goal: Succubus Hell Hound Handler by Dave Soderquist is available if goals are met for 10$

                                                              *********

Flexibility is a goal I hoped to improve on this second campaign, both with the miniature and ways to support it. Most miniatures now has a separate base to make it quick and easy to match a mini to an existing collection. All of Kev Adams minis do NOT have a separate base.  

 You may order miniatures individually with a minimum quantity of three. The price of these miniatures will be seven dollars each. Simply state the codes when you make the order.

If you purchase eight or more miniatures the price of each drops to six dollars.  This is a twenty five percent discount over the price of the average miniature before it hits retail.

You may purchase the entire collection. The cost of each miniature will be five dollars.

 Perks will represent all these options to include postage and there are four stretch goals which are priced separately if achieved. 

Thank you again for taking the time to read about my small campaign.  I am using Indiegogo to defray the cost of the sculpting and molding and support my next up coming Indiegogo venture. 

  

You get some incredible miniatures at a great price before they hit retail. These miniatures are all sculpted and in the process of being molded, and I hope to ship them within one month after the campaigns end. I have already run one successful Indiegogo campaign where everyone received their miniatures as expected.

SPREAD THE WORD!

The only thing left is to spread a few tavern rumors and I would certainly appreciate the help. Please pass on word of this campaign to friends and family, forums and blogs, or perhaps even the odd podcast. Thanks again for your time and helping me bring more quality , 28mm fantasy miniatures to the table top.

Joe Corsaro

Chief Cage Cleaner

Dragon Bait Minis

$ 5000 Stretch Goal: Succubus Hell Hound Handler by Dave Soderquist is available if goals are met for 10$                                                              *********

Flexibility is a goal I hoped to improve on this second
campaign, both with the miniature and ways to support it. Most miniatures now
has a separate base to make it quick and easy to match a mini to an existing
collection. All of Kev Adams minis do NOT have a separate base.  
 You
may order miniatures individually with a minimum quantity of three. The price
of these miniatures will be seven dollars each. Simply state the codes when you
make the order.
If
you purchase eight or more miniatures the price of each drops to six dollars.
 This is a twenty five percent discount over the price of the average
miniature before it hits retail.
You
may purchase the entire collection. The cost of each miniature will be five dollars.
 Perks will represent all these
options to include postage and there are four stretch goals which are priced separately
if achieved. 
Thank
you again for taking the time to read about my small campaign.  I am using
Indiegogo to defray the cost of the sculpting and molding and support my next
up coming Indiegogo venture. 
  
You get some incredible miniatures at a great
price before they hit retail. These miniatures are all sculpted and in the
process of being molded, and I hope to ship them within one month after the
campaigns end. I have already run one successful Indiegogo campaign where
everyone received their miniatures as expected.
SPREAD
THE WORD!
The only thing left is to spread a
few tavern rumors and I would certainly appreciate the help. Please pass
on word of this campaign to friends and family, forums and blogs, or
perhaps even the odd podcast. Thanks again for your time and helping me bring
more quality , 28mm fantasy miniatures to the table top.
Joe Corsaro
Chief Cage Cleaner
Dragon Bait Minis

story:
Queridos socios y amigos del CD Arquitectura,

La pasada temporada y como consecuencia de una espontánea y multitudinaria tangana en el partido contra el CDU Granada, nuestro jugador Ricardo Rodríguez del Hierro ‘Richi’, fue denunciado por un jugador del club rival y actualmente afronta un juicio por agresión que, caso de perderse, conllevaría graves consecuencias para él.

La violencia en el campo hay que evitarla siempre, pero no creemos que Richi sea responsable de lo que ocurrió ni merecedor del desproporcionado castigo que el fiscal solicita

Richi y su familia quieren evitar un juicio que podría acarrearle como poco antecedentes penales. Los abogados de la familia están negociando un posible acuerdo, con una compensación aproximada para el demandante de 6.000 euros.

Desde el club queremos apoyar una colecta espontánea organizada por los compañeros de Richi en el primer equipo, a la que os pedimos que, en función de vuestras posibilidades, os suméis.

Cualquier aportación es bienvenida y será útil.

Gracias a todos por vuestra ayuda,


Álvaro Ruiz del Real y Guillermo G de Polavieja 

Capitán y Presidente del CD Arquitectura de Madrid

story:
Fiction Writers' Group has been a supportive online community for writers since 2007, and nobody is more supportive of fellow writers than our luminous admin, Tokyo Shorty.

Indiegogo asked how you will know your contribution will make a difference. If you’re a FWG member, Tokyo has already made a difference to you.

She is always beta-reading, editing, compiling articles and anthologies, and she’s behind our swanky graphics.

This money will replace her old computer with one she needs to continue her own writing and her activity with FWG. Our goal is $3500. Any amount raised will go toward her purchase.

After all she’s done for us – from sharing calls for submissions to video tutorials – give a little sugar and help her keep going.

Arigatou gozaimasu!
